118 /*
119  * Message id in the set MSGCAT_SET_IO
120  * in the message catalog MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID (file cubrid.msg).
121  */
122 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_STARTS 1
123 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_NEEDED 2
124 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR 3
125 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_MAGICID 4
126 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_RELEASES 5
127 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_DBINFO 6
128 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_LEVEL 7
129 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_TIME 8
130 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_FILE 9
131 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_REST_RELO_NEEDED 10
132 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_REST_RELO_OPTIONS 11
133 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_NEWLOCATION 12
134 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_INPUT_RANGE_ERROR 13
135 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_INCORRECT_BKVOLUME 14
136 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_LEVEL_MISMATCH 15
137 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_MAGIC_MISMATCH 16
138 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_DB_MISMATCH 17
139 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_UNIT_NUM_MISMATCH 18
140 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BACKUP_TIME_MISMATCH 19
141 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BACKUP_VINF_ERROR 20
142 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BACKUP_LABEL_INFO 21
143 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_LX_LSA 22
144 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_RESTORE_FIND_REASON 23
145 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_FIND_REASON 24
146 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_PREV_BKVOL 25
147 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_NEXT_BKVOL 26
148 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_BKUP_PAGESIZE 27
149 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_ZIP_INFO 28
150 #define MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_INC_ACTIVELOG 29
151 
152 #ifdef L_cuserid
153 #define FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE L_cuserid
154 #else /* L_cuserid */
155 #define FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE 9
156 #endif /* L_cuserid */
157 
158 #if defined(WINDOWS)
159 #define GETPID() GetCurrentProcessId()
160 #else /* WINDOWS */
161 #define GETPID() getpid()
162 #endif /* WINDOWS */
163 
164 #define FILEIO_DISK_FORMAT_MODE (O_RDWR | O_CREAT)
165 #define FILEIO_DISK_PROTECTION_MODE 0600
166 #define FILEIO_MAX_WAIT_DBTXT 300
167 #define FILEIO_FULL_LEVEL_EXP 32
168 
169 /*
170  * Define a fixed size for backup and restore input/output of the volume
171  * headers. For most modern devices multiples of 512 or 1024 are needed.
172  * A size of the header data is computed in compile.
173  */
174 #define GET_NEXT_1K_SIZE(s) (((((s) - 1) / 1024) + 1) * 1024)
175 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER_IO_SIZE GET_NEXT_1K_SIZE(sizeof(FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER))
176 #define FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE(pagesize, npages) \
177  (((off_t)(pagesize)) * ((off_t)(npages)))
178 
179 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_NO_ZIP_HEADER_VERSION 1
180 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_CURRENT_HEADER_VERSION 2
181 #define FILEIO_CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPT_INTERVAL 100
182 
183 #define FILEIO_PAGE_SIZE_FULL_LEVEL (IO_PAGESIZE * FILEIO_FULL_LEVEL_EXP)
184 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE_OVERHEAD \
185  (offsetof(FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage) + sizeof(PAGEID))
186 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_DBVOLS_IO_PAGE_SIZE \
187  (IO_PAGESIZE + FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE_OVERHEAD)
188 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_DBVOLS_IO_PAGE_SIZE_FULL_LEVEL \
189  (FILEIO_PAGE_SIZE_FULL_LEVEL + FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE_OVERHEAD)
190 
191 #define FILEIO_RESTORE_DBVOLS_IO_PAGE_SIZE(sess) \
192  ((sess)->bkup.bkuphdr->bkpagesize + FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE_OVERHEAD)
193 
194 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER_PAGE_SIZE \
195  (sizeof(FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER) + offsetof(FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage))
196 
197 /* Set just the redundant copy of the pageid to the given page. */
198 #define FILEIO_SET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID_COPY(area, pageid, psize) \
199  *(PAGEID *)(((char *)(area)) + \
200  (offsetof(FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage) + psize)) = pageid
201 
202 /* Set the backup page pageid(s) */
203 #define FILEIO_SET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID(area, pageid, psize) \
204  do { \
205  ((FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *)(area))->iopageid = pageid; \
206  /* set the redundant copy of the pageid, alignment is important */ \
207  FILEIO_SET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID_COPY(area, pageid, psize); \
208  } while (false);
209 
210 /* Get the backup page primary pageid */
211 #define FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID(area) (((FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *)(area))->iopageid)
212 
213 /*
214  * Verify the integrity of the page just read by checking the redundant
215  * copy of the pageid. Remember that the ->iopageid_copy cannot be accessed
216  * directly and must be retrieved by pointer offset. If the two pageid's
217  * do not match it is probably a corrupted page.
218  */
219 #define FILEIO_CHECK_RESTORE_PAGE_ID(area, pagesz) \
220  (((FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *)(area))->iopageid == \
221  *(PAGEID *)(((char *)(area)) + offsetof(FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage) + pagesz))
222 
223 /* Define minimum number of pages required for a backup volume
224  For now, specify at least 4 pages plus the header. */
225 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_MINIMUM_NUM_PAGES \
226  CEIL_PTVDIV((FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER_IO_SIZE + \
227  (FILEIO_BACKUP_DBVOLS_IO_PAGE_SIZE) * 4), IO_PAGESIZE)
228 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_MINIMUM_NUM_PAGES_FULL_LEVEL \
229  CEIL_PTVDIV((FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER_IO_SIZE + \
230  (FILEIO_BACKUP_DBVOLS_IO_PAGE_SIZE_FULL_LEVEL) * 4), IO_PAGESIZE)
231 
232 #define FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE(rtn) \
233  do { \
234  if (fileio_Vol_info_header.volinfo == NULL \
235  && fileio_initialize_volume_info_cache () < 0) \
236  return (rtn); \
237  } while (0)
238 
239 /* Some specifications of page identifiers of backup */
240 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_START_PAGE_ID (-2)
241 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_END_PAGE_ID (-3)
242 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_START_PAGE_ID (-4)
243 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_END_PAGE_ID (-5)
244 #define FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_CONT_PAGE_ID (-6)
245 
246 #define FILEIO_END_OF_FILE (1)
247 
248 /* Minimum flush rate 40MB/s */
249 #define FILEIO_MIN_FLUSH_PAGES_PER_SEC (41943040 / IO_PAGESIZE)
250 /* TODO: Growth/drop flush rate values can be tweaked. They have been set to
251  * meet the needs of stressful workload. They have been set to drop slowly and
252  * grow back quickly.
253  * Please consider that token consumption depend on two factors:
254  * 1. System IO capabilities.
255  * 2. Flush thinking time.
256  * If flush thinking time prevents it from consuming tokens, we might reduce
257  * the numbers of token for next iterations unwillingly. A fast drop rate and
258  * slow growth rate can make it impossible to recover from a "missed"
259  * iteration (e.g. flush has been blocked on AIN list mutex).
260  */
261 /* Rate of growing flush rate when tokens are consumed. */
262 #define FILEIO_PAGE_FLUSH_GROW_RATE 0.5
263 /* Rate of reducing flush rate when tokens are not consumed. */
264 #define FILEIO_PAGE_FLUSH_DROP_RATE 0.1
265 
266 #if defined(WINDOWS)
267 #define fileio_lock_file_write(fd, offset, whence, len) \
268  fileio_lock_region(fd, F_TLOCK, offset, len)
269 #define fileio_lock_file_writew(fd, offset, whence, len) \
270  fileio_lock_region(fd, F_LOCK, offset, len)
271 #define fileio_lock_file_read(fd, offset, whence, len) \
272  fileio_lock_region(fd, F_TLOCK, offset, len)
273 #define fileio_lock_file_readw(fd, offset, whence, len) \
274  fileio_lock_region(fd, F_LOCK, offset, len)
275 #define fileio_unlock_file(fd, offset, whence, len) \
276  fileio_lock_region(fd, F_ULOCK, offset, len)
277 #else /* WINDOWS */
278 #define fileio_lock_file_read(fd, offset, whence, len) \
279  fileio_lock_region(fd, F_SETLK, F_RDLCK, offset, whence, len)
280 #define fileio_lock_file_readw(fd, offset, whence, len) \
281  fileio_lock_region(fd, F_SETLKW, F_RDLCK, offset, whence, len)
282 #define fileio_lock_file_write(fd, offset, whence, len) \
283  fileio_lock_region(fd, F_SETLK, F_WRLCK, offset, whence, len)
284 #define fileio_lock_file_writew(fd, offset, whence, len) \
285  fileio_lock_region(fd, F_SETLKW, F_WRLCK, offset, whence, len)
286 #define fileio_unlock_file(fd, offset, whence, len) \
287  fileio_lock_region(fd, F_SETLK, F_UNLCK, offset, whence, len)
288 #endif /* WINDOWS */
289 
290 #define FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT 32
291 
292 #if !defined(SERVER_MODE)
293 #define pthread_mutex_init(a, b)
294 #define pthread_mutex_destroy(a)
295 #define pthread_mutex_lock(a) 0
296 #define pthread_mutex_unlock(a)
297 static int rv;
298 #endif
299 
300 /* User input states when requesting relocation of a (backup) volume. */
301 typedef enum
302 {
303  FILEIO_RELOCATION_FIRST = 0,
304  FILEIO_RELOCATION_QUIT = FILEIO_RELOCATION_FIRST,
305  FILEIO_RELOCATION_RETRY,
306  FILEIO_RELOCATION_ALTERNATE,
307  FILEIO_RELOCATION_LAST = FILEIO_RELOCATION_ALTERNATE
308 } FILEIO_RELOCATION_VOLUME;
309 
310 typedef struct fileio_backup_file_header FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER;
311 typedef struct fileio_bkvinf_entry FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY;
312 typedef struct fileio_bkvinf_queues FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_QUEUE;
313 typedef struct fileio_sys_volinfo FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO;
314 typedef struct fileio_sys_volinfo_header FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_HEADER;
315 typedef struct fileio_volinfo FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO;
316 typedef struct fileio_volinfo_header FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER;
317 
318 /* A FILE/VOLUME HEADER IN BACKUP */
319 struct fileio_backup_file_header
320 {
321  INT64 nbytes;
322  VOLID volid;
323  short dummy1; /* Dummy field for 8byte align */
324  int dummy2; /* Dummy field for 8byte align */
325  char vlabel[PATH_MAX];
326 };
327 
328 /* Some specifications for bkvinf data */
329 
330 /* Each one of these represents a given backup volume unit */
331 struct fileio_bkvinf_entry
332 {
333  int unit_num;
334  char bkvol_name[PATH_MAX];
335  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY *link;
336 };
337 
338 /* Master data structure to retain information about each backup level */
339 struct fileio_bkvinf_queues
340 {
341  bool initialized;
342  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY *anchors[FILEIO_BACKUP_UNDEFINED_LEVEL];
343  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY *free;
344 };
345 
346 /* Volume information structure for system volumes(volid < NULL_VOLID) */
347 struct fileio_sys_volinfo
348 {
349  VOLID volid;
350  int vdes;
351  FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE lockf_type;
352  char vlabel[PATH_MAX];
353 #if defined(SERVER_MODE) && defined(WINDOWS)
354  pthread_mutex_t sysvol_mutex;
355 #endif /* SERVER_MODE && WINDOWS */
356  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *next;
357 };
358 
359 /* System volume informations are linked as a list */
360 struct fileio_sys_volinfo_header
361 {
362 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
363  pthread_mutex_t mutex;
364 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
365  int num_vols;
366  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO anchor;
367 };
368 
369 /* Volume information structure for perm/temp volumes */
370 struct fileio_volinfo
371 {
372  VOLID volid;
373  int vdes;
374  FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE lockf_type;
375 #if defined(SERVER_MODE) && defined(WINDOWS)
376  pthread_mutex_t vol_mutex; /* for fileio_read()/fileio_write() */
377 #endif /* SERVER_MODE && WINDOWS */
378  char vlabel[PATH_MAX];
379 };
380 
381 typedef union fileio_apply_function_arg
382 {
383  int vol_id;
384  int vdes;
385  const char *vol_label;
386 } APPLY_ARG;
387 
388 /* Perm/temp volume informations are stored on array.
389  * Direct access by volid is possible */
390 struct fileio_volinfo_header
391 {
392 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
393  pthread_mutex_t mutex;
394 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
395  int max_perm_vols; /* # of max. io_volinfo entries for perm. vol */
396  int next_perm_volid; /* # of used io_volinfo entries for perm. vol */
397  int max_temp_vols; /* # of max. io_volinfo entries for temp. vol */
398  int next_temp_volid; /* # of used io_volinfo entries for temp. vol */
399  /* if volid of volume is equal to this value, */
400  /* it is temp. volume */
401  int num_volinfo_array; /* # of io_volinfo entry chunks */
402  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO **volinfo; /* array of pointer for io_volinfo chunks */
403 };
404 
405 typedef bool (*VOLINFO_APPLY_FN) (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg);
406 typedef bool (*SYS_VOLINFO_APPLY_FN) (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO * sys_vol_info_p,
407  APPLY_ARG * arg);
408 
409 static FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_HEADER fileio_Sys_vol_info_header = {
410 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
411  PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER,
412 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
413  0,
414  {
415  NULL_VOLID, NULL_VOLDES, FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF, "",
416 #if defined(SERVER_MODE) && defined(WINDOWS)
417  PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER,
418 #endif /* SERVER_MODE && WINDOWS */
419  NULL}
420 };
421 
422 static FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER fileio_Vol_info_header = {
423 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
424  PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER,
425 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
426  0, 0, 0, LOG_MAX_DBVOLID, 0, NULL
427 };
428 
429 /* Records information from the bkvinf file about backup volumes */
430 static FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_QUEUE fileio_Backup_vol_info_data[2] =
431  { {false, {NULL, NULL, NULL}, NULL}, {false, {NULL, NULL, NULL}, NULL} };
432 
433 /* Flush Control */
434 #if !defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
435 static pthread_mutex_t fileio_Flushed_page_counter_mutex = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
436 #endif
437 static int fileio_Flushed_page_count = 0;

439 static TOKEN_BUCKET fc_Token_bucket_s;
440 static TOKEN_BUCKET *fc_Token_bucket = NULL;
441 static FLUSH_STATS fc_Stats;
442 
443 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
444 /* Set this to get various levels of io information regarding
445  * backup and restore activity.
446  * 0 :: no output
447  * 1 :: print names and sizes of volumes that are backed-up.
448  * 2 :: dump page bitmaps after volume is restored.
449  */
450 static int io_Bkuptrace_debug = -1;
451 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */

459  bool dolock, bool dosync);
460 static int fileio_create_backup_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_fullname, const char *vlabel,
461  VOLID volid, bool dolock, bool dosync, int atleast_pages);
462 static void fileio_dismount_without_fsync (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vdes);
463 static int fileio_max_permanent_volumes (int index, int num_permanent_volums);
464 static int fileio_min_temporary_volumes (int index, int num_temp_volums, int num_volinfo_array);
465 static FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *fileio_traverse_system_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p,
466  SYS_VOLINFO_APPLY_FN apply_function, APPLY_ARG * arg);
467 static FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLINFO_APPLY_FN apply_function,
468  APPLY_ARG * arg);
469 static FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *fileio_reverse_traverse_permanent_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p,
470  VOLINFO_APPLY_FN apply_function, APPLY_ARG * arg);
471 static FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *fileio_traverse_temporary_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLINFO_APPLY_FN apply_function,
472  APPLY_ARG * arg);

474  VOLINFO_APPLY_FN apply_function, APPLY_ARG * arg);

476 static bool fileio_dismount_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * ignore_arg);
477 static bool fileio_is_volume_descriptor_equal (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p,
478  APPLY_ARG * arg);
479 static bool fileio_is_volume_id_gt (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg);
480 static bool fileio_is_volume_id_lt (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg);
481 static FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *fileio_find_system_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p,
482  SYS_VOLINFO_APPLY_FN apply_function, APPLY_ARG * arg);
483 static bool fileio_is_system_volume_descriptor_equal (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p,
484  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO * sys_vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg);
485 static bool fileio_is_system_volume_id_equal (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO * sys_vol_info_p,
486  APPLY_ARG * arg);
487 static bool fileio_is_system_volume_label_equal (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO * sys_vol_info_p,
488  APPLY_ARG * arg);
489 static bool fileio_synchronize_sys_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO * vol_sys_info_p,
490  APPLY_ARG * arg);
491 static bool fileio_synchronize_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg);
492 static int fileio_cache (VOLID volid, const char *vlabel, int vdes, FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE lockf_type);
493 static void fileio_decache (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vdes);
494 static VOLID fileio_get_volume_id (int vdes);
495 static bool fileio_is_volume_label_equal (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg);
496 static int fileio_expand_permanent_volume_info (FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER * header, int volid);
497 static int fileio_expand_temporary_volume_info (FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER * header, int volid);
498 static bool fileio_is_terminated_process (int pid);
499 
500 static ssize_t fileio_os_read (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, void *io_page_p, size_t count, off_t offset);
501 static ssize_t fileio_os_write (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, void *io_page_p, size_t count, off_t offset);
502 #if !defined (WINDOWS)
503 static ssize_t pwrite_with_injected_fault (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int fd, const void *buf, size_t count,
504  off_t offset);
505 #endif
506 
507 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
508 static FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE fileio_lock (const char *db_fullname, const char *vlabel, int vdes, bool dowait);
509 static void fileio_unlock (const char *vlabel, int vdes, FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE lockf_type);
510 static FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE fileio_get_lockf_type (int vdes);
511 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
512 
513 static int fileio_get_primitive_way_max (const char *path, long int *filename_max, long int *pathname_max);
514 static int fileio_flush_backup (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session);
515 static ssize_t fileio_read_backup (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session, int pageid);
516 static int fileio_write_backup (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session, ssize_t towrite_nbytes);
517 static int fileio_write_backup_header (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session);
518 
519 static FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION *fileio_initialize_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_fullname,
520  char *backup_src, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session,
521  FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level,
522  const char *restore_verbose_file_path, bool newvolpath);
523 static int fileio_read_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session, int toread_nbytes);
524 static void *fileio_write_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP * page_bitmap, int vdes,
525  void *io_pgptr, VOLID vol_id, PAGEID page_id, FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level);
526 static int fileio_read_restore_header (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session);
527 static FILEIO_RELOCATION_VOLUME fileio_find_restore_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *dbname,
528  char *to_volname, int unit_num, FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level,
529  int reason);
530 
531 static int fileio_get_next_backup_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session, bool user_new);
532 static int fileio_initialize_backup_info (int which_bkvinf);
533 static FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY *fileio_allocate_backup_info (int which_bkvinf);
534 
535 static FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION *fileio_continue_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_fullname,
536  INT64 db_creation, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session,
537  bool first_time, bool authenticate, INT64 match_bkupcreation);
538 static int fileio_fill_hole_during_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int *next_pageid, int stop_pageid,
539  FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session, FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP * page_bitmap);
540 static int fileio_decompress_restore_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session, int nbytes);
541 static FILEIO_NODE *fileio_allocate_node (FILEIO_QUEUE * qp, FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER * backup_hdr);
542 static FILEIO_NODE *fileio_free_node (FILEIO_QUEUE * qp, FILEIO_NODE * node);
543 static FILEIO_NODE *fileio_delete_queue_head (FILEIO_QUEUE * qp);
544 static int fileio_compress_backup_node (FILEIO_NODE * node, FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER * backup_hdr);
545 static int fileio_write_backup_node (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session, FILEIO_NODE * node,
546  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER * backup_hdr);
547 static char *fileio_ctime (INT64 * clock, char *buf);
548 static const char *fileio_get_backup_level_string (FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level);
549 
550 static int fileio_initialize_backup_thread (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, int num_threads);
551 static void fileio_finalize_backup_thread (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, FILEIO_ZIP_METHOD zip_method);
552 static int fileio_write_backup_end_time_to_header (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, INT64 end_time);
553 static void fileio_write_backup_end_time_to_last_page (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, INT64 end_time);
554 static void fileio_read_backup_end_time_from_last_page (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p);
555 
556 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
557 static int fileio_get_lock (int fd, const char *vlabel);
558 static int fileio_release_lock (int fd);
559 static int fileio_lock_region (int fd, int cmd, int type, off_t offset, int whence, off_t len);
560 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
561 
562 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
563 static void fileio_read_backup_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session);
564 static FILEIO_TYPE fileio_write_backup_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session);
565 static FILEIO_NODE *fileio_append_queue (FILEIO_QUEUE * qp, FILEIO_NODE * node);
566 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
567 
568 static void fileio_compensate_flush (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int fd, int npage);
569 static int fileio_increase_flushed_page_count (int npages);
570 static int fileio_flush_control_get_token (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int ntoken);
571 static int fileio_flush_control_get_desired_rate (TOKEN_BUCKET * tb);
572 static int fileio_synchronize_bg_archive_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p);
573 
574 static void fileio_page_bitmap_set (FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP * page_bitmap, int page_id);
575 static bool fileio_page_bitmap_is_set (FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP * page_bitmap, int page_id);
576 static void fileio_page_bitmap_dump (FILE * out_fp, const FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP * page_bitmap);
577 
578 static int
579 fileio_increase_flushed_page_count (int npages)
580 {
581  int flushed_page_count;
582 
583 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
584  flushed_page_count = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&fileio_Flushed_page_count, npages);
585 #else
586  (void) pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Flushed_page_counter_mutex);
587  fileio_Flushed_page_count += npages;
588  flushed_page_count = fileio_Flushed_page_count;
589  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Flushed_page_counter_mutex);
590 #endif /* HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS */
591 
592  return flushed_page_count;
593 }
594 
595 static void
596 fileio_compensate_flush (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int fd, int npage)
597 {
598 #if !defined(SERVER_MODE)
599  return;
600 #else
601  int rv;
602  bool need_sync;
603  int flushed_page_count;
604 
605  assert (npage > 0);
606 
607  if (npage <= 0)
608  {
609  return;
610  }
611 
612  if (thread_p == NULL)
613  {
614  thread_p = thread_get_thread_entry_info ();
615  }
616 
617  rv = fileio_flush_control_get_token (thread_p, npage);
618  if (rv != NO_ERROR)
619  {
620  return;
621  }
622 
623  need_sync = false;
624 
625  flushed_page_count = fileio_increase_flushed_page_count (npage);
626  if (flushed_page_count > prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_PB_SYNC_ON_NFLUSH))
627  {
628  need_sync = true;
629  fileio_Flushed_page_count = 0;
630  }
631 
632  if (need_sync)
633  {
634  fileio_synchronize_all (thread_p, false);
635  }
636 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
637 }
638 
639 /*
640  * fileio_flush_control_initialize():
641  *
642  * returns:
643  *
644  * Note:
645  */
646 int
647 fileio_flush_control_initialize (void)
648 {
649 #if !defined(SERVER_MODE)
650  return NO_ERROR;
651 #else
652  TOKEN_BUCKET *tb;
653  int rv = NO_ERROR;
654 
655  assert (fc_Token_bucket == NULL);
656  tb = &fc_Token_bucket_s;
657 
658  rv = pthread_mutex_init (&tb->token_mutex, NULL);
659  if (rv != NO_ERROR)
660  {
661  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_PTHREAD_MUTEX_INIT, 0);
662  return ER_CSS_PTHREAD_MUTEX_INIT;
663  }
664  tb->tokens = 0;
665  tb->token_consumed = 0;
666 
667  rv = pthread_cond_init (&tb->waiter_cond, NULL);
668  if (rv != 0)
669  {
670  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_PTHREAD_COND_INIT, 0);
671  return ER_CSS_PTHREAD_COND_INIT;
672  }
673 
674  fc_Stats.num_tokens = 0;
675  fc_Stats.num_log_pages = 0;
676  fc_Stats.num_pages = 0;
677 
678  fc_Token_bucket = tb;
679  return rv;
680 #endif
681 }
682 
683 /*
684  * fileio_flush_control_finalize():
685  *
686  * returns:
687  *
688  * Note:
689  */
690 void
691 fileio_flush_control_finalize (void)
692 {
693 #if !defined(SERVER_MODE)
694  return;
695 #else
696  TOKEN_BUCKET *tb;
697 
698  assert (fc_Token_bucket != NULL);
699  if (fc_Token_bucket == NULL)
700  {
701  return;
702  }
703 
704  tb = fc_Token_bucket;
705  fc_Token_bucket = NULL;
706 
707  (void) pthread_mutex_destroy (&tb->token_mutex);
708  (void) pthread_cond_destroy (&tb->waiter_cond);
709 #endif
710 }
711 
712 /*
713  * fileio_flush_control_get_token():
714  *
715  * returns:
716  *
717  * Note:
718  */
719 static int
720 fileio_flush_control_get_token (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int ntoken)
721 {
722 #if !defined(SERVER_MODE)
723  return NO_ERROR;
724 #else
725  TOKEN_BUCKET *tb = fc_Token_bucket;
726  int rv = NO_ERROR;
727  int retry_count = 0;
728  int nreq;
729  bool log_cs_own = false;
730 
731  PERF_UTIME_TRACKER time_tracker = PERF_UTIME_TRACKER_INITIALIZER;
732 
733  if (tb == NULL)
734  {
735  return NO_ERROR;
736  }
737 
738  assert (ntoken > 0);
739 
740  if (LOG_CS_OWN (thread_p))
741  {
742  log_cs_own = true;
743  }
744 
745  nreq = ntoken;
746  while (nreq > 0 && retry_count < 10)
747  {
748  /* try to get a token from share tokens */
749  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tb->token_mutex);
750  assert (rv == NO_ERROR);
751 
752  if (log_cs_own == true)
753  {
754  fc_Stats.num_log_pages += nreq;
755  }
756  else
757  {
758  fc_Stats.num_pages += nreq;
759  }
760 
761  if (tb->tokens >= nreq)
762  {
763  tb->tokens -= nreq;
764  tb->token_consumed += nreq;
765  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tb->token_mutex);
766  return NO_ERROR;
767  }
768  else if (tb->tokens > 0)
769  {
770  nreq -= tb->tokens;
771  tb->token_consumed += tb->tokens;
772  tb->tokens = 0;
773  }
774 
775  assert (nreq > 0);
776 
777  if (log_cs_own == true)
778  {
779  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tb->token_mutex);
780  return NO_ERROR;
781  }
782 
783  PERF_UTIME_TRACKER_START (thread_p, &time_tracker);
784 
785  /* Wait for signal */
786  rv = pthread_cond_wait (&tb->waiter_cond, &tb->token_mutex);
787 
788  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tb->token_mutex);
789  retry_count++;
790 
791  PERF_UTIME_TRACKER_BULK_TIME (thread_p, &time_tracker, PSTAT_PB_COMPENSATE_FLUSH, nreq);
792  }
793 
794  /* I am very very unlucky (unlikely to happen) */
795  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "Failed to get token within %d trial (req=%d, remained=%d)", retry_count, ntoken, nreq);
796  return NO_ERROR;
797 #endif
798 }
799 
800 /*
801  * fileio_flush_control_add_tokens():
802  *
803  * returns:
804  *
805  * Note:
806  */
807 int
808 fileio_flush_control_add_tokens (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, INT64 diff_usec, int *token_gen, int *token_consumed)
809 {
810 #if !defined(SERVER_MODE)
811  return NO_ERROR;
812 #else
813  TOKEN_BUCKET *tb = fc_Token_bucket;
814  int gen_tokens;
815  int rv = NO_ERROR;
816 
817  assert (token_gen != NULL);
818 
819  if (tb == NULL)
820  {
821  return NO_ERROR;
822  }
823 
824  /* add remaining tokens to shared tokens */
825  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&tb->token_mutex);
826 
827  *token_consumed = tb->token_consumed;
828  tb->token_consumed = 0;
829 
830  perfmon_add_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_FC_NUM_PAGES, fc_Stats.num_pages);
831  perfmon_add_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_FC_NUM_LOG_PAGES, fc_Stats.num_log_pages);
832  perfmon_add_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_FC_TOKENS, fc_Stats.num_tokens);
833 
834 
835  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_ADAPTIVE_FLUSH_CONTROL) == true)
836  {
837  /* Get desired rate from evaluating changes in last iteration. */
838  gen_tokens = fileio_flush_control_get_desired_rate (tb);
839  /* Check new rate is not below minimum required. */
840  gen_tokens = (int) MAX (gen_tokens, (double) FILEIO_MIN_FLUSH_PAGES_PER_SEC * (double) diff_usec / 1000000.0);
841  }
842  else
843  {
844  /* Always set maximum rate. */
845  gen_tokens = (int) (prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MAX_FLUSH_PAGES_PER_SECOND) * (double) diff_usec / 1000000.0);
846  }
847 
848  *token_gen = gen_tokens;
849 
850  /* initialization statistics */
851  fc_Stats.num_pages = 0;
852  fc_Stats.num_log_pages = 0;
853  fc_Stats.num_tokens = gen_tokens;
854 
855  tb->tokens = gen_tokens;
856 
857  /* signal to waiters */
858  pthread_cond_broadcast (&tb->waiter_cond);
859  pthread_mutex_unlock (&tb->token_mutex);
860  return rv;
861 
862 #endif
863 }
864 
865 /*
866  * fileio_flush_control_get_desired_rate () -
867  *
868  */
869 static int
870 fileio_flush_control_get_desired_rate (TOKEN_BUCKET * tb)
871 {
872 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
873  return 0;
874 #else
875  int dirty_rate = pgbuf_flush_control_from_dirty_ratio ();
876  int adjust_rate = fc_Stats.num_tokens; /* Start with previous rate. */
877 
878  if (tb->tokens > 0)
879  {
880  if (dirty_rate > 0)
881  {
882  /* This is difficult situation. We did not consume all tokens but dirty rate goes up. Let's keep the number
883  * of tokens until dirty rate is no longer an issue. */
884  }
885  else
886  {
887  /* Do not drop the tokens too fast. If for any reason flush has been completely stopped, tokens drop to
888  * minimum directly. */
889  adjust_rate -= (int) (tb->tokens * FILEIO_PAGE_FLUSH_DROP_RATE);
890  }
891  }
892  else
893  {
894  /* We need to increase the rate. */
895  adjust_rate += MAX (dirty_rate, (int) (fc_Stats.num_tokens * FILEIO_PAGE_FLUSH_GROW_RATE));
896  }
897  return adjust_rate;
898 #endif
899 }
900 
901 /*
902  * fileio_initialize_volume_info_cache () - Allocate/initialize
903  * volinfo_header.volinfo array
904  * return: 0 if success, or -1
905  *
906  * Note: This function is usually first called by
907  * fileio_find_volume_descriptor_with_label()(normal startup,
908  * backup/restore etc.) or fileio_mount()(database creation time)
909  */
910 static int
911 fileio_initialize_volume_info_cache (void)
912 {
913  int i, n;
914  int rv;
915 
916  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Vol_info_header.mutex);
917 
918  if (fileio_Vol_info_header.volinfo == NULL)
919  {
920  n = (VOLID_MAX - 1) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT + 1;
921  fileio_Vol_info_header.volinfo = (FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO **) malloc (sizeof (FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *) * n);
922  if (fileio_Vol_info_header.volinfo == NULL)
923  {
924  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, sizeof (FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *) * n);
925  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Vol_info_header.mutex);
926  return -1;
927  }
928  fileio_Vol_info_header.num_volinfo_array = n;
929 
930  for (i = 0; i < fileio_Vol_info_header.num_volinfo_array; i++)
931  {
932  fileio_Vol_info_header.volinfo[i] = NULL;
933  }
934  }
935 
936  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Vol_info_header.mutex);
937  return 0;
938 }
939 
940 /* TODO: check not use */
941 #if 0
942 /*
943  * fileio_final_volinfo_cache () - Free volinfo_header.volinfo array
944  * return: void
945  */
946 void
947 fileio_final_volinfo_cache (void)
948 {
949  int i;
950 #if defined(WINDOWS) && defined(SERVER_MODE)
951  int j;
952  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vf;
953 #endif /* WINDOWS && SERVER_MODE */
954  if (fileio_Vol_info_header.volinfo != NULL)
955  {
956  for (i = 0; i < fileio_Vol_info_header.num_volinfo_array; i++)
957  {
958 #if defined(WINDOWS) && defined(SERVER_MODE)
959  vf = fileio_Vol_info_header.volinfo[i];
960  for (j = 0; j < FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT; j++)
961  {
962  if (vf[j].vol_mutex != NULL)
963  {
964  pthread_mutex_destroy (&vf[j].vol_mutex);
965  }
966  }
967 #endif /* WINDOWS && SERVER_MODE */
968  free_and_init (fileio_Vol_info_header.volinfo[i]);
969  }
970  free_and_init (fileio_Vol_info_header.volinfo);
971  fileio_Vol_info_header.num_volinfo_array = 0;
972  }
973 }
974 #endif
975 
976 static int
977 fileio_allocate_and_initialize_volume_info (FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER * header_p, int idx)
978 {
979  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
980  int i;
981 
982  header_p->volinfo[idx] = NULL;
983  vol_info_p = (FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *) malloc (sizeof (FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO) * FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT);
984  if (vol_info_p == NULL)
985  {
986  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1,
987  sizeof (FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO) * FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT);
988  return ER_FAILED;
989  }
990 
991  for (i = 0; i < FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT; i++)
992  {
993  vol_info_p[i].volid = NULL_VOLID;
994  vol_info_p[i].vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
995  vol_info_p[i].lockf_type = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
996  vol_info_p[i].vlabel[0] = '\0';
997 #if defined(WINDOWS)
998  pthread_mutex_init (&vol_info_p[i].vol_mutex, NULL);
999 #endif /* WINDOWS */
1000  }
1001 
1002  header_p->volinfo[idx] = vol_info_p;
1003  return NO_ERROR;
1004 }
1005 
1006 /*
1007  * fileio_expand_permanent_volume_info () - Expand io_volinfo chunks to cache
1008  * volid volume information
1009  * return: 0 if success, or -1
1010  * header(in):
1011  * volid(in):
1012  *
1013  * Note: Permanent volume informations are stored from volid 0 to
1014  * header->max_perm_vols. If header->max_perm_vols is less than volid,
1015  * allocate new io_volinfo chunk.
1016  */
1017 static int
1018 fileio_expand_permanent_volume_info (FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER * header_p, int volid)
1019 {
1020  int from_idx, to_idx;
1021  int rv;
1022 
1023  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&header_p->mutex);
1024 
1025  from_idx = (header_p->max_perm_vols / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT);
1026  to_idx = (volid + 1) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
1027 
1028  /* check if to_idx chunks are used for temp volume information */
1029  if (to_idx >= (header_p->num_volinfo_array - 1 - header_p->max_temp_vols / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT))
1030  {
1031  pthread_mutex_unlock (&header_p->mutex);
1032  return -1;
1033  }
1034 
1035  for (; from_idx <= to_idx; from_idx++)
1036  {
1037  if (fileio_allocate_and_initialize_volume_info (header_p, from_idx) != NO_ERROR)
1038  {
1039  pthread_mutex_unlock (&header_p->mutex);
1040  return -1;
1041  }
1042 
1043  header_p->max_perm_vols = (from_idx + 1) * FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
1044  }
1045 
1046  pthread_mutex_unlock (&header_p->mutex);
1047  return 0;
1048 }
1049 
1050 /*
1051  * fileio_expand_temporary_volume_info () - Expand io_volinfo chunks to cache
1052  * volid volume information
1053  * return: 0 if success, or -1
1054  * header(in):
1055  * volid(in):
1056  *
1057  * Note: Temporary volume informations are stored from volid LOG_MAX_DBVOLID to
1058  * LOG_MAX_DBVOLID-header->max_temp_vols.
1059  * If LOG_MAX_DBVOLID-header->max_temp_vols is greater than volid,
1060  * allocate new io_volinfo chunk.
1061  */
1062 static int
1063 fileio_expand_temporary_volume_info (FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER * header_p, int volid)
1064 {
1065  int from_idx, to_idx;
1066  int rv;
1067 
1068  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&header_p->mutex);
1069 
1070  from_idx = header_p->num_volinfo_array - 1 - (header_p->max_temp_vols / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT);
1071  to_idx = header_p->num_volinfo_array - 1 - ((LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - volid) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT);
1072 
1073  /* check if to_idx chunks are used for perm. volume information */
1074  if (to_idx <= (header_p->max_perm_vols - 1) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT)
1075  {
1076  pthread_mutex_unlock (&header_p->mutex);
1077  return -1;
1078  }
1079 
1080  for (; from_idx >= to_idx; from_idx--)
1081  {
1082  if (fileio_allocate_and_initialize_volume_info (header_p, from_idx) != NO_ERROR)
1083  {
1084  pthread_mutex_unlock (&header_p->mutex);
1085  return -1;
1086  }
1087 
1088  header_p->max_temp_vols = (header_p->num_volinfo_array - from_idx) * FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
1089  }
1090 
1091  pthread_mutex_unlock (&header_p->mutex);
1092  return 0;
1093 }
1094 
1095 /* TODO: recoding to use APR
1096  *
1097  * fileio_ctime() - VARIANT OF NORMAL CTIME THAT ALWAYS REMOVES THE NEWLINE
1098  * return: ptr to time string returned by ctime
1099  * time_t(in):
1100  * buf(in):
1101  *
1102  * Note: Strips the \n off the end of the string returned by ctime.
1103  * this routine is really general purpose, there may be other users
1104  * of ctime.
1105  */
1106 static char *
1107 fileio_ctime (INT64 * clock_p, char *buffer_p)
1108 {
1109  char *p, *t;
1110  time_t tmp_time;
1111 
1112  tmp_time = (time_t) (*clock_p);
1113  t = ctime_r (&tmp_time, buffer_p);
1114 
1115  p = strchr (t, '\n');
1116  if (p)
1117  {
1118  *p = '\0';
1119  }
1120 
1121  return (t);
1122 }
1123 
1124 /*
1125  * fileio_is_terminated_process () -
1126  * return:
1127  * pid(in):
1128  */
1129 static bool
1130 fileio_is_terminated_process (int pid)
1131 {
1132 #if defined(WINDOWS)
1133  HANDLE h_process;
1134 
1135  h_process = OpenProcess (PROCESS_QUERY_INFORMATION, FALSE, pid);
1136  if (h_process == NULL)
1137  {
1138  return true;
1139  }
1140  else
1141  {
1142  CloseHandle (h_process);
1143  return false;
1144  }
1145 #else /* WINDOWS */
1146  if (kill (pid, 0) == -1)
1147  {
1148  return true;
1149  }
1150  else
1151  {
1152  return false;
1153  }
1154 #endif /* WINDOWS */
1155 }
1156 
1157 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
1158 /*
1159  * fileio_lock () - LOCKF A DATABASE VOLUME
1160  * return:
1161  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database where the volume belongs
1162  * vlabel(in): Volume label
1163  * vdes(in): Volume descriptor
1164  * dowait(in): true when it is ok to wait for the lock (databases.txt)
1165  *
1166  */
1167 static FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE
1168 fileio_lock (const char *db_full_name_p, const char *vol_label_p, int vol_fd, bool dowait)
1169 {
1170  FILE *fp;
1171  char name_info_lock[PATH_MAX];
1172  char host[MAXHOSTNAMELEN];
1173  char host2[MAXHOSTNAMELEN];
1174  char user[FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE];
1175  char login_name[FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE];
1176  INT64 lock_time;
1177  long long tmp_lock_time;
1178  int pid;
1179  bool retry = true;
1180  int lockf_errno;
1181  FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE result = FILEIO_LOCKF;
1182  int total_num_loops = 0;
1183  int num_loops = 0;
1184  int max_num_loops;
1185  char io_timeval[CTIME_MAX], format_string[32];
1186 
1187  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_IO_LOCKF_ENABLE) != true)
1188  {
1189  return FILEIO_LOCKF;
1190  }
1191 
1192 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
1193  struct stat stbuf;
1194 
1195  /*
1196  * Make sure that advisory locks are used. An advisory lock is desired
1197  * since we are observing a voluntarily locking scheme.
1198  * Mandatory locks are know to be dangerous. If a runaway or otherwise
1199  * out-of-control process should hold a mandatory lock on the database
1200  * and fail to release that lock, the entire database system could hang
1201  */
1202  if (fstat (vol_fd, &stbuf) != -1)
1203  {
1204  if ((stbuf.st_mode & S_ISGID) != 0 && (stbuf.st_mode & S_IRWXG) != S_IXGRP)
1205  {
1206  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "A mandatory lock will be set on file = %s", vol_label_p);
1207  }
1208  }
1209 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
1210 
1211  if (vol_label_p == NULL)
1212  {
1213  vol_label_p = "";
1214  }
1215 
1216  max_num_loops = FILEIO_MAX_WAIT_DBTXT;
1217  fileio_make_volume_lock_name (name_info_lock, vol_label_p);
1218 
1219  /*
1220  * NOTE: The lockby auxiliary file is created only after we have acquired
1221  * the lock. This is important to avoid a possible synchronization
1222  * problem with this secundary technique
1223  */
1224 
1225  sprintf (format_string, "%%%ds %%d %%%ds %%lld", FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE - 1, MAXHOSTNAMELEN - 1);
1226 
1227 again:
1228  while (retry == true && fileio_lock_file_write (vol_fd, 0, SEEK_SET, 0) < 0)
1229  {
1230  if (errno == EINTR)
1231  {
1232  /* Retry if the an interruption was signed */
1233  retry = true;
1234  continue;
1235  }
1236  lockf_errno = errno;
1237  retry = false;
1238 
1239  /* Volume seems to be mounted by someone else. Find out who has it. */
1240  fp = fopen (name_info_lock, "r");
1241  if (fp == NULL)
1242  {
1243  (void) sleep (3);
1244  num_loops += 3;
1245  total_num_loops += 3;
1246  fp = fopen (name_info_lock, "r");
1247  if (fp == NULL && num_loops <= 3)
1248  {
1249  /*
1250  * Note that we try to check for the lock only one more time,
1251  * unless we have been waiting for a while
1252  * (Case of dowait == false,
1253  * note that num_loops is set to 0 when waiting for a lock).
1254  */
1255  retry = true;
1256  continue;
1257  }
1258  }
1259 
1260  if (fp == NULL || fscanf (fp, format_string, user, &pid, host, &tmp_lock_time) != 4)
1261  {
1262  strcpy (user, "???");
1263  strcpy (host, "???");
1264  pid = 0;
1265  lock_time = 0;
1266  }
1267  else
1268  {
1269  lock_time = tmp_lock_time;
1270  }
1271  /* Make sure that the process holding the lock is not a run away process. A run away process is one of the
1272  * following: 1) If the lockby file exist and the following is true: same user, same host, and lockby process
1273  * does not exist any longer */
1274  if (fp == NULL)
1275  {
1276  /* It is no more true that if the lockby file does not exist, then it is the run away process. When the user
1277  * cannot get the file lock, it means that the another process who owns the database exists. */
1278  fileio_ctime (&lock_time, io_timeval);
1279  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_LOCKED, 6, vol_label_p, db_full_name_p, user, pid, host,
1280  (lock_time == 0) ? "???" : io_timeval);
1281  return FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1282  }
1283  else
1284  {
1285  (void) fclose (fp);
1286  *host2 = '\0';
1287  cuserid ((char *) login_name);
1288 
1289  login_name[FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE - 1] = '\0';
1290 
1291  if (!
1292  (strcmp (user, login_name) == 0 && GETHOSTNAME (host2, MAXHOSTNAMELEN) == 0 && strcmp (host, host2) == 0
1293  && fileio_is_terminated_process (pid) != 0 && errno == ESRCH))
1294  {
1295  if (dowait != false)
1296  {
1297  /*
1298  * NOBODY USES dowait EXPECT DATABASE.TXT
1299  *
1300  * It would be nice if we could use a wait function to wait on a
1301  * process that is not a child process.
1302  * Wait until the process is gone if we are in the same machine,
1303  * otherwise, continue looping.
1304  */
1305  while (fileio_is_volume_exist (name_info_lock) == true && num_loops < 60
1306  && total_num_loops < max_num_loops)
1307  {
1308  if (strcmp (host, host2) == 0 && fileio_is_terminated_process (pid) != 0)
1309  {
1310  break;
1311  }
1312 
1313  (void) sleep (3);
1314  num_loops += 3;
1315  total_num_loops += 3;
1316  }
1317 
1318  if (total_num_loops < max_num_loops)
1319  {
1320  retry = true;
1321  num_loops = 0;
1322  goto again;
1323  }
1324  }
1325 
1326  /* not a run away process */
1327  fileio_ctime (&lock_time, io_timeval);
1328  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_LOCKED, 6, vol_label_p, db_full_name_p, user, pid,
1329  host, io_timeval);
1330  return FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1331  }
1332  }
1333 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
1334  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE,
1335  "io_lock: WARNING ignoring a run away lock on volume = %s\n. lockd deamon may not be"
1336  " working right.\n UNIX error = %s", vol_label_p, strerror (lockf_errno));
1337 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
1338  }
1339 
1340  /* Create the information lock file and write the information about the lock */
1341  fp = fopen (name_info_lock, "w");
1342  if (fp != NULL)
1343  {
1344  if (GETHOSTNAME (host, MAXHOSTNAMELEN) != 0)
1345  {
1346  strcpy (host, "???");
1347  }
1348 
1349  if (getuserid (login_name, FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE) == NULL)
1350  {
1351  strcpy (login_name, "???");
1352  }
1353 
1354  (void) fprintf (fp, "%s %d %s %ld", login_name, (int) GETPID (), host, time (NULL));
1355  (void) fclose (fp);
1356  }
1357  else
1358  {
1359  /* Unable to create the lockf file. */
1360  if (result == FILEIO_LOCKF)
1361  {
1362  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, name_info_lock);
1363  fileio_unlock (vol_label_p, vol_fd, result);
1364  result = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1365  }
1366  }
1367 
1368  return result;
1369 }
1370 
1371 /*
1372  * fileio_lock_la_log_path () - LOCKF A applylogdb logpath lock
1373  * return:
1374  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database where the volume belongs
1375  * lock_path(in): Lock file path
1376  * vdes(in): Volume descriptor
1377  * last_deleted_arv_num(out):
1378  *
1379  */
1380 FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE
1381 fileio_lock_la_log_path (const char *db_full_name_p, const char *lock_path_p, int vol_fd, int *last_deleted_arv_num)
1382 {
1383  FILE *fp;
1384  char host[MAXHOSTNAMELEN];
1385  char user[FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE];
1386  char login_name[FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE];
1387  INT64 lock_time;
1388  long long tmp_lock_time;
1389  int pid;
1390  bool retry = true;
1391  int lockf_errno;
1392  FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE result = FILEIO_LOCKF;
1393  int num_loops = 0;
1394  char io_timeval[64], format_string[32];
1395 
1396 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
1397  struct stat stbuf;
1398 
1399  /*
1400  * Make sure that advisory locks are used. An advisory lock is desired
1401  * since we are observing a voluntarily locking scheme.
1402  * Mandatory locks are know to be dangerous. If a runaway or otherwise
1403  * out-of-control process should hold a mandatory lock on the database
1404  * and fail to release that lock, the entire database system could hang
1405  */
1406  if (fstat (vol_fd, &stbuf) != -1)
1407  {
1408  if ((stbuf.st_mode & S_ISGID) != 0 && (stbuf.st_mode & S_IRWXG) != S_IXGRP)
1409  {
1410  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "A mandatory lock will be set on file = %s", vol_label_p);
1411  }
1412  }
1413 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
1414 
1415  if (lock_path_p == NULL)
1416  {
1417  lock_path_p = "";
1418  }
1419 
1420  /*
1421  * NOTE: The lockby auxiliary file is created only after we have acquired
1422  * the lock. This is important to avoid a possible synchronization
1423  * problem with this secundary technique
1424  */
1425  sprintf (format_string, "%%d %%%ds %%d %%%ds %%lld", FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE - 1, MAXHOSTNAMELEN - 1);
1426 
1427  while (retry == true && fileio_lock_file_write (vol_fd, 0, SEEK_SET, 0) < 0)
1428  {
1429  if (errno == EINTR)
1430  {
1431  /* Retry if the an interruption was signed */
1432  retry = true;
1433  continue;
1434  }
1435  lockf_errno = errno;
1436  retry = false;
1437 
1438  /* Volume seems to be mounted by someone else. Find out who has it. */
1439  fp = fopen (lock_path_p, "r");
1440  if (fp == NULL)
1441  {
1442  (void) sleep (3);
1443  num_loops += 3;
1444  fp = fopen (lock_path_p, "r");
1445  if (fp == NULL && num_loops <= 3)
1446  {
1447  retry = true;
1448  continue;
1449  }
1450  }
1451 
1452  if (fp == NULL || fscanf (fp, format_string, last_deleted_arv_num, user, &pid, host, &tmp_lock_time) != 5)
1453  {
1454  strcpy (user, "???");
1455  strcpy (host, "???");
1456  pid = 0;
1457  lock_time = 0;
1458  *last_deleted_arv_num = -1;
1459  }
1460  else
1461  {
1462  lock_time = tmp_lock_time;
1463  }
1464 
1465  if (fp != NULL)
1466  {
1467  (void) fclose (fp);
1468  }
1469 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
1470  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE,
1471  "io_lock: WARNING ignoring a run away lock on volume = %s\n. lockd deamon may not be"
1472  " working right.\n UNIX error = %s", lock_path_p, strerror (lockf_errno));
1473 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
1474 
1475  memset (io_timeval, 0, sizeof (io_timeval));
1476  fileio_ctime (&lock_time, io_timeval);
1477  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_LOCKED, 6, lock_path_p, db_full_name_p, user, pid, host,
1478  (lock_time == 0) ? "???" : io_timeval);
1479  return FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1480  }
1481 
1482  /* Create the information lock file and write the information about the lock */
1483  fp = fdopen (vol_fd, "w+");
1484  if (fp != NULL)
1485  {
1486  if (fscanf (fp, format_string, last_deleted_arv_num, user, &pid, host, &tmp_lock_time) != 5)
1487  {
1488  *last_deleted_arv_num = -1;
1489  }
1490 
1491  lseek (vol_fd, (off_t) 0, SEEK_SET);
1492 
1493  if (GETHOSTNAME (host, MAXHOSTNAMELEN) != 0)
1494  {
1495  strcpy (host, "???");
1496  }
1497 
1498  if (getuserid (login_name, FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE) == NULL)
1499  {
1500  strcpy (login_name, "???");
1501  }
1502 
1503  if (*last_deleted_arv_num < 0)
1504  {
1505  *last_deleted_arv_num = -1;
1506  }
1507 
1508  (void) fprintf (fp, "%-10d %s %d %s %ld", *last_deleted_arv_num, login_name, (int) GETPID (), host, time (NULL));
1509  fflush (fp);
1510  }
1511  else
1512  {
1513  /* Unable to create the lockf file. */
1514  if (result == FILEIO_LOCKF)
1515  {
1516  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, lock_path_p);
1517  result = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1518  }
1519  }
1520 
1521  return result;
1522 }
1523 
1524 /*
1525  * fileio_lock_la_dbname () - LOCKF A applylogdb database lock
1526  * return:
1527  *
1528  * lockf_vdes(in): lock file descriptor
1529  * db_name(in): database name
1530  * log_path(in): log file path
1531  *
1532  */
1533 FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE
1534 fileio_lock_la_dbname (int *lockf_vdes, char *db_name, char *log_path)
1535 {
1536  int error = NO_ERROR;
1537  int fd = NULL_VOLDES;
1538  int pid;
1539  int r;
1540  FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE result = FILEIO_LOCKF;
1541  FILE *fp = NULL;
1542  char lock_dir[PATH_MAX], lock_path[PATH_MAX];
1543  char tmp_db_name[DB_MAX_IDENTIFIER_LENGTH], tmp_log_path[PATH_MAX];
1544  char format_string[PATH_MAX];
1545 
1546  envvar_vardir_file (lock_dir, sizeof (lock_dir), "APPLYLOGDB");
1547  snprintf (lock_path, sizeof (lock_path), "%s/%s", lock_dir, db_name);
1548 
1549  if (access (lock_dir, F_OK) < 0)
1550  {
1551  /* create parent directory if not exist */
1552  if (mkdir (lock_dir, 0777) < 0 && errno == ENOENT)
1553  {
1554  char pdir[PATH_MAX];
1555 
1556  if (cub_dirname_r (lock_dir, pdir, PATH_MAX) > 0 && access (pdir, F_OK) < 0)
1557  {
1558  mkdir (pdir, 0777);
1559  }
1560  }
1561  }
1562 
1563  if (access (lock_dir, F_OK) < 0)
1564  {
1565  if (mkdir (lock_dir, 0777) < 0)
1566  {
1567  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "unable to create dir (%s)", lock_dir);
1568  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_DIRECTORY_DOESNOT_EXIST, 1, lock_dir);
1569  result = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1570  goto error_return;
1571  }
1572  }
1573 
1574  snprintf (format_string, sizeof (format_string), "%%d %%%ds %%%ds", DB_MAX_IDENTIFIER_LENGTH - 1, PATH_MAX - 1);
1575 
1576  fd = fileio_open (lock_path, O_RDWR | O_CREAT, 0644);
1577  if (fd == NULL_VOLDES)
1578  {
1579  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "unable to open lock_file (%s)", lock_path);
1580  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, lock_path);
1581 
1582  result = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1583  goto error_return;
1584  }
1585 
1586  fp = fopen (lock_path, "r");
1587  if (fp)
1588  {
1589  fseek (fp, (off_t) 0, SEEK_SET);
1590 
1591  r = fscanf (fp, format_string, &pid, tmp_db_name, tmp_log_path);
1592  if (r == 3)
1593  {
1594  assert_release (strcmp (db_name, tmp_db_name) == 0);
1595 
1596  if (strcmp (db_name, tmp_db_name) || strcmp (log_path, tmp_log_path))
1597  {
1598  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_LOCKED, 6, lock_path, db_name, "-", pid, "-", "-");
1599 
1600  fclose (fp);
1601 
1602  result = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1603  goto error_return;
1604  }
1605  }
1606 
1607  fclose (fp);
1608  }
1609  else
1610  {
1611  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "unable to open lock_file (%s)", lock_path);
1612  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, lock_path);
1613 
1614  result = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1615  goto error_return;
1616  }
1617 
1618  if (fileio_lock_file_write (fd, 0, SEEK_SET, 0) < 0)
1619  {
1620  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_LOCKED, 6, lock_path, db_name, "-", 0, "-", "-");
1621 
1622  result = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1623  goto error_return;
1624  }
1625 
1626  fp = fopen (lock_path, "w+");
1627  if (fp)
1628  {
1629  fseek (fp, (off_t) 0, SEEK_SET);
1630 
1631  pid = getpid ();
1632  fprintf (fp, "%-10d %s %s", pid, db_name, log_path);
1633  fflush (fp);
1634  fclose (fp);
1635  }
1636  else
1637  {
1638  error = fileio_release_lock (fd);
1639  assert_release (error == NO_ERROR);
1640 
1641  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "unable to open lock_file (%s)", lock_path);
1642  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, lock_path);
1643 
1644  result = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1645  goto error_return;
1646  }
1647 
1648  (*lockf_vdes) = fd;
1649 
1650  return result;
1651 
1652 error_return:
1653 
1654  if (fd != NULL_VOLDES)
1655  {
1656  fileio_close (fd);
1657  fd = NULL_VOLDES;
1658  }
1659 
1660  (*lockf_vdes) = fd;
1661 
1662  return result;
1663 }
1664 
1665 /*
1666  * fileio_unlock_la_dbname () - UNLOCKF A applylogdb database lock
1667  * return:
1668  *
1669  * lockf_vdes(in): lock file descriptor
1670  * db_name(in): database name
1671  * clear_owner(in): clear lock owner
1672  *
1673  */
1674 FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE
1675 fileio_unlock_la_dbname (int *lockf_vdes, char *db_name, bool clear_owner)
1676 {
1677  FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE result;
1678  int error;
1679  off_t end_offset;
1680  FILE *fp = NULL;
1681  char lock_dir[PATH_MAX], lock_path[PATH_MAX];
1682 
1683  envvar_vardir_file (lock_dir, sizeof (lock_dir), "APPLYLOGDB");
1684  snprintf (lock_path, sizeof (lock_path), "%s/%s", lock_dir, db_name);
1685 
1686  if (access (lock_dir, F_OK) < 0)
1687  {
1688  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "lock directory does not exist (%s)", lock_dir);
1689  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_DIRECTORY_DOESNOT_EXIST, 1, lock_dir);
1690  return FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1691  }
1692 
1693  assert_release ((*lockf_vdes) != NULL_VOLDES);
1694  if ((*lockf_vdes) == NULL_VOLDES)
1695  {
1696  return FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1697  }
1698 
1699  if (clear_owner)
1700  {
1701  fp = fopen (lock_path, "w+");
1702  if (fp == NULL)
1703  {
1704  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "unable to open lock_file (%s)", lock_path);
1705  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, lock_path);
1706 
1707  return FILEIO_LOCKF;
1708  }
1709 
1710  fseek (fp, (off_t) 0, SEEK_END);
1711  end_offset = ftell (fp);
1712  fseek (fp, (off_t) 0, SEEK_SET);
1713 
1714  if (end_offset > 0)
1715  {
1716  fprintf (fp, "%*s", (int) end_offset, " ");
1717  }
1718  fflush (fp);
1719  fclose (fp);
1720  }
1721 
1722  error = fileio_release_lock ((*lockf_vdes));
1723  if (error == NO_ERROR)
1724  {
1725  result = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
1726  }
1727  else
1728  {
1729  assert_release (error == NO_ERROR);
1730  result = FILEIO_LOCKF;
1731  }
1732 
1733  if (result == FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF)
1734  {
1735  fileio_close ((*lockf_vdes));
1736  (*lockf_vdes) = NULL_VOLDES;
1737  }
1738 
1739  return result;
1740 }
1741 
1742 static void
1743 fileio_check_lockby_file (char *name_info_lock_p)
1744 {
1745  /*
1746  * Either we did not acuire the lock through flock or seek has failed.
1747  * Use secundary technique for verification.
1748  * Make sure that current process has the lock, that is, check if
1749  * these are the consecuences of a run away process. If the lockby file
1750  * indicates that current process has the lock, remove the lockby file
1751  * to indicate that the process does not have the lock any longer.
1752  */
1753  FILE *fp;
1754  int pid;
1755  char login_name[FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE];
1756  char user[FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE];
1757  char host[MAXHOSTNAMELEN];
1758  char host2[MAXHOSTNAMELEN];
1759  char format_string[32];
1760 
1761  fp = fopen (name_info_lock_p, "r");
1762  if (fp != NULL)
1763  {
1764  sprintf (format_string, "%%%ds %%d %%%ds", FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE - 1, MAXHOSTNAMELEN - 1);
1765  if (fscanf (fp, format_string, user, &pid, host) != 3)
1766  {
1767  strcpy (user, "???");
1768  strcpy (host, "???");
1769  pid = 0;
1770  }
1771  (void) fclose (fp);
1772 
1773  /* Check for same process, same user, same host */
1774  getuserid (login_name, FILEIO_USER_NAME_SIZE);
1775 
1776  if (pid == GETPID () && strcmp (user, login_name) == 0 && GETHOSTNAME (host2, MAXHOSTNAMELEN) == 0
1777  && strcmp (host, host2) == 0)
1778  {
1779  (void) remove (name_info_lock_p);
1780  }
1781  }
1782 }
1783 
1784 /*
1785  * fileio_unlock () - UNLOCK A DATABASE VOLUME
1786  * return: void
1787  * vlabel(in): Volume label
1788  * vdes(in): Volume descriptor
1789  * lockf_type(in): Type of lock
1790  *
1791  * Note: The volume associated with the given name is unlocked and the
1792  * lock information file is removed.
1793  * If the Unix system complains that the volume is not locked by
1794  * the requested process, the information lock file is consulted
1795  * to verify for run a way process. If the requested process is
1796  * identical to the one recorded in the information lock, the
1797  * function returns without any error, otherwise, an error is set
1798  * and an error condition is returned.
1799  */
1800 static void
1801 fileio_unlock (const char *vol_label_p, int vol_fd, FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE lockf_type)
1802 {
1803  char name_info_lock[PATH_MAX];
1804 
1805  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_IO_LOCKF_ENABLE) == true)
1806  {
1807  if (vol_label_p == NULL)
1808  {
1809  vol_label_p = "";
1810  }
1811 
1812  strcpy (name_info_lock, vol_label_p);
1813  fileio_make_volume_lock_name (name_info_lock, vol_label_p);
1814 
1815  /*
1816  * We must remove the lockby file before we call flock to unlock the file.
1817  * Otherwise, we may remove the file when is locked by another process
1818  * Case of preemption and another process acquiring the lock.
1819  */
1820 
1821  if (lockf_type != FILEIO_LOCKF)
1822  {
1823  fileio_check_lockby_file (name_info_lock);
1824  }
1825  else
1826  {
1827  (void) remove (name_info_lock);
1828  fileio_unlock_file (vol_fd, 0, SEEK_SET, 0);
1829  }
1830  }
1831 }
1832 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
1833 
1834 /*
1835  * fileio_initialize_pages () - Initialize the first npages of the given volume with the
1836  * content of given page
1837  * return: io_pgptr on success, NULL on failure
1838  * vdes(in): Volume descriptor
1839  * io_pgptr(in): Initialization content of all pages
1840  * npages(in): Number of pages to initialize
1841  * kbytes_to_be_written_per_sec : size to add volume per sec
1842  */
1843 void *
1844 fileio_initialize_pages (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, FILEIO_PAGE * io_page_p, DKNPAGES start_pageid,
1845  DKNPAGES npages, size_t page_size, int kbytes_to_be_written_per_sec)
1846 {
1847  PAGEID page_id;
1848  bool skip_flush = false;
1849 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
1850  int count_of_page_for_a_sleep = 10;
1851  INT64 allowed_millis_for_a_sleep = 0; /* time which is time for writing unit of page and sleeping in a sleep */
1852  INT64 previous_elapsed_millis; /* time which is previous time for writing unit of page and sleep */
1853  INT64 time_to_sleep;
1854 
1855  TSC_TICKS start_tick, end_tick;
1856  TSCTIMEVAL tv_diff;
1857 
1858  INT64 page_count_per_sec;
1859 #endif
1860 
1861 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
1862  if (kbytes_to_be_written_per_sec > 0)
1863  {
1864  page_count_per_sec = kbytes_to_be_written_per_sec / (IO_PAGESIZE / ONE_K);
1865 
1866  if (page_count_per_sec < count_of_page_for_a_sleep)
1867  {
1868  page_count_per_sec = count_of_page_for_a_sleep;
1869  }
1870  allowed_millis_for_a_sleep = count_of_page_for_a_sleep * 1000 / page_count_per_sec;
1871 
1872  tsc_getticks (&start_tick);
1873  }
1874 #endif
1875 
1876 #if !defined (CS_MODE)
1877  skip_flush = dwb_is_created ();
1878 #endif
1879 
1880  for (page_id = start_pageid; page_id < npages + start_pageid; page_id++)
1881  {
1882 #if !defined(CS_MODE)
1883  /* check for interrupts from user (i.e. Ctrl-C) */
1884  if ((page_id % FILEIO_CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPT_INTERVAL) == 0)
1885  {
1886  if (pgbuf_is_log_check_for_interrupts (thread_p) == true)
1887  {
1888  return NULL;
1889  }
1890  }
1891 #endif /* !CS_MODE */
1892 
1893 #if !defined(NDEBUG)
1894  /* skip volume header page to find abnormal update */
1895  if (page_id == 0)
1896  {
1897  continue;
1898  }
1899 #endif
1900 
1901  if (fileio_write_or_add_to_dwb (thread_p, vol_fd, io_page_p, page_id, page_size) == NULL)
1902  {
1903  return NULL;
1904  }
1905 
1906 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
1907  if (kbytes_to_be_written_per_sec > 0 && (page_id + 1) % count_of_page_for_a_sleep == 0)
1908  {
1909  tsc_getticks (&end_tick);
1910  tsc_elapsed_time_usec (&tv_diff, end_tick, start_tick);
1911 
1912  previous_elapsed_millis = (tv_diff.tv_sec * 1000LL) + (tv_diff.tv_usec / 1000LL);
1913 
1914  /* calculate time to sleep through subtracting */
1915  time_to_sleep = allowed_millis_for_a_sleep - previous_elapsed_millis;
1916  if (time_to_sleep > 0)
1917  {
1918  thread_sleep ((double) time_to_sleep);
1919  }
1920 
1921  tsc_getticks (&start_tick);
1922  }
1923 #endif
1924  }
1925 
1926  return io_page_p;
1927 }
1928 
1929 /*
1930  * fileio_open () - Same as Unix open, but with retry during interrupts
1931  * return: volume descriptor identifier on success, NULL_VOLDES on failure
1932  * vlabel(in): Volume label
1933  * flags(in): open the volume as specified by the flags
1934  * mode(in): used when the volume is created
1935  */
1936 int
1937 fileio_open (const char *vol_label_p, int flags, int mode)
1938 {
1939  int vol_fd;
1940 
1941  do
1942  {
1943 #if defined(WINDOWS)
1944  vol_fd = open (vol_label_p, flags | _O_BINARY, mode);
1945 #else /* WINDOWS */
1946  vol_fd = open (vol_label_p, flags, mode);
1947 #endif /* WINDOWS */
1948  }
1949  while (vol_fd == NULL_VOLDES && errno == EINTR);
1950 
1951 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
1952  if (vol_fd > NULL_VOLDES)
1953  {
1954  int high_vol_fd;
1955  int range = MAX_NTRANS + 10;
1956 
1957  /* move fd to the over max_clients range */
1958  high_vol_fd = fcntl (vol_fd, F_DUPFD, range);
1959  if (high_vol_fd != -1)
1960  {
1961  close (vol_fd);
1962  vol_fd = high_vol_fd;
1963  }
1964  }
1965 
1966  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_DBFILES_PROTECT) == true && vol_fd > 0)
1967  {
1968  fileio_get_lock (vol_fd, vol_label_p);
1969  }
1970 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
1971 
1972  return vol_fd;
1973 }
1974 
1975 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
1976 /*
1977  * fileio_set_permission () -
1978  * return:
1979  * vlabel(in):
1980  */
1981 int
1982 fileio_set_permission (const char *vol_label_p)
1983 {
1984  int mode;
1985  struct stat buf;
1986  int error = NO_ERROR;
1987 
1988  if (stat (vol_label_p, &buf) < 0)
1989  {
1990  error = ER_IO_CANNOT_GET_PERMISSION;
1991  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, vol_label_p);
1992  return error;
1993  }
1994 
1995  /* get currently set mode */
1996  mode = buf.st_mode;
1997  /* remove group execute permission from mode */
1998  mode &= ~(S_IEXEC >> 3);
1999  /* set 'set group id bit' in mode */
2000  mode |= S_ISGID;
2001 
2002  if (chmod (vol_label_p, mode) < 0)
2003  {
2004  error = ER_IO_CANNOT_CHANGE_PERMISSION;
2005  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, vol_label_p);
2006  return error;
2007  }
2008 
2009  return error;
2010 }
2011 
2012 /*
2013  * fileio_get_lock () -
2014  * return:
2015  * fd(in):
2016  * vlabel(in):
2017  */
2018 static int
2019 fileio_get_lock (int fd, const char *vol_label_p)
2020 {
2021  int error = NO_ERROR;
2022 
2023  if (fileio_lock_file_read (fd, 0, SEEK_SET, 0) < 0)
2024  {
2025  error = ER_IO_GET_LOCK_FAIL;
2026  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 2, vol_label_p, fd);
2027  }
2028 
2029  return error;
2030 }
2031 
2032 /*
2033  * fileio_release_lock () -
2034  * return:
2035  * fd(in):
2036  */
2037 static int
2038 fileio_release_lock (int fd)
2039 {
2040  int error = NO_ERROR;
2041 
2042  if (fileio_unlock_file (fd, 0, SEEK_SET, 0) < 0)
2043  {
2044  error = ER_IO_RELEASE_LOCK_FAIL;
2045  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, fd);
2046  }
2047 
2048  return error;
2049 }
2050 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
2051 
2052 /*
2053  * fileio_close () - Close the volume associated with the given volume descriptor
2054  * return: void
2055  * vdes(in): Volume descriptor
2056  */
2057 void
2058 fileio_close (int vol_fd)
2059 {
2060 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
2061  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_DBFILES_PROTECT) == true)
2062  {
2063  fileio_release_lock (vol_fd);
2064  }
2065 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
2066 
2067  if (close (vol_fd) != 0)
2068  {
2069  er_set_with_oserror (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_DISMOUNT_FAIL, 1,
2070  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
2071  }
2072 }
2073 
2074 /*
2075  * fileio_create () - Create the volume (or file) without initializing it
2076  * return: volume descriptor identifier on success, NULL_VOLDES on failure
2077  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database where the volume belongs
2078  * vlabel(in): Volume label
2079  * volid(in): Volume identifier
2080  * dolock(in): Lock the volume from other Unix processes
2081  * dosync(in): synchronize the writes on the volume ?
2082  */
2083 static int
2084 fileio_create (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_full_name_p, const char *vol_label_p, VOLID vol_id,
2085  bool is_do_lock, bool is_do_sync)
2086 {
2087  int tmp_vol_desc = NULL_VOLDES;
2088  int vol_fd;
2089  FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE lockf_type = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
2090 #if defined(WINDOWS)
2091  int sh_flag;
2092 #else
2093  int o_sync;
2094 #endif /* WINDOWS */
2095 
2096 #if !defined(CS_MODE)
2097  /* Make sure that the volume is not already mounted. if it is, dismount the volume. */
2098  vol_fd = fileio_find_volume_descriptor_with_label (vol_label_p);
2099  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
2100  {
2101  fileio_dismount (thread_p, vol_fd);
2102  }
2103 #endif /* !CS_MODE */
2104 
2105 #if defined(WINDOWS)
2106  sh_flag = is_do_lock ? _SH_DENYWR : _SH_DENYNO;
2107 
2108  vol_fd = _sopen (vol_label_p, FILEIO_DISK_FORMAT_MODE | O_BINARY, sh_flag, FILEIO_DISK_PROTECTION_MODE);
2109  if (vol_fd == NULL_VOLDES)
2110  {
2111  if (sh_flag == _SH_DENYRW && errno != ENOENT)
2112  {
2113  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_LOCKED, 6, vol_label_p, db_full_name_p,
2114  "-", 0, "-", "-");
2115  }
2116  else
2117  {
2118  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_FORMAT_FAIL, 3, vol_label_p, -1, -1LL);
2119  }
2120  }
2121 
2122 #else /* !WINDOWS */
2123 
2124  o_sync = (is_do_sync != false) ? O_SYNC : 0;
2125 
2126  /* If the file exist make sure that nobody else is using it, before it is truncated */
2127  if (is_do_lock != false)
2128  {
2129  tmp_vol_desc = fileio_open (vol_label_p, O_RDWR | o_sync, 0);
2130  if (tmp_vol_desc != NULL_VOLDES)
2131  {
2132  /* The volume (file) already exist. Make sure that nobody is using it before the old one is destroyed */
2133  lockf_type = fileio_lock (db_full_name_p, vol_label_p, tmp_vol_desc, false);
2134  if (lockf_type == FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF)
2135  {
2136  /* Volume seems to be mounted by someone else */
2137  fileio_close (tmp_vol_desc);
2138  return NULL_VOLDES;
2139  }
2140  }
2141  }
2142 
2143  vol_fd = fileio_open (vol_label_p, FILEIO_DISK_FORMAT_MODE | o_sync, FILEIO_DISK_PROTECTION_MODE);
2144  if (vol_fd == NULL_VOLDES)
2145  {
2146  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_FORMAT_FAIL, 3, vol_label_p, -1, -1LL);
2147  }
2148 
2149  if (tmp_vol_desc != NULL_VOLDES)
2150  {
2151  if (lockf_type != FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF)
2152  {
2153  fileio_unlock (vol_label_p, tmp_vol_desc, lockf_type);
2154  }
2155  fileio_close (tmp_vol_desc);
2156  }
2157 #endif /* WINDOWS */
2158 
2159  perfmon_inc_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_FILE_NUM_CREATES);
2160 
2161  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
2162  {
2163 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
2164  if (is_do_lock == true)
2165  {
2166  lockf_type = fileio_lock (db_full_name_p, vol_label_p, vol_fd, false);
2167 
2168  if (lockf_type == FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF)
2169  {
2170  /* This should not happen, the volume seems to be mounted by someone else */
2171  fileio_dismount (thread_p, vol_fd);
2172  fileio_unformat (thread_p, vol_label_p);
2173  vol_fd = NULL_VOLDES;
2174 
2175  return vol_fd;
2176  }
2177  }
2178 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
2179 
2180 #if !defined(CS_MODE)
2181  if (fileio_cache (vol_id, vol_label_p, vol_fd, lockf_type) != vol_fd)
2182  {
2183  /* This should not happen, the volume seems to be mounted by someone else */
2184  fileio_dismount (thread_p, vol_fd);
2185  fileio_unformat (thread_p, vol_label_p);
2186  vol_fd = NULL_VOLDES;
2187 
2188  return vol_fd;
2189  }
2190 #endif /* !CS_MODE */
2191  }
2192 
2193  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "Created volume %s\n", vol_label_p);
2194 
2195  return vol_fd;
2196 }
2197 
2198 /*
2199  * fileio_create_backup_volume () - CREATE A BACKUP VOLUME (INSURE ENOUGH SPACE EXISTS)
2200  * return: volume descriptor identifier on success, NULL_VOLDES on failure
2201  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database where the volume belongs
2202  * vlabel(in): Volume label
2203  * volid(in): Volume identifier
2204  * dolock(in): Lock the volume from other Unix processes
2205  * dosync(in): synchronize the writes on the volume ?
2206  * atleast_npages(in): minimum number of pages required to be free
2207  *
2208  * Note: Tests to insure that there is at least the minimum requred amount of
2209  * space on the given file system are. Then calls fileio_create to create
2210  * the volume (or file) without initializing it. This is needed for tape
2211  * backups since they are not initialized at all plus saves time w/out
2212  * formatting.
2213  * Note: Space checking does not apply to devices, only files.
2214  */
2215 static int
2216 fileio_create_backup_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_full_name_p, const char *vol_label_p, VOLID vol_id,
2217  bool is_do_lock, bool is_do_sync, int atleast_npages)
2218 {
2219  struct stat stbuf;
2220  int num_free;
2221 
2222  if (stat (vol_label_p, &stbuf) != -1)
2223  {
2224 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
2225  /* In WINDOWS platform, FIFO is not supported, until now. FIFO must be existent before backup operation is
2226  * executed. */
2227  if (S_ISFIFO (stbuf.st_mode))
2228  {
2229  int vdes;
2230  struct timeval to = { 0, 100000 };
2231 
2232  while (true)
2233  {
2234  vdes = fileio_open (vol_label_p, O_WRONLY | O_NONBLOCK, 0200);
2235  if (vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
2236  {
2237  break;
2238  }
2239 
2240  if (errno == ENXIO)
2241  {
2242  /* sleep for 100 milli-seconds : consider cs & sa mode */
2243  select (0, NULL, NULL, NULL, &to);
2244 
2245 #if !defined(CS_MODE)
2246  if (pgbuf_is_log_check_for_interrupts (thread_p) == true)
2247  {
2248  return NULL_VOLDES;
2249  }
2250 #endif
2251  continue;
2252  }
2253  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_FORMAT_FAIL, 3, vol_label_p, -1, -1LL);
2254  return NULL_VOLDES;
2255  }
2256  return vdes;
2257  }
2258 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
2259  /* If there is not enough space in filesystem, then do not bother opening backup volume */
2260  if (atleast_npages > 0 && S_ISREG (stbuf.st_mode))
2261  {
2262  num_free = fileio_get_number_of_partition_free_pages (vol_label_p, IO_PAGESIZE);
2263  if (num_free < atleast_npages)
2264  {
2265  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_FORMAT_OUT_OF_SPACE, 5, vol_label_p, atleast_npages,
2266  (long long) ((IO_PAGESIZE / 1024) * atleast_npages), num_free,
2267  (long long) ((IO_PAGESIZE / 1024) * num_free));
2268  return NULL_VOLDES;
2269  }
2270  }
2271  }
2272 
2273  return (fileio_create (thread_p, db_full_name_p, vol_label_p, vol_id, is_do_lock, is_do_sync));
2274 }
2275 
2276 /*
2277  * fileio_format () - Format a volume of npages and mount the volume
2278  * return: volume descriptor identifier on success, NULL_VOLDES on failure
2279  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database where the volume belongs
2280  * vlabel(in): Volume label
2281  * volid(in): Volume identifier
2282  * npages(in): Number of pages
2283  * sweep_clean(in): Clean the newly formatted volume
2284  * dolock(in): Lock the volume from other Unix processes
2285  * dosync(in): synchronize the writes on the volume ?
2286  * kbytes_to_be_written_per_sec : size to add volume per sec
2287  *
2288  * Note: If sweep_clean is true, every page is initialized with recovery
2289  * information. In addition a volume can be optionally locked.
2290  * For example, the active log volume is locked to prevent
2291  * several server processes from accessing the same database.
2292  */
2293 int
2294 fileio_format (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_full_name_p, const char *vol_label_p, VOLID vol_id,
2295  DKNPAGES npages, bool is_sweep_clean, bool is_do_lock, bool is_do_sync, size_t page_size,
2296  int kbytes_to_be_written_per_sec, bool reuse_file)
2297 {
2298  int vol_fd;
2299  FILEIO_PAGE *malloc_io_page_p;
2300  off_t offset;
2301  DKNPAGES max_npages;
2302 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
2303  struct stat buf;
2304 #endif
2305  bool is_raw_device = false;
2306 
2307  /* Check for bad number of pages...and overflow */
2308  if (npages <= 0)
2309  {
2310  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_FORMAT_BAD_NPAGES, 2, vol_label_p, npages);
2311  return NULL_VOLDES;
2312  }
2313 
2314  if (fileio_is_volume_exist (vol_label_p) == true && reuse_file == false)
2315  {
2316  /* The volume that we are trying to create already exist. Remove it and try again */
2317 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
2318  if (lstat (vol_label_p, &buf) != 0)
2319  {
2320  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, vol_label_p);
2321  }
2322 
2323  if (!S_ISLNK (buf.st_mode))
2324  {
2325  fileio_unformat (thread_p, vol_label_p);
2326  }
2327  else
2328  {
2329  if (stat (vol_label_p, &buf) != 0)
2330  {
2331  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, vol_label_p);
2332  }
2333 
2334  is_raw_device = S_ISCHR (buf.st_mode);
2335  }
2336 #else /* !WINDOWS */
2337  fileio_unformat (thread_p, vol_label_p);
2338  is_raw_device = false;
2339 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
2340  }
2341 
2342  if (is_raw_device)
2343  {
2344  max_npages = (DKNPAGES) VOL_MAX_NPAGES (page_size);
2345  }
2346  else
2347  {
2348  max_npages = fileio_get_number_of_partition_free_pages (vol_label_p, page_size);
2349  }
2350 
2351  offset = FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (page_size, npages - 1);
2352 
2353  /*
2354  * Make sure that there is enough pages on the given partition before we
2355  * create and initialize the volume.
2356  * We should also check for overflow condition.
2357  */
2358  if (npages > max_npages || (offset < npages && npages > 1))
2359  {
2360  if (offset < npages)
2361  {
2362  /* Overflow */
2363  offset = FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (page_size, VOL_MAX_NPAGES (page_size));
2364  }
2365 
2366  if (max_npages >= 0)
2367  {
2368  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_FORMAT_OUT_OF_SPACE, 5, vol_label_p, npages, (offset / 1024),
2369  max_npages, FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (page_size / 1024, max_npages));
2370  }
2371  else
2372  {
2373  /* There was an error in fileio_get_number_of_partition_free_pages */
2374  ;
2375  }
2376 
2377  return NULL_VOLDES;
2378  }
2379 
2380  malloc_io_page_p = (FILEIO_PAGE *) malloc (page_size);
2381  if (malloc_io_page_p == NULL)
2382  {
2383  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, page_size);
2384  return NULL_VOLDES;
2385  }
2386 
2387  memset ((char *) malloc_io_page_p, 0, page_size);
2388  (void) fileio_initialize_res (thread_p, malloc_io_page_p, page_size);
2389 
2390  vol_fd = fileio_create (thread_p, db_full_name_p, vol_label_p, vol_id, is_do_lock, is_do_sync);
2391  FI_TEST (thread_p, FI_TEST_FILE_IO_FORMAT, 0);
2392  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
2393  {
2394  /* initialize the pages of the volume. */
2395 
2396  /* initialize at least two pages, the header page and the last page. in case of is_sweep_clean == true, every
2397  * page of the volume will be written. */
2398 
2399  if (fileio_write_or_add_to_dwb (thread_p, vol_fd, malloc_io_page_p, 0, page_size) == NULL)
2400  {
2401  fileio_dismount (thread_p, vol_fd);
2402  fileio_unformat (thread_p, vol_label_p);
2403  free_and_init (malloc_io_page_p);
2404 
2405  if (er_errid () != ER_INTERRUPTED)
2406  {
2407  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE, 2, 0, vol_id);
2408  }
2409 
2410  vol_fd = NULL_VOLDES;
2411  return vol_fd;
2412  }
2413 
2414 #if defined(HPUX)
2415  if ((is_sweep_clean == true
2416  && !fileio_initialize_pages (vol_fd, malloc_io_page_p, npages, page_size, kbytes_to_be_written_per_sec))
2417  || (is_sweep_clean == false
2418  && !fileio_write (vol_fd, malloc_io_page_p, npages - 1, page_size, FILEIO_WRITE_DEFAULT_WRITE)))
2419 #else /* HPUX */
2420  if (!((fileio_write_or_add_to_dwb (thread_p, vol_fd, malloc_io_page_p, npages - 1, page_size) == malloc_io_page_p)
2421  && (is_sweep_clean == false
2422  || fileio_initialize_pages (thread_p, vol_fd, malloc_io_page_p, 0, npages, page_size,
2423  kbytes_to_be_written_per_sec) == malloc_io_page_p)))
2424 #endif /* HPUX */
2425  {
2426  /* It is likely that we run of space. The partition where the volume was created has been used since we
2427  * checked above. */
2428 
2429  max_npages = fileio_get_number_of_partition_free_pages (vol_label_p, page_size);
2430 
2431  fileio_dismount (thread_p, vol_fd);
2432  fileio_unformat (thread_p, vol_label_p);
2433  free_and_init (malloc_io_page_p);
2434  if (er_errid () != ER_INTERRUPTED)
2435  {
2436  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_FORMAT_OUT_OF_SPACE, 5, vol_label_p, npages,
2437  (offset / 1024), max_npages, (long long) ((page_size / 1024) * max_npages));
2438  }
2439  vol_fd = NULL_VOLDES;
2440  return vol_fd;
2441  }
2442 
2443 #if defined(WINDOWS)
2444  fileio_dismount (thread_p, vol_fd);
2445  vol_fd = fileio_mount (thread_p, NULL, vol_label_p, vol_id, false, false);
2446 #endif /* WINDOWS */
2447  }
2448  else
2449  {
2450  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CANNOT_CREATE_VOL, 2, vol_label_p, db_full_name_p);
2451  }
2452 
2453  free_and_init (malloc_io_page_p);
2454  return vol_fd;
2455 }
2456 
2457 #if !defined (CS_MODE)
2458 /*
2459  * fileio_expand_to () - Expand a volume to the given number of pages.
2460  *
2461  * return:
2462  *
2463  * error code or NO_ERROR
2464  *
2465  *
2466  * arguments:
2467  *
2468  * vol_id : Volume identifier
2469  * size_npages : New size in pages
2470  * voltype : temporary or permanent volume type
2471  *
2472  *
2473  * How it works:
2474  *
2475  * A new size for file is provided. The new size is expected to be bigger than current size (with the exception of
2476  * recovery cases). This approach replaced extending by a given size to fix recovery errors (file extension could
2477  * be executed twice).
2478  *
2479  * Enough disk space is checked first before doing extend.
2480  *
2481  * Notes:
2482  *
2483  * Pages are not sweep_clean/initialized if they are part of temporary volumes.
2484  *
2485  * No checking for temporary volumes is performed by this function.
2486  *
2487  * On WINDOWS && SERVER MODE io_mutex lock must be obtained before calling lseek. Otherwise, expanding can
2488  * interfere with fileio_read and fileio_write calls. This caused corruptions in the temporary file, random pages
2489  * being written at the end of file instead of being written at their designated places.
2490  */
2491 int
2492 fileio_expand_to (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID vol_id, DKNPAGES size_npages, DB_VOLTYPE voltype)
2493 {
2494  int vol_fd;
2495  const char *vol_label_p;
2496  FILEIO_PAGE *io_page_p;
2497  DKNPAGES max_npages;
2498  size_t max_size;
2499  PAGEID start_pageid;
2500  size_t current_size;
2501  PAGEID last_pageid;
2502  size_t new_size;
2503  size_t desired_extend_size;
2504  size_t max_extend_size;
2505 #if defined(WINDOWS) && defined(SERVER_MODE)
2506  int rv;
2507  pthread_mutex_t *io_mutex;
2508  static pthread_mutex_t io_mutex_instance = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
2509 #endif /* WINDOWS && SERVER_MODE */
2510 
2511  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
2512 
2513  assert (size_npages > 0);
2514 
2515  vol_fd = fileio_get_volume_descriptor (vol_id);
2516  vol_label_p = fileio_get_volume_label (vol_id, PEEK);
2517 
2518  if (vol_fd == NULL_VOLDES || vol_label_p == NULL)
2519  {
2520  assert (false); /* I don't think we can accept this case */
2521  return ER_FAILED;
2522  }
2523 
2524  max_npages = fileio_get_number_of_partition_free_pages (vol_label_p, IO_PAGESIZE);
2525  if (max_npages < 0)
2526  {
2527  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error_code);
2528  return error_code;
2529  }
2530
