2531 #if defined(WINDOWS) && defined(SERVER_MODE)
2532  io_mutex = fileio_get_volume_mutex (thread_p, vol_fd);
2533  if (io_mutex == NULL)
2534  {
2535  io_mutex = &io_mutex_instance;
2536  }
2537 
2538  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (io_mutex);
2539  if (rv != 0)
2540  {
2541  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
2542  return ER_FAILED;
2543  }
2544 #endif /* WINDOWS && SERVER_MODE */
2545 
2546  /* get current size */
2547  current_size = lseek (vol_fd, 0, SEEK_END);
2548 #if defined(WINDOWS) && defined(SERVER_MODE)
2549  pthread_mutex_unlock (io_mutex);
2550 #endif /* WINDOWS && SERVER_MODE */
2551  /* safe-guard: current size is rounded to IO_PAGESIZE... unless it crashed during an expand */
2552  assert (!LOG_ISRESTARTED () || (current_size % IO_PAGESIZE) == 0);
2553 
2554  /* compute new size */
2555  new_size = ((size_t) size_npages) * IO_PAGESIZE;
2556 
2557  if (new_size <= current_size)
2558  {
2559  /* this is possible in limited cases. we cannot link file expand to a page, so sometimes we may expand but volume
2560  * header does not reflect this change. also, once expanded, we don't undo the expansion.
2561  * however next time volume wants to expand (this case), it just notices file is already expanded and all is
2562  * good. */
2563  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "skip extending volume %d with current size %zu to new size %zu\n",
2564  vol_id, current_size, new_size);
2565  return NO_ERROR;
2566  }
2567 
2568  /* overflow safety check */
2569  /* is this necessary? we dropped support for 32-bits systems. for now, I'll leave this check */
2570  max_size = ((size_t) VOL_MAX_NPAGES (IO_PAGESIZE)) * IO_PAGESIZE;
2571  new_size = MIN (new_size, max_size);
2572 
2573  /* consider disk free space */
2574  desired_extend_size = new_size - current_size;
2575  max_extend_size = ((size_t) max_npages) * IO_PAGESIZE;
2576 
2577  if (max_extend_size < desired_extend_size)
2578  {
2579  const size_t ONE_KILO = 1024;
2580  error_code = ER_IO_EXPAND_OUT_OF_SPACE;
2581 
2582  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_EXPAND_OUT_OF_SPACE, 5, vol_label_p,
2583  desired_extend_size / IO_PAGESIZE, new_size / ONE_KILO, max_npages,
2584  FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (IO_PAGESIZE / ONE_KILO, max_npages));
2585  }
2586 
2587  /* init page */
2588  io_page_p = (FILEIO_PAGE *) db_private_alloc (thread_p, IO_PAGESIZE);
2589  if (io_page_p == NULL)
2590  {
2591  /* TBD: remove memory allocation manual checks. */
2592  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) IO_PAGESIZE);
2593  return ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
2594  }
2595 
2596  memset (io_page_p, 0, IO_PAGESIZE);
2597  (void) fileio_initialize_res (thread_p, io_page_p, IO_PAGESIZE);
2598 
2599  start_pageid = (PAGEID) (current_size / IO_PAGESIZE);
2600  last_pageid = ((PAGEID) (new_size / IO_PAGESIZE) - 1);
2601 
2602  if (voltype == DB_TEMPORARY_VOLTYPE)
2603  {
2604  /* Write the last page */
2605  if (fileio_write_or_add_to_dwb (thread_p, vol_fd, io_page_p, last_pageid, IO_PAGESIZE) != io_page_p)
2606  {
2607  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error_code);
2608  }
2609  }
2610  else
2611  {
2612  /* support generic volume only */
2613  assert_release (voltype == DB_PERMANENT_VOLTYPE);
2614 
2615  if (fileio_initialize_pages (thread_p, vol_fd, io_page_p, start_pageid, last_pageid - start_pageid + 1,
2616  IO_PAGESIZE, -1) == NULL)
2617  {
2618  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error_code);
2619  }
2620  }
2621 
2622  if (error_code != NO_ERROR && error_code != ER_INTERRUPTED)
2623  {
2624  /* I don't like below assumption, it can be misleading. From what I have seen, errors are already set. */
2625 #if 0
2626  /* It is likely that we run of space. The partition where the volume was created has been used since we checked
2627  * above.
2628  */
2629  max_npages = fileio_get_number_of_partition_free_pages (vol_label_p, IO_PAGESIZE);
2630  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_EXPAND_OUT_OF_SPACE, 5, vol_label_p, size_npages,
2631  last_offset / 1024, max_npages, FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (IO_PAGESIZE / 1024, max_npages));
2632 #endif /* 0 */
2633  }
2634 
2635  db_private_free (thread_p, io_page_p);
2636 
2637  return NO_ERROR;
2638 }
2639 #endif /* not CS_MODE */
2640 
2641 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
2642 /*
2643  * fileio_truncate () - TRUNCATE A TEMPORARY VOLUME
2644  * return: npages
2645  * volid(in): Volume identifier
2646  * npages_to_resize(in): Number of pages to resize
2647  */
2648 DKNPAGES
2649 fileio_truncate (VOLID vol_id, DKNPAGES npages_to_resize)
2650 {
2651  int vol_fd;
2652  const char *vol_label_p;
2653  off_t length;
2654  bool is_retry = true;
2655 
2656  vol_fd = fileio_get_volume_descriptor (vol_id);
2657  vol_label_p = fileio_get_volume_label (vol_id, PEEK);
2658 
2659  if (vol_fd == NULL_VOLDES || vol_label_p == NULL)
2660  {
2661  return -1;
2662  }
2663 
2664  if (npages_to_resize <= 0)
2665  {
2666  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_FORMAT_BAD_NPAGES, 2, vol_label_p, npages_to_resize);
2667  return -1;
2668  }
2669 
2670  length = FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (IO_PAGESIZE, npages_to_resize);
2671  while (is_retry == true)
2672  {
2673  is_retry = false;
2674  if (ftruncate (vol_fd, length))
2675  {
2676  if (errno == EINTR)
2677  {
2678  is_retry = true;
2679  }
2680  else
2681  {
2682  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_TRUNCATE, 2, npages_to_resize,
2683  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
2684  return -1;
2685  }
2686  }
2687  }
2688  return npages_to_resize;
2689 }
2690 #endif
2691 
2692 /*
2693  * fileio_unformat () - DESTROY A VOLUME
2694  * return: void
2695  * vlabel(in): Label of volume to unformat
2696  *
2697  * Note: If the volume is mounted, it is dismounted. Then, the volume is
2698  * destroyed/unformatted.
2699  */
2700 void
2701 fileio_unformat (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *vol_label_p)
2702 {
2703  fileio_unformat_and_rename (thread_p, vol_label_p, NULL);
2704 }
2705 
2706 /*
2707  * fileio_unformat_and_rename () - DESTROY A VOLUME
2708  * return: void
2709  * vol_label(in): Label of volume to unformat
2710  * new_vlabel(in): New volume label. if NULL, volume will be deleted
2711  *
2712  * Note: If the volume is mounted, it is dismounted. Then, the volume is
2713  * destroyed/unformatted.
2714  */
2715 void
2716 fileio_unformat_and_rename (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *vol_label_p, const char *new_label_p)
2717 {
2718 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
2719  TSC_TICKS start_tick, end_tick;
2720  TSCTIMEVAL elapsed_time;
2721 #endif
2722 #if !defined(CS_MODE)
2723  int vol_fd;
2724  char vlabel_p[PATH_MAX];
2725 
2726  /* Dismount the volume if it is mounted */
2727  vol_fd = fileio_find_volume_descriptor_with_label (vol_label_p);
2728  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
2729  {
2730  /* if vol_label_p is a pointer of global vinfo->vlabel, It can be reset in fileio_dismount */
2731  strcpy (vlabel_p, vol_label_p);
2732  vol_label_p = vlabel_p;
2733  fileio_dismount (thread_p, vol_fd);
2734  }
2735 #endif /* !CS_MODE */
2736 
2737 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
2738  if (0 < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD))
2739  {
2740  tsc_getticks (&start_tick);
2741  }
2742 #endif
2743 
2744  if (new_label_p == NULL)
2745  {
2746  (void) remove (vol_label_p);
2747  }
2748  else
2749  {
2750  if (os_rename_file (vol_label_p, new_label_p) != NO_ERROR)
2751  {
2752  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_RENAME_FAIL, 2, vol_label_p, new_label_p);
2753  }
2754  }
2755 
2756 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
2757  if (0 < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD))
2758  {
2759  tsc_getticks (&end_tick);
2760  tsc_elapsed_time_usec (&elapsed_time, end_tick, start_tick);
2761  }
2762 
2763  if (MONITOR_WAITING_THREAD (elapsed_time))
2764  {
2765  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_MNT_WAITING_THREAD, 2, "file remove",
2766  prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD));
2767  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "fileio_unformat: %6d.%06d\n", elapsed_time.tv_sec, elapsed_time.tv_usec);
2768  }
2769 #endif
2770 
2771  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "Destroyed volume %s\n", vol_label_p);
2772 }
2773 
2774 /*
2775  * fileio_copy_volume () - COPY A DISK
2776  * return: volume descriptor identifier on success, NULL_VOLDES on failure
2777  * from_vdes(in): From Volume descriptor
2778  * npages(in): From Volume descriptor
2779  * to_vlabel(in): To Volume label
2780  * to_volid(in): Volume identifier assigned to the copy
2781  * reset_rcvinfo(in): Reset recovery information?
2782  *
2783  * Note: Format a new volume with the number of given pages and copy
2784  * the contents of the volume associated with from_vdes onto the
2785  * new generated volume. The recovery information kept in every
2786  * page may be optionally initialized.
2787  */
2788 int
2789 fileio_copy_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int from_vol_desc, DKNPAGES npages, const char *to_vol_label_p,
2790  VOLID to_vol_id, bool is_reset_recovery_info)
2791 {
2792  PAGEID page_id;
2793  FILEIO_PAGE *malloc_io_page_p = NULL;
2794  int to_vol_desc;
2795 
2796  /*
2797  * Create the to_volume. Don't initialize the volume with recovery
2798  * information since it generated/created when the content of the pages are
2799  * copied.
2800  */
2801 
2802 #if defined(HPUX)
2803  /* HP-UX shows the poor performance in fileio_format(). */
2804  to_vol_desc = fileio_create (NULL, to_vol_label_p, to_vol_id, false, false);
2805 #else /* HPUX */
2806  to_vol_desc =
2807  fileio_format (thread_p, NULL, to_vol_label_p, to_vol_id, npages, false, false, false, IO_PAGESIZE, 0, false);
2808 #endif /* HPUX */
2809  if (to_vol_desc == NULL_VOLDES)
2810  {
2811  return NULL_VOLDES;
2812  }
2813 
2814  /* Don't read the pages from the page buffer pool but directly from disk */
2815  malloc_io_page_p = (FILEIO_PAGE *) malloc (IO_PAGESIZE);
2816  if (malloc_io_page_p == NULL)
2817  {
2818  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) IO_PAGESIZE);
2819  goto error;
2820  }
2821 
2822  if (is_reset_recovery_info == false)
2823  {
2824  /* Copy the volume as it is */
2825  for (page_id = 0; page_id < npages; page_id++)
2826  {
2827  if (fileio_read (thread_p, from_vol_desc, malloc_io_page_p, page_id, IO_PAGESIZE) == NULL
2828  || fileio_write_or_add_to_dwb (thread_p, to_vol_desc, malloc_io_page_p, page_id, IO_PAGESIZE) == NULL)
2829  {
2830  goto error;
2831  }
2832  }
2833  }
2834  else
2835  {
2836  /* Reset the recovery information. Just like if this was a formatted volume */
2837  for (page_id = 0; page_id < npages; page_id++)
2838  {
2839  if (fileio_read (thread_p, from_vol_desc, malloc_io_page_p, page_id, IO_PAGESIZE) == NULL)
2840  {
2841  goto error;
2842  }
2843  else
2844  {
2845  fileio_reset_page_lsa (malloc_io_page_p, IO_PAGESIZE);
2846  if (fileio_write_or_add_to_dwb (thread_p, to_vol_desc, malloc_io_page_p, page_id, IO_PAGESIZE) == NULL)
2847  {
2848  goto error;
2849  }
2850  }
2851  }
2852  }
2853 
2854  if (fileio_synchronize (thread_p, to_vol_desc, to_vol_label_p, FILEIO_SYNC_ALSO_FLUSH_DWB) != to_vol_desc)
2855  {
2856  goto error;
2857  }
2858 
2859  free_and_init (malloc_io_page_p);
2860  return to_vol_desc;
2861 
2862 error:
2863  fileio_dismount (thread_p, to_vol_desc);
2864  fileio_unformat (thread_p, to_vol_label_p);
2865  if (malloc_io_page_p != NULL)
2866  {
2867  free_and_init (malloc_io_page_p);
2868  }
2869 
2870  return NULL_VOLDES;
2871 }
2872 
2873 /*
2874  * fileio_reset_volume () - Reset the recovery information (LSA) of all pages of given
2875  * volume with given reset_lsa
2876  * return:
2877  * vdes(in): Volume descriptor
2878  * vlabel(in): Volume label
2879  * npages(in): Number of pages of volume to reset
2880  * reset_lsa(in): The reset recovery information LSA
2881  */
2882 int
2883 fileio_reset_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, const char *vlabel, DKNPAGES npages, LOG_LSA * reset_lsa_p)
2884 {
2885  PAGEID page_id;
2886  FILEIO_PAGE *malloc_io_page_p;
2887  int success = NO_ERROR;
2888  bool skip_flush = false;
2889 
2890  malloc_io_page_p = (FILEIO_PAGE *) malloc (IO_PAGESIZE);
2891  if (malloc_io_page_p == NULL)
2892  {
2893  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) IO_PAGESIZE);
2894  return ER_FAILED;
2895  }
2896 
2897  for (page_id = 0; page_id < npages; page_id++)
2898  {
2899  if (fileio_read (thread_p, vol_fd, malloc_io_page_p, page_id, IO_PAGESIZE) != NULL)
2900  {
2901  fileio_set_page_lsa (malloc_io_page_p, reset_lsa_p, IO_PAGESIZE);
2902 
2903  if (fileio_write_or_add_to_dwb (thread_p, vol_fd, malloc_io_page_p, page_id, IO_PAGESIZE) == NULL)
2904  {
2905  success = ER_FAILED;
2906  break;
2907  }
2908  }
2909  else
2910  {
2911  success = ER_FAILED;
2912  break;
2913  }
2914  }
2915  free_and_init (malloc_io_page_p);
2916 
2917  if (fileio_synchronize (thread_p, vol_fd, vlabel, FILEIO_SYNC_ALSO_FLUSH_DWB) != vol_fd)
2918  {
2919  success = ER_FAILED;
2920  }
2921 
2922  return success;
2923 }
2924 
2925 /*
2926  * fileio_mount () - Mount the volume associated with the given name and permanent
2927  * identifier
2928  * return: volume descriptor identifier on success, NULL_VOLDES on failure
2929  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database where the volume belongs
2930  * vlabel(in): Volume label
2931  * volid(in): Permanent Volume identifier
2932  * lockwait(in): Lock the volume from other Unix processes
2933  * dosync(in): synchronize the writes on the volume ?
2934  */
2935 int
2936 fileio_mount (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_full_name_p, const char *vol_label_p, VOLID vol_id, int lock_wait,
2937  bool is_do_sync)
2938 {
2939 #if defined(WINDOWS)
2940  int vol_fd;
2941  int sh_flags;
2942 
2943 #if !defined(CS_MODE)
2944  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL_VOLDES);
2945 
2946  /* Is volume already mounted ? */
2947  vol_fd = fileio_find_volume_descriptor_with_label (vol_label_p);
2948  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
2949  {
2950  return vol_fd;
2951  }
2952 #endif /* !CS_MODE */
2953 
2954  sh_flags = lock_wait > 0 ? _SH_DENYWR : _SH_DENYNO;
2955 
2956  vol_fd = _sopen (vol_label_p, _O_RDWR | _O_BINARY, sh_flags, 0600);
2957  if (vol_fd == NULL_VOLDES)
2958  {
2959  if (sh_flags == _SH_DENYWR && errno != ENOENT)
2960  {
2961  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_LOCKED, 6, vol_label_p, db_full_name_p,
2962  "-", 0, "-", "-");
2963  }
2964  else
2965  {
2966  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, vol_label_p);
2967  }
2968  return NULL_VOLDES;
2969  }
2970 
2971 #if !defined(CS_MODE)
2972  /* Cache mounting information */
2973  if (fileio_cache (vol_id, vol_label_p, vol_fd, FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF) != vol_fd)
2974  {
2975  fileio_dismount (thread_p, vol_fd);
2976  return NULL_VOLDES;
2977  }
2978 #endif /* !CS_MODE */
2979 
2980  return vol_fd;
2981 
2982 #else /* WINDOWS */
2983  int vol_fd;
2984  int o_sync;
2985  FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE lockf_type = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
2986  bool is_do_wait;
2987  struct stat stat_buf;
2988  time_t last_modification_time = 0;
2989  off_t last_size = 0;
2990 
2991 #if !defined(CS_MODE)
2992  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL_VOLDES);
2993 
2994  /* Is volume already mounted ? */
2995  vol_fd = fileio_find_volume_descriptor_with_label (vol_label_p);
2996  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
2997  {
2998  return vol_fd;
2999  }
3000 #endif /* !CS_MODE */
3001 
3002  o_sync = (is_do_sync != false) ? O_SYNC : 0;
3003 
3004  /* OPEN THE DISK VOLUME PARTITION OR FILE SIMULATED VOLUME */
3005 start:
3006  vol_fd = fileio_open (vol_label_p, O_RDWR | o_sync, 0600);
3007  if (vol_fd == NULL_VOLDES)
3008  {
3009  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, vol_label_p);
3010  return NULL_VOLDES;
3011  }
3012 
3013  is_do_wait = (lock_wait > 1) ? true : false;
3014  if (is_do_wait)
3015  {
3016  if (fstat (vol_fd, &stat_buf) != 0)
3017  {
3018  fileio_close (vol_fd);
3019  return NULL_VOLDES;
3020  }
3021  last_modification_time = stat_buf.st_mtime;
3022  last_size = stat_buf.st_size;
3023  }
3024 
3025  /* LOCK THE DISK */
3026  if (lock_wait != 0)
3027  {
3028  lockf_type = fileio_lock (db_full_name_p, vol_label_p, vol_fd, is_do_wait);
3029  if (lockf_type == FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF)
3030  {
3031  /* Volume seems to be mounted by someone else */
3032  fileio_close (vol_fd);
3033  return NULL_VOLDES;
3034  }
3035  else if (lockf_type == FILEIO_LOCKF && is_do_wait == true)
3036  {
3037  /* may need to reopen the file */
3038  if (fstat (vol_fd, &stat_buf) != 0)
3039  {
3040  fileio_dismount (thread_p, vol_fd);
3041  return NULL_VOLDES;
3042  }
3043 
3044  if (last_modification_time != stat_buf.st_mtime || last_size != stat_buf.st_size)
3045  {
3046  /* somebody changed the file before the file lock was acquired */
3047  fileio_dismount (thread_p, vol_fd);
3048  goto start;
3049  }
3050  }
3051  }
3052 
3053 #if !defined(CS_MODE)
3054  /* Cache mounting information */
3055  if (fileio_cache (vol_id, vol_label_p, vol_fd, lockf_type) != vol_fd)
3056  {
3057  fileio_dismount (thread_p, vol_fd);
3058  return NULL_VOLDES;
3059  }
3060 #endif /* !CS_MODE */
3061 
3062  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_DBFILES_PROTECT) == true && vol_fd > 0)
3063  {
3064  fileio_set_permission (vol_label_p);
3065  }
3066 
3067  return vol_fd;
3068 #endif /* WINDOWS */
3069 }
3070 
3071 /*
3072  * fileio_dismount () - Dismount the volume associated with the given volume
3073  * descriptor
3074  * return: void
3075  * vdes(in): Volume descriptor
3076  */
3077 void
3078 fileio_dismount (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd)
3079 {
3080  const char *vlabel;
3081 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
3082  FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE lockf_type;
3083 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
3084  /*
3085  * Make sure that all dirty pages of the volume are forced to disk. This
3086  * is needed since a close of a file and program exist, does not imply
3087  * that the dirty pages of the file (or files that the program opened) are
3088  * forced to disk.
3089  */
3090  vlabel = fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK);
3091 
3092  (void) fileio_synchronize (thread_p, vol_fd, vlabel, FILEIO_SYNC_ALSO_FLUSH_DWB);
3093 
3094 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
3095  lockf_type = fileio_get_lockf_type (vol_fd);
3096  if (lockf_type != FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF)
3097  {
3098  fileio_unlock (vlabel, vol_fd, lockf_type);
3099  }
3100 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
3101 
3102  fileio_close (vol_fd);
3103 
3104  /* Decache volume information even during errors */
3105  fileio_decache (thread_p, vol_fd);
3106 }
3107 
3108 /*
3109  * fileio_dismount_without_fsync () -
3110  * return:
3111  * vdes(in):
3112  */
3113 static void
3114 fileio_dismount_without_fsync (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd)
3115 {
3116 #if !defined (WINDOWS)
3117  FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE lockf_type;
3118 
3119  lockf_type = fileio_get_lockf_type (vol_fd);
3120  if (lockf_type != FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF)
3121  {
3122  fileio_unlock (fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK), vol_fd, lockf_type);
3123  }
3124 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
3125 
3126  fileio_close (vol_fd);
3127 
3128  /* Decache volume information even during errors */
3129  fileio_decache (thread_p, vol_fd);
3130 }
3131 
3132 static int
3133 fileio_max_permanent_volumes (int index, int num_permanent_volums)
3134 {
3135  if (index < (num_permanent_volums - 1) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT)
3136  {
3137  return FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT - 1;
3138  }
3139  else
3140  {
3141  return (num_permanent_volums - 1) % FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
3142  }
3143 }
3144 
3145 static int
3146 fileio_min_temporary_volumes (int index, int num_temp_volums, int num_volinfo_array)
3147 {
3148  if (index > (num_volinfo_array - 1 - (num_temp_volums - 1) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT))
3149  {
3150  return 0;
3151  }
3152  else
3153  {
3154  return FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT - 1 - (num_temp_volums - 1) % FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
3155  }
3156 }
3157 
3158 static FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *
3159 fileio_traverse_system_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, SYS_VOLINFO_APPLY_FN apply_function, APPLY_ARG * arg)
3160 {
3161  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_vol_info_p;
3162  int rv;
3163 
3164  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
3165 
3166  for (sys_vol_info_p = &fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor;
3167  sys_vol_info_p != NULL && sys_vol_info_p->vdes != NULL_VOLDES; sys_vol_info_p = sys_vol_info_p->next)
3168  {
3169  if ((*apply_function) (thread_p, sys_vol_info_p, arg) == true)
3170  {
3171  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
3172  return sys_vol_info_p;
3173  }
3174  }
3175  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
3176 
3177  return NULL;
3178 }
3179 
3180 static FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *
3181 fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLINFO_APPLY_FN apply_function, APPLY_ARG * arg)
3182 {
3183  int i, j, max_j;
3184  FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER *header_p;
3185  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
3186 
3187  header_p = &fileio_Vol_info_header;
3188 
3189  for (i = 0; i <= (header_p->next_perm_volid - 1) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT; i++)
3190  {
3191  max_j = fileio_max_permanent_volumes (i, header_p->next_perm_volid);
3192 
3193  for (j = 0; j <= max_j; j++)
3194  {
3195  vol_info_p = &header_p->volinfo[i][j];
3196  if ((*apply_function) (thread_p, vol_info_p, arg) == true)
3197  {
3198  return vol_info_p;
3199  }
3200  }
3201  }
3202 
3203  return NULL;
3204 }
3205 
3206 static FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *
3207 fileio_reverse_traverse_permanent_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLINFO_APPLY_FN apply_function, APPLY_ARG * arg)
3208 {
3209  int i, j, max_j;
3210  FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER *header_p;
3211  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
3212 
3213  header_p = &fileio_Vol_info_header;
3214 
3215  for (i = (header_p->next_perm_volid - 1) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT; i >= 0; i--)
3216  {
3217  max_j = fileio_max_permanent_volumes (i, header_p->next_perm_volid);
3218 
3219  for (j = max_j; j >= 0; j--)
3220  {
3221  vol_info_p = &header_p->volinfo[i][j];
3222  if ((*apply_function) (thread_p, vol_info_p, arg) == true)
3223  {
3224  return vol_info_p;
3225  }
3226  }
3227  }
3228 
3229  return NULL;
3230 }
3231 
3232 static FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *
3233 fileio_traverse_temporary_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLINFO_APPLY_FN apply_function, APPLY_ARG * arg)
3234 {
3235  int i, j, min_j, num_temp_vols;
3236  FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER *header_p;
3237  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
3238 
3239  header_p = &fileio_Vol_info_header;
3240  num_temp_vols = LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - header_p->next_temp_volid;
3241 
3242  for (i = header_p->num_volinfo_array - 1;
3243  i > (header_p->num_volinfo_array - 1
3244  - (num_temp_vols + FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT - 1) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT); i--)
3245  {
3246  min_j = fileio_min_temporary_volumes (i, num_temp_vols, header_p->num_volinfo_array);
3247 
3248  for (j = FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT - 1; j >= min_j; j--)
3249  {
3250  vol_info_p = &header_p->volinfo[i][j];
3251  if ((*apply_function) (thread_p, vol_info_p, arg) == true)
3252  {
3253  return vol_info_p;
3254  }
3255  }
3256  }
3257 
3258  return NULL;
3259 }
3260 
3261 static FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *
3262 fileio_reverse_traverse_temporary_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLINFO_APPLY_FN apply_function, APPLY_ARG * arg)
3263 {
3264  int i, j, min_j, num_temp_vols;
3265  FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER *header_p;
3266  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
3267 
3268  header_p = &fileio_Vol_info_header;
3269  num_temp_vols = (LOG_MAX_DBVOLID) - header_p->next_temp_volid;
3270 
3271  for (i = (header_p->num_volinfo_array - ((num_temp_vols + FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT - 1) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT));
3272  i < header_p->num_volinfo_array; i++)
3273  {
3274  min_j = fileio_min_temporary_volumes (i, num_temp_vols, header_p->num_volinfo_array);
3275 
3276  for (j = min_j; j < FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT; j++)
3277  {
3278  vol_info_p = &header_p->volinfo[i][j];
3279  if ((*apply_function) (thread_p, vol_info_p, arg) == true)
3280  {
3281  return vol_info_p;
3282  }
3283  }
3284  }
3285 
3286  return NULL;
3287 }
3288 
3289 static bool
3290 fileio_dismount_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * ignore_arg)
3291 {
3292  if (vol_info_p->vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
3293  {
3294  (void) fileio_synchronize (thread_p, vol_info_p->vdes, vol_info_p->vlabel, FILEIO_SYNC_ALSO_FLUSH_DWB);
3295 
3296 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
3297  if (vol_info_p->lockf_type != FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF)
3298  {
3299  fileio_unlock (vol_info_p->vlabel, vol_info_p->vdes, vol_info_p->lockf_type);
3300  }
3301 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
3302 
3303  fileio_close (vol_info_p->vdes);
3304  }
3305 
3306 #if defined(WINDOWS) && defined(SERVER_MODE)
3307  pthread_mutex_destroy (&vol_info_p->vol_mutex);
3308 #endif /* WINDOWS && SERVER_MODE */
3309 
3310  return false;
3311 }
3312 
3313 /*
3314  * fileio_dismount_all () - Dismount all mounted volumes
3315  * return: void
3316  */
3317 void
3318 fileio_dismount_all (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
3319 {
3320  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_HEADER *sys_header_p;
3321  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_vol_info_p, *tmp_sys_vol_info_p;
3322  FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER *vol_header_p;
3323  int i, num_perm_vols, num_temp_vols;
3324  int rv;
3325  APPLY_ARG ignore_arg = { 0 };
3326 
3327  /* First, traverse sys volumes */
3328  sys_header_p = &fileio_Sys_vol_info_header;
3329  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&sys_header_p->mutex);
3330 
3331  for (sys_vol_info_p = &sys_header_p->anchor; sys_vol_info_p != NULL;)
3332  {
3333  if (sys_vol_info_p->vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
3334  {
3335  /* System volume. No need to sync DWB. */
3336  (void) fileio_synchronize (thread_p, sys_vol_info_p->vdes, sys_vol_info_p->vlabel, FILEIO_SYNC_ONLY);
3337 
3338 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
3339  if (sys_vol_info_p->lockf_type != FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF)
3340  {
3341  fileio_unlock (sys_vol_info_p->vlabel, sys_vol_info_p->vdes, sys_vol_info_p->lockf_type);
3342  }
3343 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
3344 
3345  fileio_close (sys_vol_info_p->vdes);
3346  }
3347 
3348  tmp_sys_vol_info_p = sys_vol_info_p;
3349  sys_vol_info_p = sys_vol_info_p->next;
3350  if (tmp_sys_vol_info_p != &sys_header_p->anchor)
3351  {
3352 #if defined(SERVER_MODE) && defined(WINDOWS)
3353  pthread_mutex_destroy (&tmp_sys_vol_info_p->sysvol_mutex);
3354 
3355 #endif /* WINDOWS */
3356  free_and_init (tmp_sys_vol_info_p);
3357  }
3358  }
3359 
3360  pthread_mutex_unlock (&sys_header_p->mutex);
3361 
3362  /* Second, traverse perm/temp volumes */
3363  vol_header_p = &fileio_Vol_info_header;
3364  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&vol_header_p->mutex);
3365  num_perm_vols = vol_header_p->next_perm_volid;
3366 
3367  (void) fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (thread_p, fileio_dismount_volume, &ignore_arg);
3368 
3369  vol_header_p->max_perm_vols = 0;
3370  vol_header_p->next_perm_volid = 0;
3371 
3372  num_temp_vols = LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - vol_header_p->next_temp_volid;
3373 
3374  (void) fileio_traverse_temporary_volume (thread_p, fileio_dismount_volume, &ignore_arg);
3375 
3376  vol_header_p->max_temp_vols = 0;
3377  vol_header_p->next_temp_volid = LOG_MAX_DBVOLID;
3378 
3379  if (vol_header_p->volinfo != NULL)
3380  {
3381  for (i = 0; i <= (VOLID_MAX - 1) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT; i++)
3382  {
3383  if (vol_header_p->volinfo[i] != NULL)
3384  {
3385  free_and_init (vol_header_p->volinfo[i]);
3386  }
3387 
3388  }
3389  }
3390 
3391  free_and_init (vol_header_p->volinfo);
3392 
3393  pthread_mutex_unlock (&vol_header_p->mutex);
3394 }
3395 
3396 /*
3397  * fileio_map_mounted () - Map over the data volumes
3398  * return:
3399  * fun(in): Function to call on volid and args
3400  * args(in): argumemts for fun
3401  *
3402  * Note : Map over all data volumes (i.e., the log volumes are skipped),
3403  * by calling the given function on every volume. If the function
3404  * returns false the mapping is stopped.
3405  */
3406 bool
3407 fileio_map_mounted (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, bool (*fun) (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID vol_id, void *args),
3408  void *args)
3409 {
3410  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
3411  FILEIO_VOLUME_HEADER *header_p;
3412  int i, j, max_j, min_j, num_temp_vols;
3413 
3414  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (false);
3415 
3416  header_p = &fileio_Vol_info_header;
3417  for (i = 0; i <= (header_p->next_perm_volid - 1) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT; i++)
3418  {
3419  max_j = fileio_max_permanent_volumes (i, header_p->next_perm_volid);
3420 
3421  for (j = 0; j <= max_j; j++)
3422  {
3423  vol_info_p = &header_p->volinfo[i][j];
3424  if (vol_info_p->vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
3425  {
3426  if (((*fun) (thread_p, vol_info_p->volid, args)) == false)
3427  {
3428  return false;
3429  }
3430  }
3431  }
3432  }
3433 
3434  num_temp_vols = LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - header_p->next_temp_volid;
3435  for (i = header_p->num_volinfo_array - 1;
3436  i > (header_p->num_volinfo_array - 1
3437  - (num_temp_vols + FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT - 1) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT); i--)
3438  {
3439  min_j = fileio_min_temporary_volumes (i, num_temp_vols, header_p->num_volinfo_array);
3440 
3441  for (j = FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT - 1; j >= min_j; j--)
3442  {
3443  vol_info_p = &header_p->volinfo[i][j];
3444  if (vol_info_p->vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
3445  {
3446  if (((*fun) (thread_p, vol_info_p->volid, args)) == false)
3447  {
3448  return false;
3449  }
3450  }
3451  }
3452  }
3453 
3454  return true;
3455 }
3456 
3457 static bool
3458 fileio_is_volume_descriptor_equal (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg)
3459 {
3460  if (vol_info_p->vdes == NULL_VOLDES)
3461  {
3462  return false;
3463  }
3464  return (vol_info_p->vdes == arg->vdes);
3465 }
3466 
3467 static bool
3468 fileio_is_volume_id_equal (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg)
3469 {
3470  if (vol_info_p->volid == NULL_VOLID)
3471  {
3472  return false;
3473  }
3474  return (vol_info_p->volid == arg->vol_id);
3475 }
3476 
3477 static bool
3478 fileio_is_volume_id_gt (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg)
3479 {
3480  if (vol_info_p->volid == NULL_VOLID)
3481  {
3482  return false;
3483  }
3484  return (vol_info_p->volid > arg->vol_id);
3485 }
3486 
3487 static bool
3488 fileio_is_volume_id_lt (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg)
3489 {
3490  if (vol_info_p->volid == NULL_VOLID)
3491  {
3492  return false;
3493  }
3494  return (vol_info_p->volid < arg->vol_id);
3495 }
3496 
3497 static FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *
3498 fileio_find_system_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, SYS_VOLINFO_APPLY_FN apply_function, APPLY_ARG * arg)
3499 {
3500  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_vol_info_p;
3501 
3502  for (sys_vol_info_p = &fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor;
3503  sys_vol_info_p != NULL && sys_vol_info_p->vdes != NULL_VOLDES; sys_vol_info_p = sys_vol_info_p->next)
3504  {
3505  if ((*apply_function) (thread_p, sys_vol_info_p, arg) == true)
3506  {
3507  return sys_vol_info_p;
3508  }
3509  }
3510 
3511  return NULL;
3512 }
3513 
3514 static bool
3515 fileio_is_system_volume_descriptor_equal (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO * sys_vol_info_p,
3516  APPLY_ARG * arg)
3517 {
3518  return (sys_vol_info_p->vdes == arg->vdes);
3519 }
3520 
3521 static bool
3522 fileio_is_system_volume_id_equal (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO * sys_vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg)
3523 {
3524  return (sys_vol_info_p->volid == arg->vol_id);
3525 }
3526 
3527 static bool
3528 fileio_is_system_volume_label_equal (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO * sys_vol_info_p,
3529  APPLY_ARG * arg)
3530 {
3531  return (util_compare_filepath (sys_vol_info_p->vlabel, arg->vol_label) == 0);
3532 }
3533 
3534 /*
3535  * fileio_page_hexa_dump () - Hexa dump the page.
3536  * return: nothing.
3537  * data(in): source data to dump
3538  * length(in): The length of the data.
3539  */
3540 void
3541 fileio_page_hexa_dump (const char *src_data, int length)
3542 {
3543  char *log_block_string, *dest_ptr;
3544  const size_t size = length * 4;
3545  int line_no, i;
3546 
3547  dest_ptr = log_block_string = (char *) malloc (size);
3548  if (log_block_string == NULL)
3549  {
3550  return;
3551  }
3552 
3553  for (i = 0, line_no = 0; i < length; i++, src_data++)
3554  {
3555  if (i % 32 == 0)
3556  {
3557  dest_ptr += sprintf (dest_ptr, "\n%05d: ", line_no++);
3558  }
3559 
3560  dest_ptr += sprintf (dest_ptr, "%02X ", (unsigned char) (*src_data));
3561  }
3562 
3563  dest_ptr += sprintf (dest_ptr, "\n");
3564 
3565  assert ((size_t) (dest_ptr - log_block_string) < size);
3566 
3567  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "fileio_page_hexa_dump: data = %s\n", log_block_string);
3568 
3569  free_and_init (log_block_string);
3570 }
3571 
3572 #if !defined (WINDOWS)
3573 /*
3574  * pwrite_write_with_injected_fault () - Write buffer to file descriptor with fault injection.
3575  * return:
3576  * thread_p(in): thread entry
3577  * fd(in): file descriptor
3578  * buf(in): buffer to write
3579  * count(in): count bytes to write
3580  * offset(in): offset into file
3581  */
3582 static ssize_t
3583 pwrite_with_injected_fault (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int fd, const void *buf, size_t count, off_t offset)
3584 {
3585  static bool init = false;
3586  const int mod_factor = 25000;
3587  const int block_size = 4096;
3588  int count_blocks;
3589  ssize_t r, written_nbytes;
3590  off_t unit_offset;
3591  bool fi_partial_write1_on, fi_partial_write2_on;
3592 
3593  if (init == false)
3594  {
3595  srand ((unsigned int) time (NULL));
3596  init = true;
3597  }
3598 
3599  fi_partial_write1_on = FI_INSERTED (FI_TEST_FILE_IO_WRITE_PARTS1);
3600  fi_partial_write2_on = FI_INSERTED (FI_TEST_FILE_IO_WRITE_PARTS2);
3601 
3602  if ((fi_partial_write1_on || fi_partial_write2_on) && ((rand () % mod_factor) == 0))
3603  {
3604  // simulate partial write
3605  count_blocks = count / block_size;
3606  written_nbytes = 0;
3607  for (int i = 0; i < count_blocks; i++)
3608  {
3609  if (fi_partial_write1_on)
3610  {
3611  unit_offset = i * block_size;
3612  }
3613  else
3614  {
3615  // reverse order
3616  unit_offset = ((count_blocks - 1) - i) * block_size;
3617  }
3618 
3619  r = pwrite (fd, ((char *) buf) + unit_offset, block_size, offset + unit_offset);
3620  written_nbytes += r;
3621  if (r != block_size)
3622  {
3623  return written_nbytes;
3624  }
3625 
3626  // randomly exits to remain page is partially written
3627  if ((rand () % count_blocks - 1) == 0)
3628  {
3629  char msg[1024];
3630  char *vlabel;
3631 
3632  vlabel = fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (fd, PEEK);
3633  sprintf (msg, "fault injected to write a page to offset (%ld) of '%s'\n", offset,
3634  vlabel ? vlabel : "unknown volume");
3635  er_print_callstack (ARG_FILE_LINE, "FAULT INJECTION: RANDOM EXIT\n");
3636  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_FAILED_ASSERTION, 1, msg);
3637 
3638  // exit handler
3639  (void) fileio_synchronize (thread_p, fd, vlabel, FILEIO_SYNC_ONLY);
3640 
3641 #if !defined(NDEBUG)
3642  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_ER_LOG_DEBUG))
3643  {
3644  fileio_page_hexa_dump ((const char *) buf, count);
3645 
3646 #if defined (SERVER_MODE) || defined (SA_MODE)
3647  /* Verify page correctness before the crash, for proper recovery purpose. */
3648  if (fileio_is_permanent_volume_descriptor (thread_p, fd))
3649  {
3650  /* Permanent data volume. */
3651  int error_code;
3652  bool is_page_corrupted;
3653 
3654  error_code = fileio_page_check_corruption (thread_p, (FILEIO_PAGE *) buf, &is_page_corrupted);
3655  assert (error_code == NO_ERROR && is_page_corrupted == false);
3656  }
3657  else
3658  {
3659  /* sys volume ? */
3660  int rv;
3661  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_volinfo;
3662  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
3663 
3664  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
3665  arg.vdes = fd;
3666  sys_volinfo =
3667  fileio_find_system_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_system_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
3668  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
3669  if (sys_volinfo)
3670  {
3671  logpb_debug_check_log_page (thread_p, (void *) buf);
3672  }
3673  }
3674 #endif /* defined (SERVER_MODE) || (SA_MODE) */
3675  }
3676 
3677 #endif /* defined (NDEBUG) */
3678  // exit
3679  _exit (0);
3680  }
3681  }
3682 
3683  return written_nbytes;
3684  }
3685 
3686  return pwrite (fd, buf, count, offset);
3687 }
3688 #endif
3689 
3690 #if defined(HPUX) && !defined(IA64)
3691 /*
3692  * pread () -
3693  * return:
3694  * fd(in):
3695  * buf(in):
3696  * nbytes(in):
3697  * offset(in):
3698  *
3699  * Note: Like HP-UX 11, the positioned I/O may not directly available in some
3700  * systems. In that case, use the following simulated positioned I/O
3701  * routines.
3702  */
3703 ssize_t
3704 pread (int fd, void *buf, size_t nbytes, off_t offset)
3705 {
3706  struct aiocb io;
3707  const struct aiocb *list[1];
3708  int err;
3709 
3710  io.aio_fildes = fd;
3711  io.aio_offset = offset;
3712  io.aio_buf = buf;
3713  io.aio_nbytes = nbytes;
3714  io.aio_reqprio = 0;
3715  io.aio_sigevent.sigev_notify = SIGEV_NONE;
3716 
3717  err = aio_read (&io); /* atomically reads at offset */
3718  if (err != 0)
3719  {
3720  return (err);
3721  }
3722 
3723  list[0] = &io;
3724 
3725  err = aio_suspend (list, 1, NULL); /* wait for IO to complete */
3726  if (err != 0)
3727  {
3728  return (err);
3729  }
3730 
3731  return aio_return (&io);
3732 }
3733 
3734 /*
3735  * pwrite () -
3736  * return:
3737  * fd(in):
3738  * buf(in):
3739  * nbytes(in):
3740  * offset(in):
3741  */
3742 ssize_t
3743 pwrite (int fd, const void *buf, size_t nbytes, off_t offset)
3744 {
3745  struct aiocb io;
3746  const struct aiocb *list[1];
3747  int err;
3748 
3749  io.aio_fildes = fd;
3750  io.aio_offset = offset;
3751  io.aio_buf = buf;
3752  io.aio_nbytes = nbytes;
3753  io.aio_reqprio = 0;
3754  io.aio_sigevent.sigev_notify = SIGEV_NONE;
3755 
3756  err = aio_write (&io); /* atomically writes at offset */
3757  if (err != 0)
3758  {
3759  return (err);
3760  }
3761 
3762  list[0] = &io;
3763 
3764  err = aio_suspend (list, 1, NULL); /* wait for IO to complete */
3765  if (err != 0)
3766  {
3767  return (err);
3768  }
3769 
3770  return aio_return (&io);
3771 }
3772 #elif defined(WINDOWS) && defined(SERVER_MODE)
3773 /*
3774  * fileio_get_volume_mutex () - FIND VOLUME MUTEX GIVEN DESCRIPTOR
3775  * return: I/O volume mutex
3776  * vdes(in): Volume descriptor
3777  */
3778 static pthread_mutex_t *
3779 fileio_get_volume_mutex (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vdes)
3780 {
3781  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *volinfo;
3782  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_volinfo;
3783  int rv;
3784  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
3785 
3786  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL);
3787 
3788  /* perm/temp volume ? */
3789 
3790  arg.vdes = vdes;
3791  volinfo = fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
3792  if (volinfo)
3793  {
3794  return &volinfo->vol_mutex;
3795  }
3796 
3797  arg.vdes = vdes;
3798  volinfo = fileio_traverse_temporary_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
3799  if (volinfo)
3800  {
3801  return &volinfo->vol_mutex;
3802  }
3803 
3804  /* sys volume ? */
3805  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
3806 
3807  arg.vdes = vdes;
3808  sys_volinfo = fileio_find_system_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_system_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
3809  if (sys_volinfo)
3810  {
3811  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
3812  return &sys_volinfo->sysvol_mutex;
3813  }
3814 
3815  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
3816  return NULL;
3817 }
3818 #endif /* WINDOWS && SERVER_MODE */
3819 
3820 /*
3821  * fileio_os_read () - helper for fileio_read
3822  * return: the number of bytes read is returned. On error, error code.
3823  * vol_fd(in): Volume descriptor
3824  * io_page_p(out): Address where content of page is stored. Must be of page_size long
3825  * count(in): the number of bytes to be read
3826  * offset(in): starting file offset
3827  */
3828 static ssize_t
3829 fileio_os_read (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, void *io_page_p, size_t count, off_t offset)
3830 {
3831 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
3832  /* Locate the desired page */
3833  if (lseek (vol_fd, offset, SEEK_SET) != offset)
3834  {
3835  return ER_FAILED;
3836  }
3837 
3838  /* Read the desired page */
3839  return read (vol_fd, io_page_p, count);
3840 #elif defined (WINDOWS)
3841  // TODO: replace it with ReadFile
3842  ssize_t nbytes;
3843  int rv;
3844  pthread_mutex_t *io_mutex;
3845  static pthread_mutex_t io_mutex_instance = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
3846 
3847  io_mutex = fileio_get_volume_mutex (thread_p, vol_fd);
3848  if (io_mutex == NULL)
3849  {
3850  io_mutex = &io_mutex_instance;
3851  }
3852 
3853  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (io_mutex);
3854  if (rv != 0)
3855  {
3856  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_PTHREAD_MUTEX_LOCK, 0);
3857  return ER_FAILED;
3858  }
3859 
3860  /* Locate the desired page */
3861  if (lseek (vol_fd, offset, SEEK_SET) != offset)
3862  {
3863  pthread_mutex_unlock (io_mutex);
3864  return ER_FAILED;
3865  }
3866 
3867  /* Read the desired page */
3868  nbytes = read (vol_fd, io_page_p, (unsigned int) count);
3869  if (pthread_mutex_unlock (io_mutex) != 0)
3870  {
3871  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_PTHREAD_MUTEX_UNLOCK, 0);
3872  return ER_FAILED;
3873  }
3874 
3875  return nbytes;
3876 #else /* WINDOWS */
3877  return pread (vol_fd, io_page_p, count, offset);
3878 #endif
3879 }
3880 
3881 /*
3882  * fileio_read () - READ A PAGE FROM DISK
3883  * return:
3884  * vol_fd(in): Volume descriptor
3885  * io_page_p(out): Address where content of page is stored. Must be of page_size long
3886  * page_id(in): Page identifier
3887  * page_size(in): Page size
3888  *
3889  * Note: Read the content of the page described by page_id onto the
3890  * given io_page_p buffer. The io_page_p must be page_size long.
3891  */
3892 
3893 void *
3894 fileio_read (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, void *io_page_p, PAGEID page_id, size_t page_size)
3895 {
3896 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
3897  TSC_TICKS start_tick, end_tick;
3898  TSCTIMEVAL elapsed_time;
3899 #endif
3900  off_t offset = FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (page_size, page_id);
3901  ssize_t nbytes;
3902  bool is_retry = true;
3903 
3904 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
3905  if (0 < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD))
3906  {
3907  tsc_getticks (&start_tick);
3908  }
3909 #endif
3910 
3911  while (is_retry == true)
3912  {
3913  is_retry = false;
3914 
3915  nbytes = fileio_os_read (thread_p, vol_fd, io_page_p, page_size, offset);
3916  if (nbytes != (ssize_t) page_size)
3917  {
3918  if (nbytes == 0)
3919  {
3920  /* This is an end of file. We are trying to read beyond the allocated disk space */
3921  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_PB_BAD_PAGEID, 2, page_id,
3922  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
3923  return NULL;
3924  }
3925 
3926  if (errno == EINTR)
3927  {
3928  is_retry = true;
3929  }
3930  else
3931  {
3932  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_READ, 2, page_id,
3933  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
3934  return NULL;
3935  }
3936  }
3937  }
3938 
3939 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
3940  if (0 < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD))
3941  {
3942  tsc_getticks (&end_tick);
3943  tsc_elapsed_time_usec (&elapsed_time, end_tick, start_tick);
3944  }
3945 
3946  if (MONITOR_WAITING_THREAD (elapsed_time))
3947  {
3948  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_MNT_WAITING_THREAD, 2, "file read",
3949  prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD));
3950  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "fileio_read: %6d.%06d\n", elapsed_time.tv_sec, elapsed_time.tv_usec);
3951  }
3952 #endif
3953 
3954  perfmon_inc_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_FILE_NUM_IOREADS);
3955  return io_page_p;
3956 }
3957 
3958 /*
3959  * fileio_write_or_add_to_dwb () - Write a page to disk if DWb disabled, otherwise add it to DWB
3960  * return: io_page_p on success, NULL on failure
3961  * vol_fd(in): Volume descriptor
3962  * io_page_p(in): In-memory address where the current content of page resides
3963  * page_id(in): Page identifier
3964  * page_size(in): Page size
3965  *
3966  */
3967 void *
3968 fileio_write_or_add_to_dwb (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, FILEIO_PAGE * io_page_p, PAGEID page_id,
3969  size_t page_size)
3970 {
3971 #if !defined (CS_MODE)
3972  bool skip_flush = false;
3973  DWB_SLOT *p_dwb_slot = NULL;
3974  VPID vpid;
3975  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
3976  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
3977  int error_code;
3978  FILEIO_WRITE_MODE write_mode;
3979 
3980  assert (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES && io_page_p != NULL);
3981 
3982  skip_flush = dwb_is_created ();
3983  if (skip_flush)
3984  {
3985  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL);
3986 
3987  arg.vdes = vol_fd;
3988  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
3989  if (vol_info_p)
3990  {
3991  /* Permanent volumes - uses DWB. */
3992  VPID_SET (&vpid, vol_info_p->volid, page_id);
3993 
3994  io_page_p->prv.volid = vol_info_p->volid;
3995  io_page_p->prv.pageid = page_id;
3996 
3997  error_code = dwb_add_page (thread_p, io_page_p, &vpid, &p_dwb_slot);
3998  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
3999  {
4000  return NULL;
4001  }
4002  else if (p_dwb_slot != NULL)
4003  {
4004  /* The page was successfully added to DWB. It will be written later. */
4005  return io_page_p;
4006  }
4007 
4008  /* DWB disabled, write the page. */
4009  }
4010  /* Not permanent volume - write the page. */
4011  }
4012 
4013  write_mode = skip_flush ? FILEIO_WRITE_NO_COMPENSATE_WRITE : FILEIO_WRITE_DEFAULT_WRITE;
4014 
4015  return fileio_write (thread_p, vol_fd, io_page_p, page_id, page_size, write_mode);
4016 #else
4017  return fileio_write (thread_p, vol_fd, io_page_p, page_id, page_size, FILEIO_WRITE_DEFAULT_WRITE);
4018 #endif
4019 }
4020 
4021 /*
4022  * fileio_os_write () - helper for fileio_write
4023  * return: the number of bytes written is returned. On error, error code.
4024  * vol_fd(in): Volume descriptor
4025  * io_page_p(in): In-memory address where the current content of page resides
4026  * count(in): the number of bytes to be written
4027  * offset(in): starting file offset
4028  *
4029  */
4030 static ssize_t
4031 fileio_os_write (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, void *io_page_p, size_t count, off_t offset)
4032 {
4033 #if !defined (SERVER_MODE)
4034  if (lseek (vol_fd, offset, SEEK_SET) != offset)
4035  {
4036  return ER_FAILED;
4037  }
4038 
4039  /* write the page */
4040  return write (vol_fd, io_page_p, count);
4041 #elif defined (WINDOWS)
4042  // TODO: replace it with WriteFile
4043  int rv, nbytes;
4044  pthread_mutex_t *io_mutex;
4045  static pthread_mutex_t io_mutex_instance = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
4046 
4047  io_mutex = fileio_get_volume_mutex (thread_p, vol_fd);
4048  if (io_mutex == NULL)
4049  {
4050  io_mutex = &io_mutex_instance;
4051  }
4052 
4053  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (io_mutex);
4054  if (rv != 0)
4055  {
4056  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_PTHREAD_MUTEX_LOCK, 0);
4057  return ER_FAILED;
4058  }
4059 
4060  if (lseek (vol_fd, offset, SEEK_SET) != offset)
4061  {
4062  pthread_mutex_unlock (io_mutex);
4063  return ER_FAILED;
4064  }
4065 
4066  /* write the page */
4067  nbytes = write (vol_fd, io_page_p, count);
4068 
4069  pthread_mutex_unlock (io_mutex);
4070 
4071  return (ssize_t) nbytes;
4072 #elif defined (NDEBUG)
4073  /* release mode */
4074  return pwrite (vol_fd, io_page_p, count, offset);
4075 #else
4076  /* server debugging mode */
4077  return pwrite_with_injected_fault (thread_p, vol_fd, io_page_p, count, offset);
4078 #endif
4079 }
4080 
4081 /*
4082  * fileio_write () - WRITE A PAGE TO DISK
4083  * return: io_page_p on success, NULL on failure
4084  * vol_fd(in): Volume descriptor
4085  * io_page_p(in): In-memory address where the current content of page resides
4086  * page_id(in): Page identifier
4087  * page_size(in): Page size
4088  * write_mode(in): FILEIO_WRITE_NO_COMPENSATE_WRITE skips page flush
4089  *
4090  * Note: Write the content of the page described by page_id to disk. The content of the page is stored onto io_page_p
4091  * buffer which is page_size long.
4092  */
4093 void *
4094 fileio_write (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, void *io_page_p, PAGEID page_id, size_t page_size,
4095  FILEIO_WRITE_MODE write_mode)
4096 {
4097 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4098  TSC_TICKS start_tick, end_tick;
4099  TSCTIMEVAL elapsed_time;
4100 #endif
4101  ssize_t nbytes_written;
4102  off_t offset = FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (page_size, page_id);
4103  bool is_retry = true;
4104 
4105 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4106  if (0 < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD))
4107  {
4108  tsc_getticks (&start_tick);
4109  }
4110 #endif
4111 
4112  while (is_retry == true)
4113  {
4114  is_retry = false;
4115 
4116  nbytes_written = fileio_os_write (thread_p, vol_fd, io_page_p, page_size, offset);
4117  if (nbytes_written != (ssize_t) page_size)
4118  {
4119  if (errno == EINTR)
4120  {
4121  is_retry = true;
4122  }
4123  else if (errno == ENOSPC)
4124  {
4125  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE_OUT_OF_SPACE, 2, page_id,
4126  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
4127  return NULL;
4128  }
4129  else
4130  {
4131  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE, 2, page_id,
4132  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
4133  return NULL;
4134  }
4135  }
4136  }
4137 
4138 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4139  if (0 < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD))
4140  {
4141  tsc_getticks (&end_tick);
4142  tsc_elapsed_time_usec (&elapsed_time, end_tick, start_tick);
4143  }
4144 
4145  if (MONITOR_WAITING_THREAD (elapsed_time))
4146  {
4147  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_MNT_WAITING_THREAD, 2, "file write",
4148  prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD));
4149  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "fileio_write: %6d.%06d\n", elapsed_time.tv_sec, elapsed_time.tv_usec);
4150  }
4151 #endif
4152 
4153  if (write_mode == FILEIO_WRITE_DEFAULT_WRITE)
4154  {
4155  fileio_compensate_flush (thread_p, vol_fd, 1);
4156  }
4157 
4158  perfmon_inc_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_FILE_NUM_IOWRITES);
4159 
4160  return io_page_p;
4161 }
4162 
4163 /*
4164  * fileio_read_pages () -
4165  */
4166 void *
4167 fileio_read_pages (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, char *io_pages_p, PAGEID page_id, int num_pages,
4168  size_t page_size)
4169 {
4170 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4171  TSC_TICKS start_tick, end_tick;
4172  TSCTIMEVAL elapsed_time;
4173 #endif
4174  off_t offset;
4175  ssize_t nbytes_read;
4176  size_t nbytes_to_be_read;
4177 
4178 #if defined(WINDOWS) && defined(SERVER_MODE)
4179  int rv;
4180  pthread_mutex_t *io_mutex;
4181  static pthread_mutex_t io_mutex_instance = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
4182 #endif /* WINDOWS && SERVER_MODE */
4183 
4184  assert (num_pages > 0);
4185 
4186  offset = FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (page_size, page_id);
4187  nbytes_to_be_read = ((size_t) page_size) * ((size_t) num_pages);
4188 
4189 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4190  if (0 < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD))
4191  {
4192  tsc_getticks (&start_tick);
4193  }
4194 #endif
4195 
4196  while (nbytes_to_be_read > 0)
4197  {
4198  nbytes_read = fileio_os_read (thread_p, vol_fd, io_pages_p, nbytes_to_be_read, offset);
4199  if (nbytes_read <= 0)
4200  {
4201  if (nbytes_read == 0)
4202  {
4203  return NULL;
4204  }
4205 
4206  switch (errno)
4207  {
4208  case EINTR:
4209  case EAGAIN:
4210  continue;
4211 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
4212  case EOVERFLOW:
4213  return NULL;
4214 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
4215  default:
4216  {
4217  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_READ, 2, page_id,
4218  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
4219  return NULL;
4220  }
4221  }
4222  }
4223 
4224  offset += nbytes_read;
4225  io_pages_p += nbytes_read;
4226  nbytes_to_be_read -= nbytes_read;
4227  }
4228 
4229 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4230  if (0 < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD))
4231  {
4232  tsc_getticks (&end_tick);
4233  tsc_elapsed_time_usec (&elapsed_time, end_tick, start_tick);
4234  }
4235 
4236  if (MONITOR_WAITING_THREAD (elapsed_time))
4237  {
4238  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_MNT_WAITING_THREAD, 2, "file read",
4239  prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD));
4240  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "fileio_read_pages: %6d.%06d\n", elapsed_time.tv_sec, elapsed_time.tv_usec);
4241  }
4242 #endif
4243 
4244  perfmon_inc_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_FILE_NUM_IOREADS);
4245  return io_pages_p;
4246 }
4247 
4248 /*
4249  * fileio_write_pages () - write the content of several contiguous pages to disk
4250  * return: io_page_p on success, NULL on failure
4251  * thread_p(in): Thread entry
4252  * vol_fd(in): Volume descriptor
4253  * io_page_p(in): In-memory address where the pages resides
4254  * page_id(in): First page identifier
4255  * num_pages(in): Number of pages to flush
4256  * page_size(in): Page size
4257  * write_mode(in): FILEIO_WRITE_NO_COMPENSATE_WRITE skips page flush
4258  */
4259 void *
4260 fileio_write_pages (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, char *io_pages_p, PAGEID page_id, int num_pages,
4261  size_t page_size, FILEIO_WRITE_MODE write_mode)
4262 {
4263 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4264  TSC_TICKS start_tick, end_tick;
4265  TSCTIMEVAL elapsed_time;
4266 #endif
4267  off_t offset;
4268  ssize_t nbytes_written;
4269  size_t nbytes_to_be_written;
4270 
4271 #if defined(WINDOWS) && defined(SERVER_MODE)
4272  int rv;
4273  pthread_mutex_t *io_mutex;
4274  static pthread_mutex_t io_mutex_instance = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
4275 #endif /* WINDOWS && SERVER_MODE */
4276 
4277  assert (num_pages > 0);
4278 
4279  offset = FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (page_size, page_id);
4280  nbytes_to_be_written = ((size_t) page_size) * ((size_t) num_pages);
4281 
4282 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4283  if (0 < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD))
4284  {
4285  tsc_getticks (&start_tick);
4286  }
4287 #endif
4288 
4289  while (nbytes_to_be_written > 0)
4290  {
4291  nbytes_written = fileio_os_write (thread_p, vol_fd, io_pages_p, nbytes_to_be_written, offset);
4292  if (nbytes_written <= 0)
4293  {
4294  if (nbytes_written == 0)
4295  {
4296  return NULL;
4297  }
4298 
4299  switch (errno)
4300  {
4301  case EINTR:
4302  case EAGAIN:
4303  continue;
4304 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
4305  case EOVERFLOW:
4306  return NULL;
4307 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
4308  default:
4309  {
4310  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE, 2, page_id,
4311  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
4312  return NULL;
4313  }
4314  }
4315  }
4316 
4317  offset += nbytes_written;
4318  io_pages_p += nbytes_written;
4319  nbytes_to_be_written -= nbytes_written;
4320  }
4321 
4322 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4323  if (0 < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD))
4324  {
4325  tsc_getticks (&end_tick);
4326  tsc_elapsed_time_usec (&elapsed_time, end_tick, start_tick);
4327  }
4328 
4329  if (MONITOR_WAITING_THREAD (elapsed_time))
4330  {
4331  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_MNT_WAITING_THREAD, 2, "file write",
4332  prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD));
4333  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "fileio_write_pages: %6d.%06d\n", elapsed_time.tv_sec, elapsed_time.tv_usec);
4334  }
4335 #endif
4336 
4337  if (write_mode == FILEIO_WRITE_DEFAULT_WRITE)
4338  {
4339  fileio_compensate_flush (thread_p, vol_fd, num_pages);
4340  }
4341 
4342  perfmon_add_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_FILE_NUM_IOWRITES, num_pages);
4343  return io_pages_p;
4344 }
4345 
4346 /*
4347  * fileio_writev () - WRITE A SET OF CONTIGUOUS PAGES TO DISK
4348  * return: io_pgptr on success, NULL on failure
4349  * vol_fd(in): Volume descriptor
4350  * arrayof_io_pgptr(in): An array address to address where the current content of pages reside
4351  * start_page_id(in): Page identifier of first page
4352  * npages(in): Number of consecutive pages
4353  * page_size(in): Page size
4354  *
4355  * Note: Write the content of the consecutive pages described by start_pageid to disk. The content of the pages are
4356  * address by the io_pgptr array. Each io_pgptr buffer is page size long.
4357  *
4358  * io_pgptr[0] -->> start_pageid
4359  * io_pgptr[1] -->> start_pageid + 1
4360  * ...
4361  * io_pgptr[npages - 1] -->> start_pageid + npages - 1
4362  */
4363 void *
4364 fileio_writev (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, void **io_page_array, PAGEID start_page_id, DKNPAGES npages,
4365  size_t page_size)
4366 {
4367  int i;
4368  FILEIO_WRITE_MODE write_mode = FILEIO_WRITE_DEFAULT_WRITE;
4369 
4370 #if !defined (CS_MODE)
4371  write_mode = dwb_is_created () == true ? FILEIO_WRITE_NO_COMPENSATE_WRITE : FILEIO_WRITE_DEFAULT_WRITE;
4372 #endif
4373 
4374  for (i = 0; i < npages; i++)
4375  {
4376  if (fileio_write (thread_p, vol_fd, io_page_array[i], start_page_id + i, page_size, write_mode) == NULL)
4377  {
4378  return NULL;
4379  }
4380  }
4381 
4382  return io_page_array[0];
4383 }
4384 
4385 /*
4386  * fileio_synchronize () - Synchronize a database volume's state with that on disk
4387  * return: vdes or NULL_VOLDES
4388  * vol_fd(in): Volume descriptor
4389  * vlabel(in): Volume label
4390  * sync_dwb(in): FILEIO_SYNC_ALSO_FLUSH_DWB if needs sync dwb
4391  */
4392 int
4393 fileio_synchronize (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, const char *vlabel, FILEIO_SYNC_OPTION sync_dwb)
4394 {
4395  int ret = NO_ERROR;
4396  bool all_sync = false;
4397 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4398  TSC_TICKS start_tick, end_tick;
4399  TSCTIMEVAL elapsed_time;
4400 #endif
4401 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
4402  static pthread_mutex_t inc_cnt_mutex = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
4403  int r;
4404 #endif
4405  static int inc_cnt = 0;
4406 
4407  if (prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_SUPPRESS_FSYNC) > 0)
4408  {
4409 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
4410  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&inc_cnt_mutex);
4411 #endif
4412  if (++inc_cnt >= prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_SUPPRESS_FSYNC))
4413  {
4414  inc_cnt = 0;
4415  }
4416  else
4417  {
4418 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
4419  pthread_mutex_unlock (&inc_cnt_mutex);
4420 #endif
4421  return vol_fd;
4422  }
4423 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
4424  pthread_mutex_unlock (&inc_cnt_mutex);
4425 #endif
4426  }
4427 
4428 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4429  if (0 < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD))
4430  {
4431  tsc_getticks (&start_tick);
4432  }
4433 #endif
4434 
4435 #if !defined (CS_MODE)
4436  if (sync_dwb == FILEIO_SYNC_ALSO_FLUSH_DWB && fileio_is_permanent_volume_descriptor (thread_p, vol_fd))
4437  {
4438  ret = dwb_flush_force (thread_p, &all_sync);
4439  }
4440 #endif
4441 
4442  /* If all_sync is true, everything was synchronized. This happens when DWB is completely flushed. */
4443  if (ret == NO_ERROR && all_sync == false)
4444  {
4445  ret = fsync (vol_fd);
4446  }
4447 
4448 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4449  if (0 < prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD))
4450  {
4451  tsc_getticks (&end_tick);
4452  tsc_elapsed_time_usec (&elapsed_time, end_tick, start_tick);
4453  }
4454 #endif
4455 
4456  if (ret != 0)
4457  {
4458  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_SYNC, 1, (vlabel ? vlabel : "Unknown"));
4459  return NULL_VOLDES;
4460  }
4461  else
4462  {
4463 #if defined (EnableThreadMonitoring)
4464  if (MONITOR_WAITING_THREAD (elapsed_time))
4465  {
4466  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_MNT_WAITING_THREAD, 2, "file sync",
4467  prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_MNT_WAITING_THREAD));
4468  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "fileio_synchronize: %6d.%06d\n", elapsed_time.tv_sec, elapsed_time.tv_usec);
4469  }
4470 #endif
4471 
4472  perfmon_inc_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_FILE_NUM_IOSYNCHES);
4473  return vol_fd;
4474  }
4475 }
4476 
4477 /*
4478  * fileio_synchronize_bg_archive_volume () -
4479  * return:
4480  */
4481 static int
4482 fileio_synchronize_bg_archive_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
4483 {
4484  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
4485 
4486  arg.vol_id = LOG_DBLOG_BG_ARCHIVE_VOLID;
4487  (void) fileio_traverse_system_volume (thread_p, fileio_synchronize_sys_volume, &arg);
4488  return NO_ERROR;
4489 }
4490 
4491 /*
4492  * fileio_synchronize_sys_volume () -
4493  * return:
4494  * vol_info_p(in):
4495  */
4496 static bool
4497 fileio_synchronize_sys_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO * sys_vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg)
4498 {
4499  bool found = false;
4500 
4501  if (sys_vol_info_p->vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
4502  {
4503  /* sync when match is found or arg.vol_id is given as NULL_VOLID for all sys volumes. */
4504  if (arg->vol_id == NULL_VOLID)
4505  {
4506  /* fall through */
4507  ;
4508  }
4509  else if (sys_vol_info_p->volid == arg->vol_id)
4510  {
4511  found = true;
4512  }
4513  else
4514  {
4515  /* irrelevant volume */
4516  return false;
4517  }
4518 
4519 
4520  /* System volume. No need to sync DWB. */
4521  fileio_synchronize (thread_p, sys_vol_info_p->vdes, sys_vol_info_p->vlabel, FILEIO_SYNC_ONLY);
4522  }
4523 
4524  return found;
4525 }
4526 
4527 /*
4528  * fileio_synchronize_volume () -
4529  * return:
4530  * vol_info_p(in):
4531  *
4532  * Note : This function does not synchronize DWB.
4533  */
4534 static bool
4535 fileio_synchronize_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg)
4536 {
4537  bool found = false;
4538 
4539  if (vol_info_p->vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
4540  {
4541  /* sync when match is found or arg.vol_id is given as NULL_VOLID for all sys volumes. */
4542  if (arg->vol_id == NULL_VOLID)
4543  {
4544  /* fall through */
4545  ;
4546  }
4547  else if (vol_info_p->volid == arg->vol_id)
4548  {
4549  found = true;
4550  }
4551  else
4552  {
4553  /* irrelevant volume */
4554  return false;
4555  }
4556 
4557  fileio_synchronize (thread_p, vol_info_p->vdes, vol_info_p->vlabel, FILEIO_SYNC_ONLY);
4558  }
4559 
4560  return found;
4561 }
4562 
4563 /*
4564  * fileio_synchronize_all () - Synchronize all database volumes with disk
4565  * return:
4566  * include_log(in):
4567  */
4568 int
4569 fileio_synchronize_all (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, bool is_include)
4570 {
4571  int success = NO_ERROR;
4572  bool all_sync = false;
4573  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
4574 #if defined (SERVER_MODE) || defined (SA_MODE)
4575  PERF_UTIME_TRACKER time_track;
4576 
4577  PERF_UTIME_TRACKER_START (thread_p, &time_track);
4578 #endif /* defined (SERVER_MODE) || defined (SA_MODE) */
4579 
4580  arg.vol_id = NULL_VOLID;
4581 
4582  er_stack_push ();
4583 
4584  if (is_include)
4585  {
4586  /* Flush logs. */
4587  (void) fileio_traverse_system_volume (thread_p, fileio_synchronize_sys_volume, &arg);
4588  }
4589 
4590 #if !defined (CS_MODE)
4591  /* Flush DWB before volume data. */
4592  success = dwb_flush_force (thread_p, &all_sync);
4593 #endif
4594 
4595  /* Check whether the volumes were flushed. */
4596  if (success == NO_ERROR && all_sync == false)
4597  {
4598  /* Flush volume data. */
4599  (void) fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (thread_p, fileio_synchronize_volume, &arg);
4600 
4601  if (er_errid () == ER_IO_SYNC)
4602  {
4603  success = ER_FAILED;
4604  }
4605  }
4606 
4607  er_stack_pop ();
4608 
4609 #if defined (SERVER_MODE) || defined (SA_MODE)
4610  PERF_UTIME_TRACKER_TIME (thread_p, &time_track, PSTAT_FILE_IOSYNC_ALL);
4611 #endif /* defined (SERVER_MODE) || defined (SA_MODE) */
4612 
4613  return success;
4614 }
4615 
4616 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
4617 /*
4618  * fileio_read_user_area () - READ A PORTION OF THE USER AREA OF THE GIVEN PAGE
4619  * return: area on success, NULL on failure
4620  * vdes(in): Volume descriptor
4621  * pageid(in): Page identifier
4622  * start_offset(in): Start offset of interested content in page
4623  * nbytes(in): Length of the content of page to copy
4624  * area(out):
4625  *
4626  * Note: Copy a portion of the content of the user area of the page described
4627  * by pageid onto the given area. The area must be big enough to hold
4628  * the needed content
4629  */
4630 void *
4631 fileio_read_user_area (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, PAGEID page_id, off_t start_offset, size_t nbytes,
4632  void *area_p)
4633 {
4634  off_t offset;
4635  bool is_retry = true;
4636  FILEIO_PAGE *io_page_p;
4637 #if defined(WINDOWS) && defined(SERVER_MODE)
4638  pthread_mutex_t io_mutex;
4639  int rv;
4640  int actual_nread;
4641 #endif /* WINDOWS && SERVER_MODE */
4642 
4643  io_page_p = (FILEIO_PAGE *) malloc (IO_PAGESIZE);
4644  if (io_page_p == NULL)
4645  {
4646  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) IO_PAGESIZE);
4647  return NULL;
4648  }
4649 
4650  /* Find the offset intop the user area on the desired page */
4651  offset = FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (IO_PAGESIZE, page_id);
4652 
4653  while (is_retry == true)
4654  {
4655  is_retry = false;
4656 
4657 #if !defined(SERVER_MODE)
4658  /* Locate the desired page */
4659  if (lseek (vol_fd, offset, SEEK_SET) != offset)
4660  {
4661  if (io_page_p != NULL)
4662  {
4663  free_and_init (io_page_p);
4664  }
4665 
4666  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_READ, 2, page_id,
4667  fileio_get_volume_label (fileio_get_volume_id (vol_fd), PEEK));
4668  return NULL;
4669  }
4670 
4671  /* Read the desired page */
4672  if (read (vol_fd, io_page_p, IO_PAGESIZE) != IO_PAGESIZE)
4673 #elif defined(WINDOWS)
4674  io_mutex = fileio_get_volume_mutex (thread_p, vol_fd);
4675  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&io_mutex);
4676  if (rv != 0)
4677  {
4678  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, rv, 0);
4679  return NULL;
4680  }
4681 
4682  /* Locate the desired page */
4683  if (lseek (vol_fd, offset, SEEK_SET) != offset)
4684  {
4685  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_READ, 2, page_id,
4686  fileio_get_volume_label (fileio_get_volume_id (vol_fd), PEEK));
4687  pthread_mutex_unlock (&io_mutex);
4688  return NULL;
4689  }
4690 
4691  /* Read the desired page */
4692  actual_nread = read (vol_fd, io_page_p, IO_PAGESIZE);
4693  if (pthread_mutex_unlock (&io_mutex) != 0)
4694  {
4695  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_PTHREAD_MUTEX_UNLOCK, 0);
4696  return NULL;
4697  }
4698  if (actual_nread != IO_PAGESIZE)
4699 #else /* WINDOWS */
4700  if (pread (vol_fd, io_page_p, IO_PAGESIZE, offset) != IO_PAGESIZE)
4701 #endif /* WINDOWS */
4702  {
4703  if (errno == EINTR)
4704  {
4705  is_retry = true;
4706  }
4707  else
4708  {
4709  if (io_page_p != NULL)
4710  {
4711  free_and_init (io_page_p);
4712  }
4713 
4714  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_READ, 2, page_id,
4715  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
4716  return NULL;
4717  }
4718  }
4719  }
4720 
4721  memcpy (area_p, io_page_p->page + start_offset, nbytes);
4722 
4723  if (io_page_p != NULL)
4724  {
4725  free_and_init (io_page_p);
4726  }
4727 
4728  perfmon_inc_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_FILE_NUM_IOREADS);
4729  return area_p;
4730 }
4731 
4732 /*
4733  * fileio_write_user_area () - READ A PORTION OF THE USER AREA OF THE GIVEN PAGE
4734  * return: area on success, NULL on failure
4735  * vdes(in): Volume descriptor
4736  * pageid(in): Page identifier
4737  * start_offset(in): Start offset of interested content in page
4738  * nbytes(in): Length of the content of page to copy
4739  * area(out):
4740  *
4741  * Note: Copy a portion of the content of the user area of the page described
4742  * by pageid onto the given area. The area must be big enough to hold
4743  * the needed content
4744  */
4745 void *
4746 fileio_write_user_area (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd, PAGEID page_id, off_t start_offset, int nbytes,
4747  void *area_p)
4748 {
4749  off_t offset;
4750  bool is_retry = true;
4751  FILEIO_PAGE *io_page_p = NULL;
4752  void *write_p;
4753  struct stat stat_buf;
4754 #if defined(WINDOWS) && defined(SERVER_MODE)
4755  int actual_nwrite, rv;
4756  pthread_mutex_t io_mutex;
4757 #endif /* WINDOWS && SERVER_MODE */
4758 
4759  if (fstat (vol_fd, &stat_buf) != 0)
4760  {
4761  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE, 2, page_id,
4762  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
4763  return NULL;
4764  }
4765 
4766 #if defined(WINDOWS)
4767  /* Find the offset intop the user area on the desired page */
4768  offset = (FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (IO_PAGESIZE, page_id) + offsetof (FILEIO_PAGE, page));
4769 
4770  /* Add the starting offset */
4771  offset += start_offset;
4772 
4773  write_p = area_p;
4774 #else /* WINDOWS */
4775  if (S_ISREG (stat_buf.st_mode)) /* regular file */
4776  {
4777  /* Find the offset intop the user area on the desired page */
4778  offset = (FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (IO_PAGESIZE, page_id) + offsetof (FILEIO_PAGE, page));
4779 
4780  /* Add the starting offset */
4781  offset += start_offset;
4782 
4783  write_p = area_p;
4784 
4785  }
4786  else if (S_ISCHR (stat_buf.st_mode)) /* Raw device */
4787  {
4788  offset = FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (IO_PAGESIZE, page_id);
4789  if (nbytes != DB_PAGESIZE)
4790  {
4791  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE, 2, page_id,
4792  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
4793  return NULL;
4794 
4795  }
4796 
4797  io_page_p = (FILEIO_PAGE *) malloc (IO_PAGESIZE);
4798  if (io_page_p == NULL)
4799  {
4800  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) IO_PAGESIZE);
4801  return NULL;
4802  }
4803 
4804  (void) fileio_initialize_res (thread_p, io_page_p, IO_PAGESIZE);
4805  memcpy (io_page_p->page, area_p, nbytes);
4806 
4807  write_p = (void *) io_page_p;
4808  nbytes = IO_PAGESIZE;
4809  }
4810  else
4811  {
4812  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE, 2, page_id,
4813  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
4814  return NULL;
4815  }
4816 #endif /* WINDOWS */
4817 
4818  while (is_retry == true)
4819  {
4820  is_retry = false;
4821 
4822  nbytes_written = fileio_os_write (thread_p, vol_fd, write_p, nbytes, offset);
4823  if (nbytes_written != nbytes)
4824  {
4825  if (errno == EINTR)
4826  {
4827  is_retry = true;
4828  }
4829  else if (errno == ENOSPC)
4830  {
4831  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE_OUT_OF_SPACE, 2, page_id,
4832  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
4833  goto error;
4834  }
4835  else
4836  {
4837  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE, 2, page_id,
4838  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (vol_fd, PEEK));
4839  goto error;
4840  }
4841  }
4842  }
4843 
4844  if (io_page_p != NULL)
4845  {
4846  free_and_init (io_page_p);
4847  }
4848 
4849  fileio_compensate_flush (thread_p, vol_fd, 1);
4850  perfmon_inc_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_FILE_NUM_IOWRITES);
4851  return area_p;
4852 
4853 error:
4854  if (io_page_p != NULL)
4855  {
4856  free_and_init (io_page_p);
4857  }
4858 
4859  return NULL;
4860 }
4861 #endif
4862 
4863 /*
4864  * fileio_get_number_of_volume_pages () - Find the size of the volume in number of pages
4865  * return: Num pages
4866  * vol_fd(in): Volume descriptor
4867  */
4868 DKNPAGES
4869 fileio_get_number_of_volume_pages (int vol_fd, size_t page_size)
4870 {
4871  off_t offset;
4872 
4873  offset = lseek (vol_fd, 0L, SEEK_END);
4874  return (DKNPAGES) (offset / page_size);
4875 
4876 }
4877 
4878 /*
4879  * fileio_get_number_of_partition_free_pages () - Find the number of free pages in the given
4880  * OS disk partition
4881  * return: number of free pages
4882  * path(in): Path to disk partition
4883  *
4884  * Note: The number of pages is in the size of the database system not
4885  * the size of the OS system.
4886  */
4887 int
4888 fileio_get_number_of_partition_free_pages (const char *path_p, size_t page_size)
4889 {
4890 #if defined(WINDOWS)
4891  return (free_space (path_p, (int) IO_PAGESIZE));
4892 #else /* WINDOWS */
4893  int vol_fd;
4894  INT64 npages = -1;
4895 
4896 #if defined(SOLARIS)
4897  struct statvfs buf;
4898 #else /* SOLARIS */
4899  struct statfs buf;
4900 #endif /* SOLARIS */
4901 
4902 #if defined(SOLARIS)
4903  if (statvfs (path_p, &buf) == -1)
4904  {
4905 #elif defined(AIX)
4906  if (statfs ((char *) path_p, &buf) == -1)
4907  {
4908 #else /* AIX */
4909  if (statfs (path_p, &buf) == -1)
4910  {
4911 #endif /* AIX */
4912 
4913  if (errno == ENOENT
4914  && ((vol_fd = fileio_open (path_p, FILEIO_DISK_FORMAT_MODE, FILEIO_DISK_PROTECTION_MODE)) != NULL_VOLDES))
4915  {
4916  /* The given file did not exist. We create it for temporary consumption then it is removed */
4917  npages = fileio_get_number_of_partition_free_pages (path_p, page_size);
4918  /* Close the file and remove it */
4919  fileio_close (vol_fd);
4920  (void) remove (path_p);
4921  }
4922  else
4923  {
4924  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, path_p);
4925  }
4926  }
4927  else
4928  {
4929 #if defined(SOLARIS)
4930  npages = (buf.f_bavail / page_size) * ((off_t) buf.f_frsize);
4931 #else /* SOLARIS */
4932  npages = (buf.f_bavail / page_size) * ((off_t) buf.f_bsize);
4933 #endif /* SOLARIS */
4934 
4935  if (npages < 0 || npages > INT_MAX)
4936  {
4937  npages = INT_MAX;
4938  }
4939  }
4940 
4941  if (npages < 0)
4942  {
4943  return -1;
4944  }
4945  else
4946  {
4947  assert (npages <= INT_MAX);
4948 
4949  return (int) npages;
4950  }
4951 
4952 #endif /* WINDOWS */
4953 }
4954 
4955 /*
4956  * fileio_get_number_of_partition_free_pages () - document me!
4957  *
4958  * return : Number of free sectors
4959  * path_p (in) : Path to disk partition
4960  */
4961 DKNSECTS
4962 fileio_get_number_of_partition_free_sectors (const char *path_p)
4963 {
4964 #if defined(WINDOWS)
4965  return (DKNSECTS) free_space (path_p, IO_SECTORSIZE);
4966 #else /* WINDOWS */
4967  int vol_fd;
4968  INT64 nsects = -1;
4969 
4970 #if defined(SOLARIS)
4971  struct statvfs buf;
4972 #else /* SOLARIS */
4973  struct statfs buf;
4974 #endif /* SOLARIS */
4975 
4976 #if defined(SOLARIS)
4977  if (statvfs (path_p, &buf) == -1)
4978  {
4979 #elif defined(AIX)
4980  if (statfs ((char *) path_p, &buf) == -1)
4981  {
4982 #else /* AIX */
4983  if (statfs (path_p, &buf) == -1)
4984  {
4985 #endif /* AIX */
4986 
4987  if (errno == ENOENT
4988  && ((vol_fd = fileio_open (path_p, FILEIO_DISK_FORMAT_MODE, FILEIO_DISK_PROTECTION_MODE)) != NULL_VOLDES))
4989  {
4990  /* The given file did not exist. We create it for temporary consumption then it is removed */
4991  nsects = fileio_get_number_of_partition_free_sectors (path_p);
4992  /* Close the file and remove it */
4993  fileio_close (vol_fd);
4994  (void) remove (path_p);
4995  }
4996  else
4997  {
4998  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, path_p);
4999  }
5000  }
5001  else
5002  {
5003 #if defined(SOLARIS)
5004  nsects = (buf.f_bavail / IO_SECTORSIZE) * ((off_t) buf.f_frsize);
5005 #else /* SOLARIS */
5006  nsects = (buf.f_bavail / IO_SECTORSIZE) * ((off_t) buf.f_bsize);
5007 #endif /* SOLARIS */
5008 
5009  if (nsects < 0 || nsects > INT_MAX)
5010  {
5011  nsects = INT_MAX;
5012  }
5013  }
5014 
5015  if (nsects < 0)
5016  {
5017  return -1;
5018  }
5019  else
5020  {
5021  assert (nsects <= INT_MAX);
5022 
5023  return (DKNSECTS) nsects;
5024  }
5025 
5026 #endif /* WINDOWS */
5027 }
5028 
5029 /*
5030  * fileio_rename () - Rename the volume from "old_vlabel" to "new_vlabel"
5031  * return: new_vlabel or NULL in case of error
5032  * volid(in): Volume Identifier
5033  * old_vlabel(in): Old volume label
5034  * new_vlabel(in): New volume label
5035  */
5036 const char *
5037 fileio_rename (VOLID vol_id, const char *old_label_p, const char *new_label_p)
5038 {
5039 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
5040  if (fileio_get_volume_descriptor (vol_id) != NULL_VOLDES)
5041  {
5042  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "io_rename: SYSTEM ERROR..The volume %s must be dismounted to rename a volume...");
5043  return NULL;
5044  }
5045 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
5046 
5047  if (os_rename_file (old_label_p, new_label_p) != NO_ERROR)
5048  {
5049  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_RENAME_FAIL, 2, old_label_p, new_label_p);
5050  return NULL;
5051  }
5052  return new_label_p;
5053 }
5054 
5055 /*
5056  * fileio_is_volume_exist () - Find if a volume exist
5057  * return: true/false
5058  * vlabel(in): Volume label
5059  */
5060 bool
5061 fileio_is_volume_exist (const char *vol_label_p)
5062 {
5063  int vol_fd;
5064 
5065 #if !defined(CS_MODE)
5066  /* Is volume already mounted ? */
5067  vol_fd = fileio_find_volume_descriptor_with_label (vol_label_p);
5068  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
5069  {
5070  return true;
5071  }
5072 #endif /* !CS_MODE */
5073 
5074  /* Check the existance of the file by opening the file */
5075  vol_fd = fileio_open (vol_label_p, O_RDONLY, 0);
5076  if (vol_fd == NULL_VOLDES)
5077  {
5078  if (errno == ENOENT)
5079  {
5080  return false;
5081  }
5082  }
5083  else
5084  {
5085  fileio_close (vol_fd);
5086  }
5087 
5088  return true;
5089 }
5090 
5091 /*
5092  * fileio_is_volume_exist_and_file () - Find if a volume exist and is a regular file
5093  * return: true/false
5094  * vlabel(in): Volume label
5095  *
5096  * Note: This is to differentiate between directories, raw devices, and files.
5097  */
5098 bool
5099 fileio_is_volume_exist_and_file (const char *vol_label_p)
5100 {
5101  int vol_fd;
5102  struct stat stbuf;
5103 
5104  /* Is volume already mounted ? */
5105  vol_fd = fileio_find_volume_descriptor_with_label (vol_label_p);
5106  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
5107  {
5108  return true;
5109  }
5110 
5111  if (stat (vol_label_p, &stbuf) != -1 && S_ISREG (stbuf.st_mode))
5112  {
5113  return true;
5114  }
5115 
5116  return false;
5117 }
5118 
5119 static char *
5120 fileio_check_file_exist (char *name_p, char *new_guess_path_p, int check_size, int *max_name_size_p)
5121 {
5122  char *tmp_name_p;
5123  int vol_fd = NULL_VOLDES;
5124 
5125  tmp_name_p = name_p - (*max_name_size_p - check_size + 1);
5126  *tmp_name_p = '\0';
5127 
5128  vol_fd = fileio_open (new_guess_path_p, O_RDONLY, 0);
5129  if (vol_fd == NULL_VOLDES)
5130  {
5131  vol_fd = fileio_open (new_guess_path_p, FILEIO_DISK_FORMAT_MODE, FILEIO_DISK_PROTECTION_MODE);
5132  if (vol_fd == NULL_VOLDES && errno == ENAMETOOLONG)
5133  {
5134  *max_name_size_p = check_size + 1;
5135  name_p = tmp_name_p;
5136  }
5137  else
5138  {
5139  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
5140  {
5141  fileio_close (vol_fd);
5142  (void) remove (new_guess_path_p);
5143  }
5144  *tmp_name_p = 'x';
5145  }
5146  }
5147  else
5148  {
5149  *tmp_name_p = 'x';
5150  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
5151  {
5152  fileio_close (vol_fd);
5153  }
5154  }
5155 
5156  return name_p;
5157 }
5158 
5159 static char *
5160 fileio_check_file_is_same (char *name_p, char *new_guess_path_p, int check_size, int *max_name_size_p, struct stat *buf)
5161 {
5162  char *tmp_name_p;
5163 
5164  tmp_name_p = name_p - (*max_name_size_p - check_size + 1);
5165  *tmp_name_p = '\0';
5166 
5167  if (stat (new_guess_path_p, &buf[1]) == 0 && buf[0].st_ino == buf[1].st_ino)
5168  {
5169  *max_name_size_p = check_size + 1;
5170  name_p = tmp_name_p;
5171  }
5172  else
5173  {
5174  *tmp_name_p = 'x';
5175  }
5176 
5177  return name_p;
5178 }
5179 
5180 /*
5181  * fileio_get_primitive_way_max () - Find the longest names of files and
5182  * path names that can be given for
5183  * the given file system (path) in a
5184  * primitive way
5185  * return: filename max
5186  * path(in): Path to directory or file name
5187  * filename_max(out): the longest name that could be given
5188  * pathname_max(out): the longest path that could be given
5189  *
