5190  * Note: This function should only be used when the values cannot be
5191  * determine using pathconf.
5192  */
5193 static int
5194 fileio_get_primitive_way_max (const char *path_p, long int *file_name_max_p, long int *path_name_max_p)
5195 {
5196  static char last_guess_path[PATH_MAX] = { '\0' };
5197  static int max_name_size = -1;
5198  char new_guess_path[PATH_MAX];
5199  char *name_p;
5200  int check256, check14;
5201  bool is_remove = false;
5202  int vol_fd = NULL_VOLDES;
5203  struct stat buf[2];
5204  int i;
5205  int success;
5206 
5207  *file_name_max_p = NAME_MAX;
5208  *path_name_max_p = PATH_MAX;
5209 
5210  if (*file_name_max_p > *path_name_max_p)
5211  {
5212  *file_name_max_p = *path_name_max_p;
5213  }
5214 
5215  /* Verify the above compilation guesses */
5216 
5217  strncpy (new_guess_path, path_p, PATH_MAX);
5218  name_p = strrchr (new_guess_path, '/');
5219 #if defined(WINDOWS)
5220  {
5221  char *tmp_name = strrchr (new_guess_path, '\\');
5222  if (name_p < tmp_name)
5223  name_p = tmp_name;
5224  }
5225 #endif /* WINDOWS */
5226 
5227  if (name_p != NULL)
5228  {
5229  *++name_p = '\0';
5230  }
5231  else
5232  {
5233  name_p = new_guess_path;
5234  }
5235 
5236  if (max_name_size != -1 && strcmp (last_guess_path, new_guess_path) == 0)
5237  {
5238  return *file_name_max_p = max_name_size;
5239  }
5240 
5241  for (max_name_size = 1, i = (int) strlen (new_guess_path) + 1;
5242  max_name_size < *file_name_max_p && i < *path_name_max_p; max_name_size++, i++)
5243  {
5244  *name_p++ = 'x';
5245  }
5246 
5247  *name_p++ = '\0';
5248 
5249  /* Start from the back until you find a file which is different. The assumption is that the files do not exist. */
5250 
5251  check256 = 1;
5252  check14 = 1;
5253  while (max_name_size > 1)
5254  {
5255  vol_fd = fileio_open (new_guess_path, O_RDONLY, 0);
5256  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
5257  {
5258  /* The file already exist */
5259  is_remove = false;
5260  break;
5261  }
5262  else
5263  {
5264  /* The file did not exist. Create the file and at the end remove the file */
5265  is_remove = true;
5266  vol_fd = fileio_open (new_guess_path, FILEIO_DISK_FORMAT_MODE, FILEIO_DISK_PROTECTION_MODE);
5267  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
5268  {
5269  break;
5270  }
5271 
5272  if (errno != ENAMETOOLONG)
5273  {
5274  goto error;
5275  }
5276 
5277  /*
5278  * Name truncation is not allowed. Most Unix systems accept
5279  * filename of 256 or 14.
5280  * Assume one of this for now
5281  */
5282  if (max_name_size > 257 && check256 == 1)
5283  {
5284  check256 = 0;
5285  name_p = fileio_check_file_exist (name_p, new_guess_path, 256, &max_name_size);
5286  }
5287  else if (max_name_size > 15 && check14 == 1)
5288  {
5289  check14 = 0;
5290  name_p = fileio_check_file_exist (name_p, new_guess_path, 14, &max_name_size);
5291  }
5292  *name_p-- = '\0';
5293  max_name_size--;
5294  }
5295  }
5296 
5297  strncpy (last_guess_path, new_guess_path, PATH_MAX);
5298 
5299  if (vol_fd != NULL_VOLDES)
5300  {
5301  fileio_close (vol_fd);
5302  if (stat (new_guess_path, &buf[0]) == -1)
5303  {
5304  goto error;
5305  }
5306  }
5307  else
5308  {
5309  goto error;
5310  }
5311 
5312  /*
5313  * Most Unix system are either 256 or 14. Do a quick check to see if 15
5314  * is the same than current value. If it is, set maxname to 15 and decrement
5315  * name.
5316  */
5317 
5318  check256 = 1;
5319  check14 = 1;
5320  for (; max_name_size > 1; max_name_size--)
5321  {
5322  *name_p-- = '\0';
5323  if ((success = stat (new_guess_path, &buf[1])) == 0 && buf[0].st_ino == buf[1].st_ino)
5324  {
5325  /*
5326  * Same file. Most Unix system allow either 256 or 14 for filenames.
5327  * Perform a quick check to see if we can speed up the checking
5328  * process
5329  */
5330 
5331  if (max_name_size > 257 && check256 == 1)
5332  {
5333  check256 = 0;
5334  name_p = fileio_check_file_is_same (name_p, new_guess_path, 256, &max_name_size, buf);
5335  /* Check if the name with 257 is the same. If it is advance the to 256 */
5336  }
5337  else if (max_name_size > 15 && check14 == 1)
5338  {
5339  check14 = 0;
5340  name_p = fileio_check_file_is_same (name_p, new_guess_path, 14, &max_name_size, buf);
5341  }
5342  }
5343  else
5344  {
5345  if (success == 0)
5346  {
5347  continue;
5348  }
5349  else if (errno == ENOENT)
5350  {
5351  /* The file did not exist or the file is different. Therefore, previous maxname is the maximum name */
5352  max_name_size++;
5353  break;
5354  }
5355 
5356  goto error;
5357  }
5358  }
5359 
5360  /* The length has been found */
5361  if (is_remove == true)
5362  {
5363  (void) remove (last_guess_path);
5364  }
5365 
5366  name_p = strrchr (last_guess_path, '/');
5367 #if defined(WINDOWS)
5368  {
5369  char *tmp_name = strrchr (last_guess_path, '\\');
5370  if (name_p < tmp_name)
5371  {
5372  name_p = tmp_name;
5373  }
5374  }
5375 #endif /* WINDOWS */
5376  if (name_p != NULL)
5377  {
5378  *++name_p = '\0';
5379  }
5380 
5381  /* Plus 2 since we start with zero and we need to include null character */
5382  max_name_size = max_name_size + 2;
5383 
5384  return *file_name_max_p = max_name_size;
5385 
5386 error:
5387  if (is_remove == true)
5388  {
5389  (void) remove (last_guess_path);
5390  }
5391 
5392  max_name_size = -1;
5393  *path_name_max_p = -1;
5394  *file_name_max_p = -1;
5395 
5396  return -1;
5397 }
5398 
5399 /*
5400  * fileio_get_max_name () - Find the longest names of files and path
5401  * names that can be given for the given file
5402  * system (path)
5403  * return: filename max
5404  * path(in): Path to directory or file name
5405  * filename_max(out): the longest name that could be given
5406  * pathname_max(out): the longest path that could be given
5407  *
5408  * Note: The main goal of this function is to respect the limits that
5409  * the database system is using at compile time (e.g., variables
5410  * defined with PATH_MAX) and at run time. For example, if
5411  * the constant FILENAME_MAX cannot be used to detect long names
5412  * since this value at compilation time may be different from the
5413  * value at execution time (e.g., at other installation). If we
5414  * use the compiled value, it may be possible that we will be
5415  * removing a file when a new one is created when truncation of
5416  * filenames is allowed at the running file system.
5417  * In addition, it is possible that such limits may differ across
5418  * file systems, device boundaries. For example, Unix System V
5419  * uses a maximum of 14 characters for file names, and Unix BSD
5420  * uses 255. On this implementations, we are forced to use 14
5421  * characters.
5422  * The functions returns the minimum of the compilation and run
5423  * time for both filename and pathname.
5424  */
5425 int
5426 fileio_get_max_name (const char *given_path_p, long int *file_name_max_p, long int *path_name_max_p)
5427 {
5428  char new_path[PATH_MAX];
5429  const char *path_p;
5430  char *name_p;
5431  struct stat stbuf;
5432 
5433  /* Errno need to be reset to find out if the values are not handle */
5434  errno = 0;
5435  path_p = given_path_p;
5436 
5437  *file_name_max_p = pathconf ((char *) path_p, _PC_NAME_MAX);
5438  *path_name_max_p = pathconf ((char *) path_p, _PC_PATH_MAX);
5439 
5440  if ((*file_name_max_p < 0 || *path_name_max_p < 0) && (errno == ENOENT || errno == EINVAL))
5441  {
5442  /*
5443  * The above values may not be accepted for that path. The path may be
5444  * a file instead of a directory, try it with the directory since some
5445  * implementations cannot answer the above question when the path is a
5446  * file
5447  */
5448 
5449  if (stat (path_p, &stbuf) != -1 && ((stbuf.st_mode & S_IFMT) != S_IFDIR))
5450  {
5451  /* Try it with the directory instead */
5452  strncpy (new_path, given_path_p, PATH_MAX);
5453  name_p = strrchr (new_path, '/');
5454 #if defined(WINDOWS)
5455  {
5456  char *tmp_name = strrchr (new_path, '\\');
5457  if (name_p < tmp_name)
5458  name_p = tmp_name;
5459  }
5460 #endif /* WINDOWS */
5461  if (name_p != NULL)
5462  {
5463  *name_p = '\0';
5464  }
5465  path_p = new_path;
5466 
5467  *file_name_max_p = pathconf ((char *) path_p, _PC_NAME_MAX);
5468  *path_name_max_p = pathconf ((char *) path_p, _PC_PATH_MAX);
5469 
5470  path_p = given_path_p;
5471  }
5472  }
5473 
5474  if (*file_name_max_p < 0 || *path_name_max_p < 0)
5475  {
5476  /* If errno is zero, the values are indeterminate */
5477  (void) fileio_get_primitive_way_max (path_p, file_name_max_p, path_name_max_p);
5478  }
5479 
5480  /* Make sure that we do not overpass compilation structures */
5481  if (*file_name_max_p < 0 || *file_name_max_p > NAME_MAX)
5482  {
5483  *file_name_max_p = NAME_MAX;
5484  }
5485 
5486  if (*path_name_max_p < 0 || *path_name_max_p > PATH_MAX)
5487  {
5488  *path_name_max_p = PATH_MAX;
5489  }
5490 
5491  return *file_name_max_p;
5492 }
5493 
5494 /*
5495  * fileio_get_base_file_name () - Find start of basename in given filename
5496  * return: basename
5497  * fullname(in): Fullname of file
5498  */
5499 const char *
5500 fileio_get_base_file_name (const char *full_name_p)
5501 {
5502  const char *no_path_name_p;
5503 
5504  no_path_name_p = strrchr (full_name_p, PATH_SEPARATOR);
5505 #if defined(WINDOWS)
5506  {
5507  const char *nn_tmp = strrchr (full_name_p, '/');
5508  if (no_path_name_p < nn_tmp)
5509  {
5510  no_path_name_p = nn_tmp;
5511  }
5512  }
5513 #endif /* WINDOWS */
5514  if (no_path_name_p == NULL)
5515  {
5516  no_path_name_p = full_name_p;
5517  }
5518  else
5519  {
5520  no_path_name_p++; /* Skip to the name */
5521  }
5522 
5523  return no_path_name_p;
5524 }
5525 
5526 /*
5527  * fileio_get_directory_path () - Find directory path of given file. That is copy all but the
5528  * basename of filename
5529  * return: path
5530  * path(out): The path of the file
5531  * fullname(in): Fullname of file
5532  */
5533 char *
5534 fileio_get_directory_path (char *path_p, const char *full_name_p)
5535 {
5536  const char *base_p;
5537  size_t path_size;
5538 
5539  base_p = fileio_get_base_file_name (full_name_p);
5540 
5541  assert (base_p >= full_name_p);
5542 
5543  if (base_p == full_name_p)
5544  {
5545  /* Same pointer, the file does not contain a path/directory portion. Use the current directory */
5546  if (getcwd (path_p, PATH_MAX) == NULL)
5547  {
5548  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CWD_FAIL, 0);
5549  *path_p = '\0';
5550  }
5551  }
5552  else
5553  {
5554  path_size = (size_t) (base_p - full_name_p - 1);
5555  if (path_size > PATH_MAX)
5556  {
5557  path_size = PATH_MAX;
5558  }
5559  memcpy (path_p, full_name_p, path_size);
5560  path_p[path_size] = '\0';
5561  }
5562 
5563  return path_p;
5564 }
5565 
5566 /*
5567  * fileio_get_volume_max_suffix () -
5568  * return:
5569  */
5570 int
5571 fileio_get_volume_max_suffix (void)
5572 {
5573  return FILEIO_MAX_SUFFIX_LENGTH;
5574 }
5575 
5576 /*
5577  * fileio_make_volume_lock_name () - Build the name of volumes
5578  * return: void
5579  * vol_lockname(out):
5580  * vol_fullname(in):
5581  *
5582  * Note: The caller must have enough space to store the name of the volume
5583  * that is constructed(sprintf). It is recommended to have at least
5584  * DB_MAX_PATH_LENGTH length.
5585  */
5586 static void
5587 fileio_make_volume_lock_name (char *vol_lock_name_p, const char *vol_full_name_p)
5588 {
5589  sprintf (vol_lock_name_p, "%s%s", vol_full_name_p, FILEIO_VOLLOCK_SUFFIX);
5590 }
5591

5593  * fileio_make_volume_info_name () - Build the name of volumes

5596  * db_fullname(in):
5597  *
5598  * Note: The caller must have enough space to store the name of the volume
5599  * that is constructed(sprintf). It is recommended to have at least
5600  * DB_MAX_PATH_LENGTH length.
5601  */
5602 void
5603 fileio_make_volume_info_name (char *vol_info_name_p, const char *db_full_name_p)

5606 }
5607 
5608 /*
5609  * fileio_make_volume_ext_name () - Build the name of volumes
5610  * return: void

5612  * ext_path(in):
5613  * ext_name(in):
5614  * volid(in):
5615  *
5616  * Note: The caller must have enough space to store the name of the volume
5617  * that is constructed(sprintf). It is recommended to have at least
5618  * DB_MAX_PATH_LENGTH length.
5619  */
5620 void
5621 fileio_make_volume_ext_name (char *vol_ext_full_name_p, const char *ext_path_p, const char *ext_name_p, VOLID vol_id)

5624  FILEIO_VOLEXT_PREFIX, vol_id);
5625 }

5642 }

5663  * fileio_make_log_active_name () - Build the name of volumes

5680 
5681 /*
5682  * fileio_make_temp_log_files_from_backup () - Build the name of volumes
5683  * return: void
5684  * logactive_name(out):
5685  * level(in):
5686  * active_name(in):
5687  *
5688  * Note: The caller must have enough space to store the name of the volume
5689  * that is constructed(sprintf). It is recommended to have at least
5690  * DB_MAX_PATH_LENGTH length.
5691  */
5692 void
5693 fileio_make_temp_log_files_from_backup (char *temp_log_name, VOLID to_volid, FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level,
5694  const char *base_log_name)
5695 {
5696  switch (to_volid)
5697  {
5698  case LOG_DBLOG_ACTIVE_VOLID:
5699  sprintf (temp_log_name, "%s_%03d_tmp", base_log_name, level);
5700  break;
5701  case LOG_DBLOG_INFO_VOLID:
5702  sprintf (temp_log_name, "%s_%03d_tmp", base_log_name, level);
5703  break;
5704  case LOG_DBLOG_ARCHIVE_VOLID:
5705  sprintf (temp_log_name, "%s_%03d_tmp", base_log_name, level);
5706  break;
5707  default:
5708  break;
5709  }
5710 }
5711 
5712 /*
5713  * fileio_make_log_archive_name () - Build the name of volumes
5714  * return: void
5715  * logarchive_name(out):
5716  * log_path(in):
5717  * dbname(in):
5718  * arvnum(in):
5719  *
5720  * Note: The caller must have enough space to store the name of the volume
5721  * that is constructed(sprintf). It is recommended to have at least
5722  * DB_MAX_PATH_LENGTH length.
5723  */
5724 void
5725 fileio_make_log_archive_name (char *log_archive_name_p, const char *log_path_p, const char *db_name_p,
5726  int archive_number)
5727 {
5728  sprintf (log_archive_name_p, "%s%s%s%s%03d", log_path_p, FILEIO_PATH_SEPARATOR (log_path_p), db_name_p,
5729  FILEIO_SUFFIX_LOGARCHIVE, archive_number);
5730 }
5731

5733  * fileio_make_removed_log_archive_name () - Build the name of removed volumes

5738  *

5740  * that is constructed(sprintf). It is recommended to have at least

5742  */

5750 /*
5751  * fileio_make_log_archive_temp_name () -
5752  * return: void
5753  * logarchive_name_p(out):
5754  * log_path_p(in):
5755  * db_name_p(in):
5756  *
5757  * Note:
5758  */
5759 void
5760 fileio_make_log_archive_temp_name (char *log_archive_temp_name_p, const char *log_path_p, const char *db_name_p)
5761 {
5762  const char *fmt_string_p;
5763 
5764  fmt_string_p = "%s%s%s%s";
5765 
5766  snprintf (log_archive_temp_name_p, PATH_MAX - 1, fmt_string_p, log_path_p, FILEIO_PATH_SEPARATOR (log_path_p),
5767  db_name_p, FILEIO_SUFFIX_TMP_LOGARCHIVE);
5768 }
5769

5771  * fileio_make_log_info_name () - Build the name of volumes
5772  * return: void
5773  * loginfo_name(out):
5774  * log_path(in):
5775  * dbname(in):
5776  *
5777  * Note: The caller must have enough space to store the name of the volume
5778  * that is constructed(sprintf). It is recommended to have at least

5780  */

5782 fileio_make_log_info_name (char *log_info_name_p, const char *log_path_p, const char *db_name_p)
5783 {

5785  FILEIO_SUFFIX_LOGINFO);
5786 }

5788 /*
5789  * fileio_make_backup_volume_info_name () - Build the name of volumes
5790  * return: void
5791  * backup_volinfo_name(out):
5792  * backinfo_path(in):
5793  * dbname(in):
5794  *
5795  * Note: The caller must have enough space to store the name of the volume
5796  * that is constructed(sprintf). It is recommended to have at least
5797  * DB_MAX_PATH_LENGTH length.
5798  */
5799 void
5800 fileio_make_backup_volume_info_name (char *backup_volinfo_name_p, const char *backup_info_path_p, const char *db_name_p)
5801 {

5803  FILEIO_SUFFIX_BACKUP_VOLINFO);
5804 }
5805 
5806 /*
5807  * fileio_make_backup_name () - Build the name of volumes
5808  * return: void
5809  * backup_name(out):
5810  * nopath_volname(in):
5811  * backup_path(in):
5812  * level(in):
5813  * unit_num(in):
5814  *
5815  * Note: The caller must have enough space to store the name of the volume
5816  * that is constructed(sprintf). It is recommended to have at least
5817  * DB_MAX_PATH_LENGTH length.
5818  */
5819 void
5820 fileio_make_backup_name (char *backup_name_p, const char *no_path_vol_name_p, const char *backup_path_p,
5821  FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level, int unit_num)
5822 {
5823  sprintf (backup_name_p, "%s%c%s%s%dv%03d", backup_path_p, PATH_SEPARATOR, no_path_vol_name_p, FILEIO_SUFFIX_BACKUP,
5824  level, unit_num);
5825 }
5826 
5827 /*
5828  * fileio_make_dwb_name () - Build the name of DWB volume
5829  * return: void
5830  * dwb_name_p(out): the name of DWB volume
5831  * dwb_path_p(in): double write buffer path
5832  * dbname(in): database name
5833  *
5834  * Note: The caller must have enough space to store the name of the volume
5835  * that is constructed(sprintf). It is recommended to have at least
5836  * DB_MAX_PATH_LENGTH length.
5837  */
5838 void
5839 fileio_make_dwb_name (char *dwb_name_p, const char *dwb_path_p, const char *db_name_p)
5840 {
5841  sprintf (dwb_name_p, "%s%s%s%s", dwb_path_p, FILEIO_PATH_SEPARATOR (dwb_path_p), db_name_p, FILEIO_SUFFIX_DWB);
5842 }
5843 
5844 
5845 /*
5846  * fileio_cache () - Cache information related to a mounted volume
5847  * return: vdes on success, NULL_VOLDES on failure
5848  * volid(in): Permanent volume identifier
5849  * vlabel(in): Name/label of the volume
5850  * vdes(in): I/O volume descriptor
5851  * lockf_type(in): Type of lock
5852  */
5853 static int
5854 fileio_cache (VOLID vol_id, const char *vol_label_p, int vol_fd, FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE lockf_type)
5855 {
5856  bool is_permanent_volume;
5857  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
5858  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_vol_info_p;
5859  int i, j, rv;
5860 
5861  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL_VOLDES);
5862 
5863  if (vol_id > NULL_VOLID)
5864  {
5865  /* perm volume */
5866  if (vol_id < fileio_Vol_info_header.next_temp_volid)
5867  {
5868  i = vol_id / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
5869  j = vol_id % FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
5870  if (vol_id >= fileio_Vol_info_header.max_perm_vols
5871  && fileio_expand_permanent_volume_info (&fileio_Vol_info_header, vol_id) < 0)
5872  {
5873  return NULL_VOLDES;
5874  }
5875  is_permanent_volume = true;
5876  }
5877  else
5878  {
5879  /* volid is the next temp volume id */
5880  i = (fileio_Vol_info_header.num_volinfo_array - 1 - (LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - vol_id) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT);
5881  j = (FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT - 1 - (LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - vol_id) % FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT);
5882  if (((LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - vol_id) >= fileio_Vol_info_header.max_temp_vols)
5883  && fileio_expand_temporary_volume_info (&fileio_Vol_info_header, vol_id) < 0)
5884  {
5885  return NULL_VOLDES;
5886  }
5887  is_permanent_volume = false;
5888  }
5889 
5890  vol_info_p = &fileio_Vol_info_header.volinfo[i][j];
5891  vol_info_p->volid = vol_id;
5892  vol_info_p->vdes = vol_fd;
5893  vol_info_p->lockf_type = lockf_type;
5894  strncpy (vol_info_p->vlabel, vol_label_p, PATH_MAX);
5895  /* modify next volume id */
5896  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Vol_info_header.mutex);
5897  if (is_permanent_volume)
5898  {
5899  if (fileio_Vol_info_header.next_perm_volid <= vol_id)
5900  {
5901  fileio_Vol_info_header.next_perm_volid = vol_id + 1;
5902  }
5903  }
5904  else
5905  {
5906  if (fileio_Vol_info_header.next_temp_volid >= vol_id)
5907  {
5908  fileio_Vol_info_header.next_temp_volid = vol_id - 1;
5909  }
5910  }
5911  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Vol_info_header.mutex);
5912  }
5913  else
5914  {
5915  if (vol_id == LOG_DBDWB_VOLID)
5916  {
5917  /* Do not cache DWB. */
5918  return vol_fd;
5919  }
5920 
5921  /* system volume */
5922  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
5923  if (fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
5924  {
5925  sys_vol_info_p = (FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *) malloc (sizeof (FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO));
5926  if (sys_vol_info_p == NULL)
5927  {
5928  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1,
5929  sizeof (FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO));
5930  vol_fd = NULL_VOLDES;
5931  }
5932  else
5933  {
5934  sys_vol_info_p->volid = vol_id;
5935  sys_vol_info_p->vdes = vol_fd;
5936  sys_vol_info_p->lockf_type = lockf_type;
5937  strncpy (sys_vol_info_p->vlabel, vol_label_p, PATH_MAX);
5938  sys_vol_info_p->next = fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.next;
5939  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.next = sys_vol_info_p;
5940  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.num_vols++;
5941 #if defined(WINDOWS)
5942  pthread_mutex_init (&sys_vol_info_p->sysvol_mutex, NULL);
5943 #endif /* WINDOWS */
5944  }
5945  }
5946  else
5947  {
5948  sys_vol_info_p = &fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor;
5949  sys_vol_info_p->volid = vol_id;
5950  sys_vol_info_p->vdes = vol_fd;
5951  sys_vol_info_p->lockf_type = lockf_type;
5952  sys_vol_info_p->next = NULL;
5953  strncpy (sys_vol_info_p->vlabel, vol_label_p, PATH_MAX);
5954 #if defined(WINDOWS)
5955  pthread_mutex_init (&sys_vol_info_p->sysvol_mutex, NULL);
5956 #endif /* WINDOWS */
5957  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.num_vols++;
5958  }
5959 
5960  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
5961  }
5962 
5963  return vol_fd;
5964 }
5965 
5966 /*
5967  * fileio_decache () - Decache volume information. Used when the volume is
5968  * dismounted
5969  * return: void
5970  * vdes(in): I/O Volume descriptor
5971  */
5972 static void
5973 fileio_decache (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd)
5974 {
5975  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_vol_info_p, *prev_sys_vol_info_p;
5976  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
5977  int vol_id, prev_vol;
5978  int rv;
5979  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
5980 
5981  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
5982  /* sys volume ? */
5983  for ((sys_vol_info_p = &fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor, prev_sys_vol_info_p = NULL);
5984  (sys_vol_info_p != NULL && sys_vol_info_p->vdes != NULL_VOLDES);
5985  prev_sys_vol_info_p = sys_vol_info_p, sys_vol_info_p = sys_vol_info_p->next)
5986  {
5987  if (sys_vol_info_p->vdes == vol_fd)
5988  {
5989  if (prev_sys_vol_info_p == NULL)
5990  {
5991  if (fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.next != NULL)
5992  {
5993  /* copy next volinfo to anchor. */
5994  sys_vol_info_p = fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.next;
5995  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.volid = sys_vol_info_p->volid;
5996  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.vdes = sys_vol_info_p->vdes;
5997  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.lockf_type = sys_vol_info_p->lockf_type;
5998  strncpy (fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.vlabel, sys_vol_info_p->vlabel, PATH_MAX);
5999  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.next = sys_vol_info_p->next;
6000 #if defined(SERVER_MODE) && defined(WINDOWS)
6001  pthread_mutex_destroy (&sys_vol_info_p->sysvol_mutex);
6002 #endif /* WINDOWS */
6003  free_and_init (sys_vol_info_p);
6004  }
6005  else
6006  {
6007  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.volid = NULL_VOLID;
6008  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
6009  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.lockf_type = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
6010  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.vlabel[0] = '\0';
6011  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.next = NULL;
6012 #if defined(SERVER_MODE) && defined(WINDOWS)
6013  pthread_mutex_destroy (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.anchor.sysvol_mutex);
6014 #endif /* WINDOWS */
6015  }
6016  }
6017  else
6018  {
6019  prev_sys_vol_info_p->next = sys_vol_info_p->next;
6020 #if defined(SERVER_MODE) && defined(WINDOWS)
6021  pthread_mutex_destroy (&sys_vol_info_p->sysvol_mutex);
6022 #endif /* WINDOWS */
6023  free_and_init (sys_vol_info_p);
6024  }
6025  fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.num_vols--;
6026  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6027  return;
6028  }
6029  }
6030  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6031  arg.vdes = vol_fd;
6032  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
6033  if (vol_info_p)
6034  {
6035  vol_id = vol_info_p->volid;
6036 
6037  /* update next_perm_volid, if needed */
6038  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Vol_info_header.mutex);
6039  if (fileio_Vol_info_header.next_perm_volid == vol_id + 1)
6040  {
6041  fileio_Vol_info_header.next_perm_volid = fileio_find_previous_perm_volume (thread_p, vol_id) + 1;
6042  }
6043  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Vol_info_header.mutex);
6044 
6045  vol_info_p->volid = NULL_VOLID;
6046  vol_info_p->vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
6047  vol_info_p->lockf_type = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
6048  vol_info_p->vlabel[0] = '\0';
6049 #if defined(SERVER_MODE) && defined(WINDOWS)
6050  pthread_mutex_destroy (&vol_info_p->vol_mutex);
6051 #endif /* WINDOWS */
6052  return;
6053  }
6054 
6055  arg.vdes = vol_fd;
6056  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_temporary_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
6057  if (vol_info_p)
6058  {
6059  vol_id = vol_info_p->volid;
6060 
6061  /* update next_temp_volid, if needed */
6062  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Vol_info_header.mutex);
6063  if (fileio_Vol_info_header.next_temp_volid == vol_id - 1)
6064  {
6065  prev_vol = fileio_find_previous_temp_volume (thread_p, vol_id);
6066  /* if prev_vol is NULL_VOLID, this volume is last volume */
6067  fileio_Vol_info_header.next_temp_volid = (prev_vol != NULL_VOLID) ? (prev_vol - 1) : (LOG_MAX_DBVOLID);
6068  }
6069 
6070  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Vol_info_header.mutex);
6071 
6072  vol_info_p->volid = NULL_VOLID;
6073  vol_info_p->vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
6074  vol_info_p->lockf_type = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
6075  vol_info_p->vlabel[0] = '\0';
6076 #if defined(SERVER_MODE) && defined(WINDOWS)
6077  pthread_mutex_destroy (&vol_info_p->vol_mutex);
6078 #endif /* WINDOWS */
6079  return;
6080  }
6081 }
6082 
6083 /*
6084  * fileio_get_volume_label ()
6085  * - Find the name of a mounted volume given its permanent volume identifier
6086  * return: Volume label
6087  * volid(in): Permanent volume identifier
6088  */
6089 char *
6090 fileio_get_volume_label (VOLID vol_id, bool is_peek)
6091 {
6092  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
6093  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_vol_info_p;
6094  char *vol_label_p = NULL;
6095  int i, j, rv;
6096  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
6097 
6098  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL);
6099  if (vol_id > NULL_VOLID)
6100  {
6101  /* perm volume */
6102  if (vol_id < fileio_Vol_info_header.next_temp_volid)
6103  {
6104  if (vol_id >= fileio_Vol_info_header.max_perm_vols)
6105  {
6106  return NULL;
6107  }
6108 
6109  i = vol_id / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
6110  j = vol_id % FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
6111  }
6112  else
6113  {
6114  /* volid is the next temp volume id */
6115  if ((LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - vol_id) >= fileio_Vol_info_header.max_temp_vols)
6116  {
6117  return NULL;
6118  }
6119 
6120  i = fileio_Vol_info_header.num_volinfo_array - 1 - (LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - vol_id) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
6121  j = FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT - 1 - (LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - vol_id) % FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
6122  }
6123  vol_info_p = &fileio_Vol_info_header.volinfo[i][j];
6124  vol_label_p = (char *) vol_info_p->vlabel;
6125  }
6126  else
6127  {
6128  /* system volume */
6129  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6130  arg.vol_id = vol_id;
6131  sys_vol_info_p = fileio_find_system_volume (NULL, fileio_is_system_volume_id_equal, &arg);
6132  if (sys_vol_info_p)
6133  {
6134  vol_label_p = (char *) sys_vol_info_p->vlabel;
6135  }
6136 
6137  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6138  }
6139 
6140  if (!is_peek)
6141  {
6142  char *ret = strdup (vol_label_p);
6143 
6144  if (ret == NULL)
6145  {
6146  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) strlen (vol_label_p));
6147  }
6148 
6149  return ret;
6150  }
6151 
6152  return vol_label_p;
6153 }
6154 
6155 /*
6156  * fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd ()
6157  * - Find the name of a mounted volume given its file descriptor
6158  * return: Volume label
6159  * vol_fd(in): volume descriptor
6160  */
6161 char *
6162 fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (int vol_fd, bool is_peek)
6163 {
6164  return fileio_get_volume_label (fileio_get_volume_id (vol_fd), is_peek);
6165 }
6166 
6167 
6168 /*
6169  * fileio_get_volume_id () - Find volume identifier of a mounted volume given its
6170  * descriptor
6171  * return: The volume identifier
6172  * vdes(in): I/O volume descriptor
6173  */
6174 static VOLID
6175 fileio_get_volume_id (int vol_fd)
6176 {
6177  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
6178  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_vol_info_p;
6179  VOLID vol_id = NULL_VOLID;
6180  int rv;
6181  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
6182 
6183  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL_VOLID);
6184  /* sys volume ? */
6185  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6186  arg.vdes = vol_fd;
6187  sys_vol_info_p = fileio_find_system_volume (NULL, fileio_is_system_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
6188  if (sys_vol_info_p)
6189  {
6190  vol_id = sys_vol_info_p->volid;
6191  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6192  return vol_id;
6193  }
6194 
6195  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6196 
6197  arg.vdes = vol_fd;
6198  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (NULL, fileio_is_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
6199  if (vol_info_p)
6200  {
6201  return vol_info_p->volid;
6202  }
6203 
6204  arg.vdes = vol_fd;
6205  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_temporary_volume (NULL, fileio_is_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
6206  if (vol_info_p)
6207  {
6208  return vol_info_p->volid;
6209  }
6210 
6211  return vol_id;
6212 }
6213 
6214 static bool
6215 fileio_is_volume_label_equal (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO * vol_info_p, APPLY_ARG * arg)
6216 {
6217  return (util_compare_filepath (vol_info_p->vlabel, arg->vol_label) == 0);
6218 }
6219 
6220 /*
6221  * fileio_find_volume_id_with_label () - Find the volume identifier given the volume label of
6222  * a mounted volume
6223  * return: The volume identifier
6224  * vlabel(in): Volume Name/label
6225  */
6226 VOLID
6227 fileio_find_volume_id_with_label (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *vol_label_p)
6228 {
6229  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
6230  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_vol_info_p;
6231  VOLID vol_id = NULL_VOLID;
6232  int rv;
6233  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
6234 
6235  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL_VOLID);
6236  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6237  arg.vol_label = vol_label_p;
6238  sys_vol_info_p = fileio_find_system_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_system_volume_label_equal, &arg);
6239  if (sys_vol_info_p)
6240  {
6241  vol_id = sys_vol_info_p->volid;
6242  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6243  return vol_id;
6244  }
6245 
6246  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6247 
6248  arg.vol_label = vol_label_p;
6249  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_volume_label_equal, &arg);
6250  if (vol_info_p)
6251  {
6252  return vol_info_p->volid;
6253  }
6254 
6255  arg.vol_label = vol_label_p;
6256  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_temporary_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_volume_label_equal, &arg);
6257  if (vol_info_p)
6258  {
6259  return vol_info_p->volid;
6260  }
6261 
6262  return vol_id;
6263 }
6264 
6265 bool
6266 fileio_is_temp_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID volid)
6267 {
6268  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
6269  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
6270 
6271  if (volid == NULL_VOLID)
6272  {
6273  return false;
6274  }
6275 
6276  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (false);
6277 
6278  arg.vol_id = volid;
6279  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_temporary_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_volume_id_equal, &arg);
6280  if (vol_info_p)
6281  {
6282  assert (fileio_get_volume_descriptor (volid) != NULL_VOLDES);
6283  return true;
6284  }
6285 
6286  return false;
6287 }
6288 
6289 /*
6290  * fileio_is_permanent_volume_descriptor () - Check whether is permanent volume descriptor.
6291  * return: I/O volume descriptor
6292  * vol_fd(in): Volume descriptor to check.
6293  */
6294 bool
6295 fileio_is_permanent_volume_descriptor (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int vol_fd)
6296 {
6297  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
6298  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
6299 
6300  if (vol_fd == NULL_VOLDES)
6301  {
6302  return false;
6303  }
6304 
6305  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (false);
6306 
6307  arg.vdes = vol_fd;
6308  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
6309  if (vol_info_p)
6310  {
6311  return true;
6312  }
6313 
6314  return false;
6315 }
6316 
6317 VOLID
6318 fileio_find_next_perm_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID volid)
6319 {
6320  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
6321  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
6322 
6323  if (volid == NULL_VOLID)
6324  {
6325  return NULL_VOLID;
6326  }
6327 
6328  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL_VOLID);
6329 
6330  arg.vol_id = volid;
6331  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_volume_id_gt, &arg);
6332  if (vol_info_p)
6333  {
6334  assert (fileio_get_volume_descriptor (volid) != NULL_VOLDES);
6335  return vol_info_p->volid;
6336  }
6337 
6338  return NULL_VOLID;
6339 }
6340 
6341 VOLID
6342 fileio_find_previous_perm_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID volid)
6343 {
6344  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
6345  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
6346 
6347  if (volid == NULL_VOLID)
6348  {
6349  return NULL_VOLID;
6350  }
6351 
6352  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL_VOLID);
6353 
6354  arg.vol_id = volid;
6355  vol_info_p = fileio_reverse_traverse_permanent_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_volume_id_lt, &arg);
6356  if (vol_info_p)
6357  {
6358  assert (fileio_get_volume_descriptor (volid) != NULL_VOLDES);
6359  return vol_info_p->volid;
6360  }
6361 
6362  return NULL_VOLID;
6363 }
6364 
6365 VOLID
6366 fileio_find_previous_temp_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID volid)
6367 {
6368  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
6369  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
6370 
6371  if (volid == NULL_VOLID)
6372  {
6373  return NULL_VOLID;
6374  }
6375 
6376  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL_VOLID);
6377 
6378  arg.vol_id = volid;
6379  vol_info_p = fileio_reverse_traverse_temporary_volume (thread_p, fileio_is_volume_id_gt, &arg);
6380  if (vol_info_p)
6381  {
6382  assert (fileio_get_volume_descriptor (volid) != NULL_VOLDES);
6383  return vol_info_p->volid;
6384  }
6385 
6386  return NULL_VOLID;
6387 }
6388 
6389 /*
6390  * fileio_get_volume_descriptor () - Find the volume descriptor given the volume permanent
6391  * identifier
6392  * return: I/O volume descriptor
6393  * volid(in): Permanent volume identifier
6394  */
6395 int
6396 fileio_get_volume_descriptor (VOLID vol_id)
6397 {
6398  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
6399  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_vol_info_p;
6400  int vol_fd = NULL_VOLDES;
6401  int i, j, rv;
6402  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
6403 
6404  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL_VOLDES);
6405  if (vol_id > NULL_VOLID)
6406  {
6407  /* perm volume */
6408  if (vol_id < fileio_Vol_info_header.next_temp_volid)
6409  {
6410  if (vol_id >= fileio_Vol_info_header.max_perm_vols)
6411  {
6412  return NULL_VOLDES;
6413  }
6414  i = vol_id / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
6415  j = vol_id % FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
6416  }
6417  else
6418  {
6419  /* volid is the next temp volume id */
6420  if ((LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - vol_id) >= fileio_Vol_info_header.max_temp_vols)
6421  {
6422  return NULL_VOLDES;
6423  }
6424  i = fileio_Vol_info_header.num_volinfo_array - 1 - (LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - vol_id) / FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
6425  j = FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT - 1 - (LOG_MAX_DBVOLID - vol_id) % FILEIO_VOLINFO_INCREMENT;
6426  }
6427  vol_info_p = &fileio_Vol_info_header.volinfo[i][j];
6428  vol_fd = vol_info_p->vdes;
6429  }
6430  else
6431  {
6432  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6433  arg.vol_id = vol_id;
6434  sys_vol_info_p = fileio_find_system_volume (NULL, fileio_is_system_volume_id_equal, &arg);
6435  if (sys_vol_info_p)
6436  {
6437  vol_fd = sys_vol_info_p->vdes;
6438  }
6439 
6440  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6441  }
6442 
6443  return vol_fd;
6444 }
6445 
6446 /*
6447  * fileio_find_volume_descriptor_with_label () - Find the volume descriptor given the volume label/name
6448  * return: Volume Name/label
6449  * vlabel(in): I/O volume descriptor
6450  */
6451 int
6452 fileio_find_volume_descriptor_with_label (const char *vol_label_p)
6453 {
6454  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
6455  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_vol_info_p;
6456  int vol_fd = NULL_VOLDES;
6457  int rv;
6458  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
6459 
6460  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (NULL_VOLDES);
6461  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6462  arg.vol_label = vol_label_p;
6463  sys_vol_info_p = fileio_find_system_volume (NULL, fileio_is_system_volume_label_equal, &arg);
6464  if (sys_vol_info_p)
6465  {
6466  vol_fd = sys_vol_info_p->vdes;
6467  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6468  return vol_fd;
6469  }
6470 
6471  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6472 
6473  arg.vol_label = vol_label_p;
6474  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (NULL, fileio_is_volume_label_equal, &arg);
6475  if (vol_info_p)
6476  {
6477  return vol_info_p->vdes;
6478  }
6479 
6480  arg.vol_label = vol_label_p;
6481  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_temporary_volume (NULL, fileio_is_volume_label_equal, &arg);
6482  if (vol_info_p)
6483  {
6484  return vol_info_p->vdes;
6485  }
6486 
6487  return vol_fd;
6488 }
6489 
6490 /*
6491  * fileio_get_lockf_type () - Find the lock type applied to a mounted volume
6492  * return: lockf_type
6493  * vdes(in): I/O volume descriptor
6494  */
6495 static FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE
6496 fileio_get_lockf_type (int vol_fd)
6497 {
6498  FILEIO_VOLUME_INFO *vol_info_p;
6499  FILEIO_SYSTEM_VOLUME_INFO *sys_vol_info_p;
6500  FILEIO_LOCKF_TYPE lockf_type = FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF;
6501  int rv;
6502  APPLY_ARG arg = { 0 };
6503 
6504  FILEIO_CHECK_AND_INITIALIZE_VOLUME_HEADER_CACHE (FILEIO_NOT_LOCKF);
6505  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6506  arg.vdes = vol_fd;
6507  sys_vol_info_p = fileio_find_system_volume (NULL, fileio_is_system_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
6508  if (sys_vol_info_p)
6509  {
6510  lockf_type = sys_vol_info_p->lockf_type;
6511  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6512  return lockf_type;
6513  }
6514  pthread_mutex_unlock (&fileio_Sys_vol_info_header.mutex);
6515 
6516  arg.vdes = vol_fd;
6517  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_permanent_volume (NULL, fileio_is_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
6518  if (vol_info_p)
6519  {
6520  return vol_info_p->lockf_type;
6521  }
6522 
6523  arg.vdes = vol_fd;
6524  vol_info_p = fileio_traverse_temporary_volume (NULL, fileio_is_volume_descriptor_equal, &arg);
6525  if (vol_info_p)
6526  {
6527  return vol_info_p->lockf_type;
6528  }
6529 
6530  return lockf_type;
6531 }
6532 
6533 #if 0
6534  /* currently, disable the following code. DO NOT DELETE ME NEED FUTURE OPTIMIZATION */
6535 static void
6536 fileio_determine_backup_buffer_size (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, int buf_size)
6537 {
6538  int vol_size, max_buf_size;
6539  vol_size = DB_INT32_MAX; /* 2G */
6540  if ((int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE) > 0)
6541  {
6542  vol_size = MIN (vol_size, (int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE));
6543  }
6544 
6545  vol_size -= (FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER_IO_SIZE + FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER_PAGE_SIZE);
6546  max_buf_size = buf_size * prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_NBUFFERS);
6547  while (max_buf_size > buf_size)
6548  {
6549  if (vol_size % max_buf_size < buf_size)
6550  {
6551  break; /* OK */
6552  }
6553  max_buf_size -= buf_size;
6554  }
6555 
6556  session_p->bkup.iosize = max_buf_size;
6557 }
6558 #endif
6559 
6560 static int
6561 fileio_initialize_backup_thread (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, int num_threads)
6562 {
6563  FILEIO_THREAD_INFO *thread_info_p;
6564  FILEIO_QUEUE *queue_p;
6565 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
6566  int num_cpus;
6567  int rv;
6568 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
6569 
6570  thread_info_p = &session_p->read_thread_info;
6571  queue_p = &thread_info_p->io_queue;
6572 
6573 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
6574  rv = pthread_mutex_init (&thread_info_p->mtx, NULL);
6575  if (rv != 0)
6576  {
6577  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_PTHREAD_MUTEX_INIT, 0);
6578  return ER_CSS_PTHREAD_MUTEX_INIT;
6579  }
6580 
6581  rv = pthread_cond_init (&thread_info_p->rcv, NULL);
6582  if (rv != 0)
6583  {
6584  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_PTHREAD_COND_INIT, 0);
6585  return ER_CSS_PTHREAD_COND_INIT;
6586  }
6587 
6588  rv = pthread_cond_init (&thread_info_p->wcv, NULL);
6589  if (rv != 0)
6590  {
6591  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_PTHREAD_COND_INIT, 0);
6592  return ER_CSS_PTHREAD_COND_INIT;
6593  }
6594 
6595  /* get the number of CPUs */
6596  num_cpus = fileio_os_sysconf ();
6597  /* check for the upper bound of threads */
6598  if (num_threads == FILEIO_BACKUP_NUM_THREADS_AUTO)
6599  {
6600  thread_info_p->num_threads = num_cpus;
6601  }
6602  else
6603  {
6604  thread_info_p->num_threads = MIN (num_threads, num_cpus * 2);
6605  }
6606  thread_info_p->num_threads = MIN (thread_info_p->num_threads, NUM_NORMAL_TRANS);
6607 #else /* SERVER_MODE */
6608  thread_info_p->num_threads = 1;
6609 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
6610 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
6611  fprintf (stdout, "PRM_CSS_MAX_CLIENTS = %d, tp->num_threads = %d\n", prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_CSS_MAX_CLIENTS),
6612  thread_info_p->num_threads);
6613 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
6614  queue_p->size = 0;
6615  queue_p->head = NULL;
6616  queue_p->tail = NULL;
6617  queue_p->free_list = NULL;
6618 
6619  thread_info_p->initialized = true;
6620 
6621  return NO_ERROR;
6622 }
6623 
6624 /*
6625  * fileio_initialize_backup () - Initialize the backup session structure with the given
6626  * information
6627  * return: session or NULL
6628  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database to backup
6629  * backup_destination(in): Name of backup device (file or directory)
6630  * session(out): The session array
6631  * level(in): The presumed backup level
6632  * verbose_file_path(in): verbose mode file path
6633  * num_threads(in): number of threads
6634  * sleep_msecs(in): sleep interval in msecs
6635  */
6636 FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION *
6637 fileio_initialize_backup (const char *db_full_name_p, const char *backup_destination_p,
6638  FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level, const char *verbose_file_path,
6639  int num_threads, int sleep_msecs)
6640 {
6641  int vol_fd;
6642  int size;
6643  const char *db_nopath_name_p;
6644  struct stat stbuf;
6645  int buf_size;
6646  int io_page_size;
6647  const char *verbose_fp_mode;
6648 
6649  /*
6650  * First assume that backup device is a regular file or a raw device.
6651  * Adjustments are made at a later point, if the backup_destination is
6652  * a directory.
6653  */
6654  strncpy (session_p->bkup.name, backup_destination_p, PATH_MAX);
6655  strncpy (session_p->bkup.current_path, backup_destination_p, PATH_MAX);
6656  session_p->bkup.vlabel = session_p->bkup.name;
6657  session_p->bkup.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
6658  session_p->bkup.dtype = FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_UNKNOWN;
6659  session_p->dbfile.level = level;
6660  session_p->bkup.buffer = NULL;
6661  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr = NULL;
6662  session_p->dbfile.area = NULL;
6663 
6664  /* Now find out the type of backup_destination and the best page I/O for the backup. The accepted types are either
6665  * file, directory, or raw device. */
6666  while (stat (backup_destination_p, &stbuf) == -1)
6667  {
6668  /*
6669  * Could not stat or backup_destination is a file or directory that does not exist.
6670  * If the backup_destination does not exist, try to create it to make sure that we can write at this backup
6671  * destination.
6672  */
6673  vol_fd = fileio_open (backup_destination_p, FILEIO_DISK_FORMAT_MODE, FILEIO_DISK_PROTECTION_MODE);
6674  if (vol_fd == NULL_VOLDES)
6675  {
6676  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, backup_destination_p);
6677  return NULL;
6678  }
6679  fileio_close (vol_fd);
6680  continue;
6681  }
6682 
6683  if (S_ISDIR (stbuf.st_mode))
6684  {
6685  /*
6686  * This is a DIRECTORY where the backup is going to be sent.
6687  * The name of the backup file in this directory is labeled as databasename.bkLvNNN (Unix).
6688  * In this case, we may destroy any previous backup in this directory.
6689  */
6690  session_p->bkup.dtype = FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DIRECTORY;
6691  db_nopath_name_p = fileio_get_base_file_name (db_full_name_p);
6692  fileio_make_backup_name (session_p->bkup.name, db_nopath_name_p, backup_destination_p, level,
6693  FILEIO_INITIAL_BACKUP_UNITS);
6694  }
6695  else if (S_ISREG (stbuf.st_mode))
6696  {
6697  /* Regular file. Remember the directory of this file, in case more volumes are needed. */
6698  session_p->bkup.dtype = FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DIRECTORY;
6699  fileio_get_directory_path (session_p->bkup.current_path, backup_destination_p);
6700  }
6701  else
6702  {
6703  /*
6704  * ASSUME that everything else is a special file such as a FIFO file, a device(character or block special file)
6705  * which is not named for I/O purposes. That is, the name of the device or regular file is used as the backup.
6706  */
6707  session_p->bkup.dtype = FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DEVICE;
6708  }
6709 
6710 #if defined(WINDOWS)
6711  buf_size = 4096;
6712 #else /* WINDOWS */
6713  buf_size = stbuf.st_blksize;
6714 #endif /* WINDOWS */
6715  /* User may override the default size by specifying a multiple of the natural block size for the device. */
6716  session_p->bkup.iosize = buf_size * prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_NBUFFERS);
6717 #if 0
6718  /* currently, disable the following code. DO NOT DELETE ME NEED FUTURE OPTIMIZATION */
6719  fileio_determine_backup_buffer_size (session_p, buf_size);
6720 #endif
6721  if ((int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE) > 0
6722  && (session_p->bkup.iosize >= MIN ((int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE), DB_INT32_MAX)))
6723  {
6724  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE,
6725  "Backup block buffer size %d must be less "
6726  "than backup volume size %d, resetting buffer size to %d\n", session_p->bkup.iosize,
6727  (int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE), buf_size);
6728  session_p->bkup.iosize = buf_size;
6729  }
6730 
6731 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
6732  /* These print statements are candidates for part of a "verbose" option to backupdb. */
6733  fprintf (stdout, "NATURAL BUFFER SIZE %d (%d IO buffer blocks)\n", session_p->bkup.iosize,
6734  session_p->bkup.iosize / buf_size);
6735  fprintf (stdout, "BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE = %d\n", (int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE));
6736 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
6737  /*
6738  * Initialize backup device related information.
6739  *
6740  * Make sure it is large enough to hold various headers and pages.
6741  * Beware that upon restore, both the backup buffer size and the
6742  * database io pagesize may be different.
6743  */
6744  io_page_size = IO_PAGESIZE;
6745  if (session_p->dbfile.level == FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL)
6746  {
6747  io_page_size *= FILEIO_FULL_LEVEL_EXP;
6748  }
6749 
6750  size = MAX (io_page_size + FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE_OVERHEAD, FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER_PAGE_SIZE);
6751 
6752  session_p->bkup.buffer = (char *) malloc (session_p->bkup.iosize);
6753  if (session_p->bkup.buffer == NULL)
6754  {
6755  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) session_p->bkup.iosize);
6756 
6757  goto error;
6758  }
6759 
6760  session_p->dbfile.area = (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) malloc (size);
6761  if (session_p->dbfile.area == NULL)
6762  {
6763  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) size);
6764 
6765  goto error;
6766  }
6767 
6768  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr = (FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER *) malloc (FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER_IO_SIZE);
6769  if (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr == NULL)
6770  {
6771  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER_IO_SIZE);
6772 
6773  goto error;
6774  }
6775 
6776  session_p->bkup.ptr = session_p->bkup.buffer;
6777  session_p->bkup.count = 0;
6778  session_p->bkup.voltotalio = 0;
6779  session_p->bkup.alltotalio = 0;
6780  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num = FILEIO_INITIAL_BACKUP_UNITS;
6781  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->level = level;
6782  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->bkup_iosize = session_p->bkup.iosize;
6783  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->bk_hdr_version = FILEIO_BACKUP_CURRENT_HEADER_VERSION;
6784  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->start_time = 0;
6785  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->end_time = -1;
6786  memset (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_prec_bkvolname, 0, sizeof (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_prec_bkvolname));
6787  memset (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_next_bkvolname, 0, sizeof (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_next_bkvolname));
6788  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->zip_method = FILEIO_ZIP_NONE_METHOD;
6789  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->zip_level = FILEIO_ZIP_NONE_LEVEL;
6790  /* Initialize database file related information */
6791  LSA_SET_NULL (&session_p->dbfile.lsa);
6792  session_p->dbfile.vlabel = NULL;
6793  session_p->dbfile.volid = NULL_VOLID;
6794  session_p->dbfile.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
6795  session_p->dbfile.nbytes = -1;
6796  FILEIO_SET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area, NULL_PAGEID, io_page_size);
6797 
6798 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
6799  fprintf (stdout, "fileio_initialize_backup: %d\t%d,\t%d\n",
6800  ((FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) (session_p->dbfile.area))->iopageid,
6801  *(PAGEID *) (((char *) (session_p->dbfile.area)) + offsetof (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage) + io_page_size),
6802  io_page_size);
6803 #endif
6804 
6805  if (fileio_initialize_backup_thread (session_p, num_threads) != NO_ERROR)
6806  {
6807  goto error;
6808  }
6809 
6810  if (verbose_file_path && *verbose_file_path)
6811  {
6812  if (session_p->type == FILEIO_BACKUP_WRITE && level == 0)
6813  {
6814  verbose_fp_mode = "w";
6815  }
6816  else
6817  {
6818  verbose_fp_mode = "a";
6819  }
6820 
6821  session_p->verbose_fp = fopen (verbose_file_path, verbose_fp_mode);
6822  if (session_p->verbose_fp == NULL)
6823  {
6824  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_CANNOT_OPEN_VERBOSE_FILE, 1, verbose_file_path);
6825 
6826  goto error;
6827  }
6828 
6829  setbuf (session_p->verbose_fp, NULL);
6830  }
6831  else
6832  {
6833  session_p->verbose_fp = NULL;
6834  }
6835 
6836  session_p->sleep_msecs = sleep_msecs;
6837 
6838  return session_p;
6839 
6840 error:
6841  if (session_p->bkup.buffer != NULL)
6842  {
6843  free_and_init (session_p->bkup.buffer);
6844  }
6845  if (session_p->dbfile.area != NULL)
6846  {
6847  free_and_init (session_p->dbfile.area);
6848  }
6849  if (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr != NULL)
6850  {
6851  free_and_init (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr);
6852  }
6853  if (session_p->verbose_fp != NULL)
6854  {
6855  fclose (session_p->verbose_fp);
6856  session_p->verbose_fp = NULL;
6857  }
6858 
6859  return NULL;
6860 }
6861 
6862 /*
6863  * fileio_finalize_backup_thread() -
6864  * return: void
6865  *
6866  * session_p(in/out):
6867  * zip_method(in):
6868  */
6869 static void
6870 fileio_finalize_backup_thread (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, FILEIO_ZIP_METHOD zip_method)
6871 {
6872  FILEIO_THREAD_INFO *tp;
6873  FILEIO_QUEUE *qp;
6874  FILEIO_NODE *node, *node_next;
6875 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
6876  int rv;
6877 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
6878 
6879  tp = &session_p->read_thread_info;
6880  qp = &tp->io_queue;
6881 
6882  if (tp->initialized == false)
6883  {
6884  return;
6885  }
6886 
6887 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
6888  rv = pthread_mutex_destroy (&tp->mtx);
6889  if (rv != 0)
6890  {
6891  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_PTHREAD_MUTEX_DESTROY, 0);
6892  }
6893 
6894  rv = pthread_cond_destroy (&tp->rcv);
6895  if (rv != 0)
6896  {
6897  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_PTHREAD_COND_DESTROY, 0);
6898  }
6899 
6900  rv = pthread_cond_destroy (&tp->wcv);
6901  if (rv != 0)
6902  {
6903  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_PTHREAD_COND_DESTROY, 0);
6904  }
6905 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
6906 
6907  while (qp->size > 0)
6908  {
6909  node = fileio_delete_queue_head (qp);
6910  (void) fileio_free_node (qp, node);
6911  }
6912 
6913  for (node = qp->free_list; node; node = node_next)
6914  {
6915  node_next = node->next;
6916  switch (zip_method)
6917  {
6918  case FILEIO_ZIP_LZO1X_METHOD:
6919  if (node->wrkmem != NULL)
6920  {
6921  free_and_init (node->wrkmem);
6922  }
6923 
6924  if (node->zip_page != NULL)
6925  {
6926  free_and_init (node->zip_page);
6927  }
6928  break;
6929  case FILEIO_ZIP_ZLIB_METHOD:
6930  break;
6931  default:
6932  break;
6933  }
6934 
6935  if (node->area != NULL)
6936  {
6937  free_and_init (node->area);
6938  }
6939 
6940  if (node != NULL)
6941  {
6942  free_and_init (node);
6943  }
6944  }
6945 
6946  qp->free_list = NULL;
6947 
6948  tp->initialized = false;
6949 }
6950 
6951 /*
6952  * fileio_abort_backup () - The backup session is aborted
6953  * return: void
6954  * session(in/out): The session array
6955  * does_unformat_bk(in): set to TRUE to delete backup volumes we know about
6956  *
6957  * Note: The currently created backup file can be removed if desired. This
6958  * routine is called in for normal cleanup as well as to handle
6959  * exceptions.
6960  */
6961 void
6962 fileio_abort_backup (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, bool does_unformat_bk)
6963 {
6964  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER *backup_header_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
6965  FILEIO_ZIP_METHOD zip_method;
6966 
6967  zip_method = backup_header_p ? backup_header_p->zip_method : FILEIO_ZIP_NONE_METHOD;
6968  /* Remove the currently created backup */
6969  if (session_p->bkup.vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
6970  {
6971  if (session_p->bkup.dtype == FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DIRECTORY)
6972  {
6973  if (session_p->type == FILEIO_BACKUP_READ)
6974  {
6975  /* access backup device for read */
6976  fileio_dismount_without_fsync (thread_p, session_p->bkup.vdes);
6977  }
6978  else
6979  {
6980  /* access backup device for write */
6981  fileio_dismount (thread_p, session_p->bkup.vdes);
6982  }
6983  }
6984  else
6985  {
6986  fileio_dismount_without_fsync (thread_p, session_p->bkup.vdes);
6987  }
6988  }
6989 
6990  /* Destroy the current backup volumes */
6991  if (does_unformat_bk)
6992  {
6993  /* Remove current backup volume */
6994  if (session_p->bkup.dtype == FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DIRECTORY
6995  && fileio_is_volume_exist_and_file (session_p->bkup.vlabel))
6996  {
6997  fileio_unformat (thread_p, session_p->bkup.vlabel);
6998  }
6999 
7000  /* Remove backup volumes previous to this one */
7001  if (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr)
7002  {
7003  fileio_remove_all_backup (thread_p, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->level);
7004  }
7005  }
7006 
7007  if (session_p->verbose_fp)
7008  {
7009  fclose (session_p->verbose_fp);
7010  session_p->verbose_fp = NULL;
7011  }
7012 
7013  /* Deallocate memory space */
7014  if (session_p->bkup.buffer != NULL)
7015  {
7016  free_and_init (session_p->bkup.buffer);
7017  }
7018 
7019  if (session_p->dbfile.area != NULL)
7020  {
7021  free_and_init (session_p->dbfile.area);
7022  }
7023 
7024  if (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr != NULL)
7025  {
7026  free_and_init (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr);
7027  }
7028 
7029  fileio_finalize_backup_info (FILEIO_FIRST_BACKUP_VOL_INFO);
7030  LSA_SET_NULL (&session_p->dbfile.lsa);
7031  session_p->dbfile.level = FILEIO_BACKUP_UNDEFINED_LEVEL;
7032  session_p->dbfile.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
7033  session_p->dbfile.volid = NULL_VOLID;
7034  session_p->dbfile.vlabel = NULL;
7035  session_p->dbfile.nbytes = -1;
7036  session_p->dbfile.area = NULL;
7037  session_p->bkup.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
7038  session_p->bkup.vlabel = NULL;
7039  session_p->bkup.iosize = -1;
7040  session_p->bkup.count = 0;
7041  session_p->bkup.voltotalio = 0;
7042  session_p->bkup.alltotalio = 0;
7043  session_p->bkup.buffer = session_p->bkup.ptr = NULL;
7044  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr = NULL;
7045  fileio_finalize_backup_thread (session_p, zip_method);
7046 }
7047 
7048 /*
7049  * fileio_start_backup () - Start a backup session
7050  * return: session or NULL
7051  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database to backup
7052  * db_creation(in): Creation time of database
7053  * backup_level(in): Backup level
7054  * backup_start_lsa(in): start lsa for backup
7055  * backup_chkpt_lsa(in): checkpoint lsa for backup
7056  * all_levels_info(in): previous backup info per level
7057  * session(in/out): The session array
7058  * zip_method(in): compression method
7059  * zip_level(in): compression evel
7060  *
7061  * Note: Note that fileio_initialize_backup must have already been invoked on the
7062  * session.
7063  */
7064 FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION *
7065 fileio_start_backup (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_full_name_p, INT64 * db_creation_time_p,
7066  FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL backup_level, LOG_LSA * backup_start_lsa_p, LOG_LSA * backup_checkpoint_lsa_p,
7067  FILEIO_BACKUP_RECORD_INFO * all_levels_info_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p,
7068  FILEIO_ZIP_METHOD zip_method, FILEIO_ZIP_LEVEL zip_level)
7069 {
7070  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER *backup_header_p;
7071  int i;
7072 
7073  /* Complete the session array initialization and create/open the backup destination device. */
7074  LSA_COPY (&session_p->dbfile.lsa, backup_start_lsa_p);
7075  session_p->bkup.vdes =
7076  fileio_create_backup_volume (thread_p, db_full_name_p, session_p->bkup.vlabel, LOG_DBCOPY_VOLID, false, false,
7077  (session_p->dbfile.level == FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL)
7078  ? FILEIO_BACKUP_MINIMUM_NUM_PAGES_FULL_LEVEL : FILEIO_BACKUP_MINIMUM_NUM_PAGES);
7079  if (session_p->bkup.vdes == NULL_VOLDES)
7080  {
7081  goto error;
7082  }
7083 
7084  /* Remember name of new backup volume */
7085  if (fileio_add_volume_to_backup_info (session_p->bkup.name, session_p->dbfile.level,
7086  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num, FILEIO_FIRST_BACKUP_VOL_INFO) != NO_ERROR)
7087  {
7088  goto error;
7089  }
7090 
7091  /* Write the description/header of the backup to the backup device */
7092 
7093  backup_header_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
7094  backup_header_p->iopageid = FILEIO_BACKUP_START_PAGE_ID;
7095  strncpy (backup_header_p->magic, CUBRID_MAGIC_DATABASE_BACKUP, CUBRID_MAGIC_MAX_LENGTH);
7096  strncpy (backup_header_p->db_release, rel_release_string (), REL_MAX_RELEASE_LENGTH);
7097  strncpy (backup_header_p->db_fullname, db_full_name_p, PATH_MAX);
7098  backup_header_p->db_creation = *db_creation_time_p;
7099  backup_header_p->db_iopagesize = IO_PAGESIZE;
7100  backup_header_p->db_compatibility = rel_disk_compatible ();
7101  backup_header_p->level = backup_level;
7102  LSA_COPY (&backup_header_p->start_lsa, backup_start_lsa_p);
7103  LSA_COPY (&backup_header_p->chkpt_lsa, backup_checkpoint_lsa_p);
7104 
7105  for (i = FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL; i < FILEIO_BACKUP_UNDEFINED_LEVEL; i++)
7106  {
7107  if (all_levels_info_p)
7108  {
7109  if (i == FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL)
7110  {
7111  LSA_SET_NULL (&backup_header_p->previnfo[i].lsa);
7112  }
7113  else
7114  {
7115  LSA_COPY (&backup_header_p->previnfo[i].lsa, &all_levels_info_p[i].lsa);
7116  }
7117  backup_header_p->previnfo[i].at_time = all_levels_info_p[i].at_time;
7118  }
7119  else
7120  {
7121  LSA_SET_NULL (&backup_header_p->previnfo[i].lsa);
7122  backup_header_p->previnfo[i].at_time = 0;
7123  }
7124  }
7125 
7126  backup_header_p->start_time = time (NULL);
7127  backup_header_p->unit_num = FILEIO_INITIAL_BACKUP_UNITS;
7128  backup_header_p->bkpagesize = backup_header_p->db_iopagesize;
7129 
7130  if (backup_level == FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL)
7131  {
7132  backup_header_p->bkpagesize *= FILEIO_FULL_LEVEL_EXP;
7133  }
7134 
7135  switch (zip_method)
7136  {
7137  case FILEIO_ZIP_LZO1X_METHOD:
7138  if (lzo_init () != LZO_E_OK)
7139  {
7140 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
7141  fprintf (stdout, "internal error - lzo_init() failed !!!\n");
7142  fprintf (stdout,
7143  "(this usually indicates a compiler bug - try recompiling\nwithout optimizations, and enable "
7144  "`-DLZO_DEBUG' for diagnostics)\n");
7145 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
7146  goto error;
7147  }
7148  break;
7149  case FILEIO_ZIP_ZLIB_METHOD:
7150  break;
7151  default:
7152  break;
7153  }
7154 
7155  backup_header_p->zip_method = zip_method;
7156  backup_header_p->zip_level = zip_level;
7157  /* Now write this information to the backup volume. */
7158  if (fileio_write_backup_header (session_p) != NO_ERROR)
7159  {
7160  goto error;
7161  }
7162 
7163  return session_p;
7164 
7165 error:
7166  fileio_abort_backup (thread_p, session_p, true);
7167  return NULL;
7168 }
7169 
7170 /*
7171  * fileio_write_backup_end_time_to_header () - Write the end time of backup
7172  * to backup volume header
7173  * return: error status
7174  * session(in): backup session
7175  * end_time: the end time of backup
7176  */
7177 static int
7178 fileio_write_backup_end_time_to_header (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, INT64 end_time)
7179 {
7180  const char *first_bkvol_name;
7181  int vdes, nbytes;
7182 
7183  first_bkvol_name =
7184  fileio_get_backup_info_volume_name (session_p->dbfile.level, FILEIO_INITIAL_BACKUP_UNITS,
7185  FILEIO_FIRST_BACKUP_VOL_INFO);
7186 
7187  if (first_bkvol_name == NULL)
7188  {
7189  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, "(backup volume name is null)");
7190  return ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL;
7191  }
7192 
7193  if (strncmp (first_bkvol_name, session_p->bkup.vlabel, PATH_MAX) == 0)
7194  {
7195  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->end_time = end_time;
7196  lseek (session_p->bkup.vdes, 0, SEEK_SET);
7197  fileio_write_backup_header (session_p);
7198  }
7199  else
7200  {
7201  vdes = fileio_open (first_bkvol_name, O_RDWR, 0);
7202  if (vdes == NULL_VOLDES)
7203  {
7204  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, first_bkvol_name);
7205  return ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL;
7206  }
7207 
7208  lseek (vdes, offsetof (FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER, end_time), SEEK_SET);
7209  nbytes = write (vdes, (char *) &end_time, sizeof (INT64));
7210  if (nbytes != sizeof (INT64))
7211  {
7212  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE, 2, 1, first_bkvol_name);
7213  fileio_close (vdes);
7214  return ER_IO_WRITE;
7215  }
7216  fileio_close (vdes);
7217  }
7218 
7219  return NO_ERROR;
7220 }
7221 
7222 /*
7223  * fileio_write_backup_end_time_to_last_page () - Write the end time of backup
7224  * to the last page of backup
7225  * return: void
7226  * session(in): backup session
7227  * end_time: the end time of backup
7228  */
7229 static void
7230 fileio_write_backup_end_time_to_last_page (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, INT64 end_time)
7231 {
7232  char *write_to;
7233 
7234  write_to = ((char *) &(session_p->dbfile.area->iopageid)) + offsetof (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage);
7235  memcpy (write_to, (char *) &end_time, sizeof (INT64));
7236 }
7237 
7238 /*
7239  * fileio_read_backup_end_time_from_last_page () - Read the end time of backup
7240  * from the last page of backup
7241  * return: void
7242  * session(in): backup session
7243  */
7244 static void
7245 fileio_read_backup_end_time_from_last_page (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p)
7246 {
7247  char *read_from;
7248 
7249  read_from = ((char *) &(session_p->dbfile.area->iopageid)) + offsetof (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage);
7250  memcpy ((char *) &(session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->end_time), read_from, sizeof (INT64));
7251 }
7252 
7253 /*
7254  * fileio_finish_backup () - Finish the backup session successfully
7255  * return: session or NULL
7256  * session(in/out): The session array
7257  */
7258 FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION *
7259 fileio_finish_backup (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p)
7260 {
7261  int nbytes;
7262  char *msg_area = NULL;
7263  char io_time_val[CTIME_MAX];
7264  INT64 end_time;
7265 
7266  end_time = (INT64) time (NULL);
7267 
7268  /*
7269  * Indicate end of backup and flush any buffered data.
7270  * Note that only the end of backup marker is written,
7271  * so callers of io_restore_read must check for the appropriate
7272  * end of backup condition.
7273  */
7274  session_p->dbfile.area->iopageid = FILEIO_BACKUP_END_PAGE_ID;
7275  nbytes = offsetof (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage);
7276 
7277  if (session_p->bkup.dtype == FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DEVICE)
7278  {
7279  fileio_write_backup_end_time_to_last_page (session_p, end_time);
7280  nbytes += sizeof (INT64);
7281  }
7282 
7283  if (fileio_write_backup (thread_p, session_p, nbytes) != NO_ERROR)
7284  {
7285  return NULL;
7286  }
7287 
7288  if (session_p->bkup.count > 0)
7289  {
7290 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
7291  fprintf (stdout, "io_backup_end: iosize = %d, count = %d, voltotalio = %ld : EOF JUNK\n", session_p->bkup.iosize,
7292  session_p->bkup.count, session_p->bkup.voltotalio);
7293 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
7294  /*
7295  * We must add some junk at the end of the buffered area since some
7296  * backup devices (e.g., Fixed-length I/O tape devices such as
7297  * 1/4" cartridge tape devices), requires number of bytes to write
7298  * to be a multiple of the physical record size (io_size).
7299  */
7300  nbytes = CAST_BUFLEN (session_p->bkup.iosize - session_p->bkup.count);
7301  memset (session_p->bkup.ptr, '\0', nbytes);
7302  session_p->bkup.count = session_p->bkup.iosize;
7303  /* Flush any buffered information */
7304  if (fileio_flush_backup (thread_p, session_p) != NO_ERROR)
7305  {
7306  return NULL;
7307  }
7308  }
7309 
7310  /*
7311  * Now, make sure that all the information is physically written to
7312  * the backup device. That is, make sure that nobody (e.g., backup
7313  * device controller or OS) is caching data.
7314  */
7315 
7316  if (session_p->bkup.dtype == FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DIRECTORY)
7317  {
7318  if (fileio_write_backup_end_time_to_header (session_p, end_time) != NO_ERROR)
7319  {
7320  return NULL;
7321  }
7322 
7323  if (fileio_synchronize (thread_p, session_p->bkup.vdes, session_p->bkup.name,
7324  FILEIO_SYNC_ONLY) != session_p->bkup.vdes)
7325  {
7326  return NULL;
7327  }
7328  }
7329 
7330  /* Tell user that current backup volume just completed */
7331 #if defined(SERVER_MODE) && !defined(WINDOWS)
7332  if (asprintf (&msg_area, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BACKUP_LABEL_INFO),
7333  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->level, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num,
7334  fileio_get_base_file_name (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_fullname),
7335  fileio_ctime (&session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->start_time, io_time_val)) < 0)
7336 #else /* SERVER_MODE && !WINDOWS */
7337  if (asprintf (&msg_area, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BACKUP_LABEL_INFO),
7338  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->level, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num,
7339  fileio_get_base_file_name (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_fullname),
7340  fileio_ctime (&session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->start_time, io_time_val)) < 0)
7341 #endif /* SERVER_MODE && !WINDOWS */
7342  {
7343  /* Note: we do not know the exact malloc size that failed */
7344  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) FILEIO_MAX_USER_RESPONSE_SIZE);
7345  return NULL;
7346  }
7347  else
7348  {
7349  (void) fileio_request_user_response (thread_p, FILEIO_PROMPT_DISPLAY_ONLY, msg_area, NULL, NULL, -1, -1, NULL,
7350  -1);
7351  /* Note: Not free_and_init */
7352  free (msg_area);
7353  }
7354 
7355  return session_p;
7356 }
7357 
7358 /*
7359  * fileio_remove_all_backup () - REMOVE ALL BACKUP VOLUMES
7360  * return: void
7361  * start_level(in): the starting level to remove
7362  *
7363  * Note: Initialize the backup session structure with the given information.
7364  * Remove backup. Cleanup backup. This routine deletes all backups of
7365  * a higher level as well. Furthermore, this routine assumes that the
7366  * bkvinf cache has already been read in from the bkvinf file.
7367  */
7368 void
7369 fileio_remove_all_backup (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int start_level)
7370 {
7371  int level;
7372  int unit_num;
7373  const char *vol_name_p;
7374 
7375  level = start_level;
7376  if (level >= FILEIO_BACKUP_UNDEFINED_LEVEL)
7377  {
7378  return;
7379  }
7380 
7381  if (level < FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL)
7382  {
7383  level = FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL;
7384  }
7385 
7386  do
7387  {
7388  unit_num = FILEIO_INITIAL_BACKUP_UNITS;
7389  while (true)
7390  {
7391  vol_name_p =
7392  fileio_get_backup_info_volume_name ((FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL) level, unit_num++, FILEIO_FIRST_BACKUP_VOL_INFO);
7393  if (vol_name_p == NULL)
7394  {
7395  break;
7396  }
7397 
7398  if (fileio_is_volume_exist_and_file (vol_name_p))
7399  {
7400  fileio_unformat (thread_p, vol_name_p);
7401  }
7402  }
7403 
7404  level++;
7405  }
7406  while (level < FILEIO_BACKUP_UNDEFINED_LEVEL);
7407  /* Remove all names just deleted from memory */
7408  fileio_clear_backup_info_level (start_level, false, FILEIO_FIRST_BACKUP_VOL_INFO);
7409 }
7410 
7411 /*
7412  * fileio_allocate_node () -
7413  * return:
7414  * qp(in):
7415  * backup_hdr(in):
7416  */
7417 static FILEIO_NODE *
7418 fileio_allocate_node (FILEIO_QUEUE * queue_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER * backup_header_p)
7419 {
7420  FILEIO_NODE *node_p;
7421  int size;
7422  size_t zip_page_size, wrkmem_size;
7423 
7424  if (queue_p->free_list) /* re-use already alloced nodes */
7425  {
7426  node_p = queue_p->free_list;
7427  queue_p->free_list = node_p->next; /* cut-off */
7428  return node_p;
7429  }
7430 
7431  /* at here, need to alloc */
7432  node_p = (FILEIO_NODE *) malloc (sizeof (FILEIO_NODE));
7433  if (node_p == NULL)
7434  {
7435  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, sizeof (FILEIO_NODE));
7436  goto exit_on_error;
7437  }
7438 
7439  node_p->area = NULL;
7440  node_p->zip_page = NULL;
7441  node_p->wrkmem = NULL;
7442  size = backup_header_p->bkpagesize + FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE_OVERHEAD;
7443  node_p->area = (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) malloc (size);
7444  if (node_p == NULL)
7445  {
7446  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) size);
7447  goto exit_on_error;
7448  }
7449 
7450  switch (backup_header_p->zip_method)
7451  {
7452  case FILEIO_ZIP_LZO1X_METHOD:
7453  zip_page_size = sizeof (lzo_uint) + size + size / 16 + 64 + 3;
7454  node_p->zip_page = (FILEIO_ZIP_PAGE *) malloc (zip_page_size);
7455  if (node_p->zip_page == NULL)
7456  {
7457  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, zip_page_size);
7458  goto exit_on_error;
7459  }
7460 
7461  if (backup_header_p->zip_level == FILEIO_ZIP_LZO1X_999_LEVEL)
7462  {
7463  /* best reduction */
7464  wrkmem_size = LZO1X_999_MEM_COMPRESS;
7465  }
7466  else
7467  {
7468  /* best speed */
7469  wrkmem_size = LZO1X_1_MEM_COMPRESS;
7470  }
7471 
7472  node_p->wrkmem = (lzo_bytep) malloc (wrkmem_size);
7473  if (node_p->wrkmem == NULL)
7474  {
7475  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, wrkmem_size);
7476  goto exit_on_error;
7477  }
7478  break;
7479  case FILEIO_ZIP_ZLIB_METHOD:
7480  break;
7481  default:
7482  break;
7483  }
7484 
7485 exit_on_end:
7486 
7487  return node_p;
7488 exit_on_error:
7489 
7490  if (node_p)
7491  {
7492  if (node_p->wrkmem)
7493  {
7494  free_and_init (node_p->wrkmem);
7495  }
7496 
7497  if (node_p->zip_page)
7498  {
7499  free_and_init (node_p->zip_page);
7500  }
7501 
7502  if (node_p->area)
7503  {
7504  free_and_init (node_p->area);
7505  }
7506 
7507  free_and_init (node_p);
7508  }
7509 
7510  node_p = NULL;
7511  goto exit_on_end;
7512 }
7513 
7514 /*
7515  * fileio_free_node () -
7516  * return:
7517  * qp(in):
7518  * node(in):
7519  */
7520 static FILEIO_NODE *
7521 fileio_free_node (FILEIO_QUEUE * queue_p, FILEIO_NODE * node_p)
7522 {
7523  if (node_p)
7524  {
7525  node_p->prev = node_p->next = NULL;
7526  node_p->next = queue_p->free_list; /* add to free list */
7527  queue_p->free_list = node_p;
7528  }
7529 
7530  return node_p;
7531 }
7532 
7533 /*
7534  * fileio_append_queue () -
7535  * return:
7536  * qp(in):
7537  * node(in):
7538  */
7539 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
7540 static FILEIO_NODE *
7541 fileio_append_queue (FILEIO_QUEUE * queue_p, FILEIO_NODE * node_p)
7542 {
7543  if (node_p)
7544  {
7545  node_p->prev = node_p->next = NULL;
7546  node_p->next = queue_p->tail; /* add to tail */
7547  if (queue_p->tail)
7548  {
7549  queue_p->tail->prev = node_p;
7550  }
7551  queue_p->tail = node_p;
7552  if (queue_p->head == NULL)
7553  {
7554  /* the first */
7555  queue_p->head = node_p;
7556  }
7557 
7558  queue_p->size++;
7559  }
7560 
7561  return node_p;
7562 }
7563 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
7564 
7565 /*
7566  * fileio_delete_queue_head () -
7567  * return:
7568  * qp(in):
7569  */
7570 static FILEIO_NODE *
7571 fileio_delete_queue_head (FILEIO_QUEUE * queue_p)
7572 {
7573  FILEIO_NODE *node;
7574 
7575  node = queue_p->head;
7576  if (node)
7577  {
7578  if (node == queue_p->tail) /* only one node */
7579  {
7580  queue_p->tail = NULL;
7581  }
7582  else
7583  {
7584  node->prev->next = NULL; /* cut-off */
7585  }
7586 
7587  queue_p->head = node->prev;
7588  queue_p->size--;
7589  }
7590 
7591  return node;
7592 }
7593 
7594 /*
7595  * fileio_compress_backup_node () -
7596  * return:
7597  * node(in):
7598  * backup_hdr(in):
7599  */
7600 static int
7601 fileio_compress_backup_node (FILEIO_NODE * node_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER * backup_header_p)
7602 {
7603  int error = NO_ERROR;
7604  int rv;
7605 
7606  if (!node_p || !backup_header_p)
7607  {
7608  goto exit_on_error;
7609  }
7610 
7611  assert (node_p->nread >= 0);
7612 
7613  switch (backup_header_p->zip_method)
7614  {
7615  case FILEIO_ZIP_LZO1X_METHOD:
7616  if (backup_header_p->zip_level == FILEIO_ZIP_LZO1X_999_LEVEL)
7617  {
7618  /* best reduction */
7619  rv =
7620  lzo1x_999_compress ((lzo_bytep) node_p->area, (lzo_uint) node_p->nread, node_p->zip_page->buf,
7621  &node_p->zip_page->buf_len, node_p->wrkmem);
7622  }
7623  else
7624  {
7625  /* best speed */
7626  rv =
7627  lzo1x_1_compress ((lzo_bytep) node_p->area, (lzo_uint) node_p->nread, node_p->zip_page->buf,
7628  &node_p->zip_page->buf_len, node_p->wrkmem);
7629  }
7630  if (rv != LZO_E_OK || (node_p->zip_page->buf_len > (size_t) (node_p->nread + node_p->nread / 16 + 64 + 3)))
7631  {
7632  /* this should NEVER happen */
7633  error = ER_IO_LZO_COMPRESS_FAIL;
7634  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 4, backup_header_p->zip_method,
7635  fileio_get_zip_method_string (backup_header_p->zip_method), backup_header_p->zip_level,
7636  fileio_get_zip_level_string (backup_header_p->zip_level));
7637 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
7638  fprintf (stdout,
7639  "internal error - compression failed: %d, node->pageid = %d, node->nread = %d, "
7640  "node->zip_page->buf_len = %d, node->nread + node->nread / 16 + 64 + 3 = %d\n", rv,
7641  node_p->pageid, node_p->nread, node_p->zip_page->buf_len,
7642  node_p->nread + node_p->nread / 16 + 64 + 3);
7643 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
7644  goto exit_on_error;
7645  }
7646 
7647  if (node_p->zip_page->buf_len < (size_t) node_p->nread)
7648  {
7649  /* already write compressed block */
7650  ;
7651  }
7652  else
7653  {
7654  /* not compressible - write uncompressed block */
7655  node_p->zip_page->buf_len = (lzo_uint) node_p->nread;
7656  memcpy (node_p->zip_page->buf, node_p->area, node_p->nread);
7657  }
7658  break;
7659  case FILEIO_ZIP_ZLIB_METHOD:
7660  break;
7661  default:
7662  break;
7663  }
7664 
7665 exit_on_end:
7666 
7667  return error;
7668 exit_on_error:
7669 
7670  if (error == NO_ERROR)
7671  {
7672  error = ER_FAILED;
7673  }
7674  goto exit_on_end;
7675 }
7676 
7677 /*
7678  * fileio_write_backup_node () -
7679  * return:
7680  * thread_p(in):
7681  * session_p(in/out):
7682  * node_p(in):
7683  * backup_header_p(in):
7684  */
7685 static int
7686 fileio_write_backup_node (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, FILEIO_NODE * node_p,
7687  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER * backup_header_p)
7688 {
7689  int error = NO_ERROR;
7690 
7691  if (!session_p || !node_p || !backup_header_p)
7692  {
7693  goto exit_on_error;
7694  }
7695 
7696  switch (backup_header_p->zip_method)
7697  {
7698  case FILEIO_ZIP_LZO1X_METHOD:
7699  session_p->dbfile.area = (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) node_p->zip_page;
7700  node_p->nread = sizeof (lzo_uint) + node_p->zip_page->buf_len;
7701  break;
7702  case FILEIO_ZIP_ZLIB_METHOD:
7703  break;
7704  default:
7705  session_p->dbfile.area = node_p->area;
7706  break;
7707  }
7708 
7709  if (fileio_write_backup (thread_p, session_p, node_p->nread) != NO_ERROR)
7710  {
7711  goto exit_on_error;
7712  }
7713 
7714 exit_on_end:
7715 
7716  return error;
7717 
7718 exit_on_error:
7719 
7720  if (error == NO_ERROR)
7721  {
7722  error = ER_FAILED;
7723  }
7724  goto exit_on_end;
7725 }
7726 
7727 /*
7728  * fileio_read_backup_volume () -
7729  * return:
7730  * session(in/out):
7731  */
7732 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
7733 static void
7734 fileio_read_backup_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p)
7735 {
7736  FILEIO_THREAD_INFO *thread_info_p;
7737  FILEIO_QUEUE *queue_p;
7738  FILEIO_NODE *node_p = NULL;
7739  int rv;
7740  bool need_unlock = false;
7741  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER *backup_header_p;
7742  FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *save_area_p;
7743 
7744  if (thread_p == NULL)
7745  {
7746  thread_p = thread_get_thread_entry_info ();
7747  if (thread_p == NULL)
7748  {
7749  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
7750  return;
7751  }
7752  }
7753 
7754  if (!session_p)
7755  {
7756  return;
7757  }
7758 
7759  thread_info_p = &session_p->read_thread_info;
7760  queue_p = &thread_info_p->io_queue;
7761  /* thread service routine has tran_index_lock, and should release before it is working */
7762  pthread_mutex_unlock (&thread_p->tran_index_lock);
7763  thread_p->tran_index = thread_info_p->tran_index;
7764 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
7765  fprintf (stdout, "start io_backup_volume_read, session = %p\n", session_p);
7766 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
7767  backup_header_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
7768  node_p = NULL; /* init */
7769  while (1)
7770  {
7771  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&thread_info_p->mtx);
7772  while (thread_info_p->io_type == FILEIO_WRITE)
7773  {
7774  pthread_cond_wait (&thread_info_p->rcv, &thread_info_p->mtx);
7775  }
7776 
7777  if (thread_info_p->io_type == FILEIO_ERROR_INTERRUPT)
7778  {
7779  need_unlock = true;
7780  node_p = NULL;
7781  goto exit_on_error;
7782  }
7783 
7784  /* get one page from queue head and do write */
7785  if (node_p)
7786  {
7787  node_p->writeable = true;
7788  thread_info_p->io_type = FILEIO_WRITE;
7789  pthread_cond_signal (&thread_info_p->wcv); /* wake up write thread */
7790  while (thread_info_p->io_type == FILEIO_WRITE)
7791  {
7792  pthread_cond_wait (&thread_info_p->rcv, &thread_info_p->mtx);
7793  }
7794 
7795  if (thread_info_p->io_type == FILEIO_ERROR_INTERRUPT)
7796  {
7797  need_unlock = true;
7798  node_p = NULL;
7799  goto exit_on_error;
7800  }
7801  }
7802 
7803  /* check EOF */
7804  if (thread_info_p->pageid >= thread_info_p->from_npages)
7805  {
7806  thread_info_p->end_r_threads++;
7807  if (thread_info_p->end_r_threads >= thread_info_p->act_r_threads)
7808  {
7809  thread_info_p->io_type = FILEIO_WRITE;
7810  pthread_cond_signal (&thread_info_p->wcv); /* wake up write thread */
7811  }
7812  pthread_mutex_unlock (&thread_info_p->mtx);
7813  break;
7814  }
7815
