7816  /* alloc queue node */
7817  node_p = fileio_allocate_node (queue_p, backup_header_p);
7818  if (node_p == NULL)
7819  {
7820  thread_info_p->io_type = FILEIO_ERROR_INTERRUPT;
7821  need_unlock = true;
7822  goto exit_on_error;
7823  }
7824 
7825  /* read one page from Disk sequentially */
7826 
7827  save_area_p = session_p->dbfile.area; /* save link */
7828  session_p->dbfile.area = node_p->area;
7829  node_p->pageid = thread_info_p->pageid;
7830  node_p->writeable = false; /* init */
7831  node_p->nread = fileio_read_backup (thread_p, session_p, node_p->pageid);
7832  session_p->dbfile.area = save_area_p; /* restore link */
7833  if (node_p->nread == -1)
7834  {
7835  thread_info_p->io_type = FILEIO_ERROR_INTERRUPT;
7836  need_unlock = true;
7837  goto exit_on_error;
7838  }
7839  else if (node_p->nread == 0)
7840  {
7841  /* This could be an error since we estimated more pages. End of file/volume. */
7842  thread_info_p->io_type = FILEIO_ERROR_INTERRUPT;
7843  need_unlock = true;
7844  goto exit_on_error;
7845  }
7846 
7847  /* Have to allow other threads to run and check for interrupts from the user (i.e. Ctrl-C ) */
7848  if ((thread_info_p->pageid % FILEIO_CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPT_INTERVAL) == 0
7849  && pgbuf_is_log_check_for_interrupts (thread_p) == true)
7850  {
7851 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
7852  fprintf (stdout, "io_backup_volume_read interrupt\n");
7853 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
7854  thread_info_p->io_type = FILEIO_ERROR_INTERRUPT;
7855  need_unlock = true;
7856  goto exit_on_error;
7857  }
7858 
7859  /*
7860  * Do we need to backup this page ?
7861  * In other words, has it been changed since either the previous backup
7862  * of this level or a lower level.
7863  */
7864 
7865  if (thread_info_p->only_updated_pages == false || LSA_ISNULL (&session_p->dbfile.lsa)
7866  || LSA_LT (&session_p->dbfile.lsa, &node_p->area->iopage.prv.lsa))
7867  {
7868  /* Backup the content of this page along with its page identifier add alloced node to the queue */
7869  (void) fileio_append_queue (queue_p, node_p);
7870  }
7871  else
7872  {
7873  /* free node */
7874  (void) fileio_free_node (queue_p, node_p);
7875  node_p = NULL;
7876  }
7877 
7878 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
7879  fprintf (stdout, "read_thread from_npages = %d, pageid = %d\n", thread_info_p->from_npages,
7880  thread_info_p->pageid);
7881 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
7882  thread_info_p->pageid++;
7883  pthread_mutex_unlock (&thread_info_p->mtx);
7884  if (node_p)
7885  {
7886  node_p->nread += FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE_OVERHEAD;
7887  FILEIO_SET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID_COPY (node_p->area, node_p->pageid, backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
7888 
7889 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
7890  fprintf (stdout, "fileio_read_backup_volume: %d\t%d,\t%d\n",
7891  ((FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) (node_p->area))->iopageid,
7892  *(PAGEID *) (((char *) (node_p->area)) + offsetof (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage) +
7893  backup_header_p->bkpagesize), backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
7894 #endif
7895 
7896  if (backup_header_p->zip_method != FILEIO_ZIP_NONE_METHOD
7897  && fileio_compress_backup_node (node_p, backup_header_p) != NO_ERROR)
7898  {
7899  thread_info_p->io_type = FILEIO_ERROR_INTERRUPT;
7900  need_unlock = false;
7901  node_p = NULL;
7902  goto exit_on_error;
7903  }
7904  }
7905  }
7906 
7907 exit_on_end:
7908 
7909 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
7910  fprintf (stdout, "end io_backup_volume_read\n");
7911 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
7912  return;
7913 exit_on_error:
7914 
7915  /* set error info */
7916  if (thread_info_p->errid == NO_ERROR)
7917  {
7918  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
7919  thread_info_p->errid = er_errid ();
7920  }
7921 
7922  thread_info_p->end_r_threads++;
7923  if (thread_info_p->end_r_threads >= thread_info_p->act_r_threads)
7924  {
7925  pthread_cond_signal (&thread_info_p->wcv); /* wake up write thread */
7926  }
7927 
7928  if (need_unlock)
7929  {
7930  pthread_mutex_unlock (&thread_info_p->mtx);
7931  }
7932 
7933  if (node_p != NULL)
7934  {
7935  (void) fileio_free_node (queue_p, node_p);
7936  }
7937 
7938  goto exit_on_end;
7939 }
7940 
7941 /*
7942  * fileio_write_backup_volume () -
7943  * return:
7944  * session(in/out):
7945  */
7946 static FILEIO_TYPE
7947 fileio_write_backup_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p)
7948 {
7949  FILEIO_THREAD_INFO *thread_info_p;
7950  FILEIO_QUEUE *queue_p;
7951  FILEIO_NODE *node_p;
7952  int rv;
7953  bool need_unlock = false;
7954  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER *backup_header_p;
7955  FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *save_area_p;
7956 
7957  if (!session_p)
7958  {
7959  return FILEIO_WRITE;
7960  }
7961 
7962  thread_info_p = &session_p->read_thread_info;
7963  queue_p = &thread_info_p->io_queue;
7964 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
7965  fprintf (stdout, "start io_backup_volume_write\n");
7966 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
7967  backup_header_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
7968  rv = pthread_mutex_lock (&thread_info_p->mtx);
7969  while (1)
7970  {
7971  while (thread_info_p->io_type == FILEIO_READ)
7972  {
7973  pthread_cond_wait (&thread_info_p->wcv, &thread_info_p->mtx);
7974  }
7975 
7976  if (thread_info_p->io_type == FILEIO_ERROR_INTERRUPT)
7977  {
7978  need_unlock = true;
7979  goto exit_on_error;
7980  }
7981 
7982  /* do write */
7983  while (queue_p->head && queue_p->head->writeable == true)
7984  {
7985  /* delete the head node of the queue */
7986  node_p = fileio_delete_queue_head (queue_p);
7987  if (node_p == NULL)
7988  {
7989  thread_info_p->io_type = FILEIO_ERROR_INTERRUPT;
7990  }
7991  else
7992  {
7993  save_area_p = session_p->dbfile.area; /* save link */
7994  rv = fileio_write_backup_node (thread_p, session_p, node_p, backup_header_p);
7995  if (rv != NO_ERROR)
7996  {
7997  thread_info_p->io_type = FILEIO_ERROR_INTERRUPT;
7998  }
7999  session_p->dbfile.area = save_area_p; /* restore link */
8000 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
8001  fprintf (stdout, "write_thread node->pageid = %d, node->nread = %d\n", node_p->pageid, node_p->nread);
8002 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
8003  if (session_p->verbose_fp && thread_info_p->from_npages >= 25
8004  && node_p->pageid >= thread_info_p->check_npages)
8005  {
8006  fprintf (session_p->verbose_fp, "#");
8007  thread_info_p->check_ratio++;
8008  thread_info_p->check_npages =
8009  (int) (((float) thread_info_p->from_npages / 25.0) * thread_info_p->check_ratio);
8010  }
8011 
8012  /* free node */
8013  (void) fileio_free_node (queue_p, node_p);
8014  }
8015 
8016  if (thread_info_p->io_type == FILEIO_ERROR_INTERRUPT)
8017  {
8018  need_unlock = true;
8019  goto exit_on_error;
8020  }
8021  }
8022 
8023  thread_info_p->io_type = FILEIO_READ; /* reset */
8024  /* check EOF */
8025  if (thread_info_p->end_r_threads >= thread_info_p->act_r_threads)
8026  {
8027  /* only write thread alive */
8028  pthread_mutex_unlock (&thread_info_p->mtx);
8029  break;
8030  }
8031 
8032  pthread_cond_broadcast (&thread_info_p->rcv); /* wake up all read threads */
8033  }
8034 
8035 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
8036  fprintf (stdout, "end io_backup_volume_write\n");
8037 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
8038 exit_on_end:
8039 
8040  return thread_info_p->io_type;
8041 exit_on_error:
8042 
8043  /* set error info */
8044  if (er_errid () == NO_ERROR)
8045  {
8046  switch (thread_info_p->errid)
8047  {
8048  case ER_INTERRUPTED:
8049  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INTERRUPTED, 0);
8050  break;
8051  default: /* give up to handle this case */
8052  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOG_DBBACKUP_FAIL, 1,
8053  fileio_get_base_file_name (backup_header_p->db_fullname));
8054  break;
8055  }
8056  }
8057 
8058  if (thread_info_p->end_r_threads >= thread_info_p->act_r_threads)
8059  {
8060  /* only write thread alive an error (i.e, INTERRUPT) was broken out, so terminate the all threads. But, I am the
8061  * last one, and all the readers are terminated */
8062  pthread_mutex_unlock (&thread_info_p->mtx);
8063  goto exit_on_end;
8064  }
8065 
8066  /* wake up all read threads and wait for all killed */
8067  pthread_cond_broadcast (&thread_info_p->rcv);
8068  pthread_cond_wait (&thread_info_p->wcv, &thread_info_p->mtx);
8069  pthread_mutex_unlock (&thread_info_p->mtx);
8070  goto exit_on_end;
8071 }
8072 
8073 // *INDENT-OFF*
8074 class fileio_read_backup_volume_task : public cubthread::entry_task
8075 {
8076 public:
8077  fileio_read_backup_volume_task (void) = delete;
8078 
8079  fileio_read_backup_volume_task (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION *session_p)
8080  : m_backup_session (session_p)
8081  {
8082  }
8083 
8084  void
8085  execute (context_type &thread_ref) override final
8086  {
8087  fileio_read_backup_volume (&thread_ref, m_backup_session);
8088  }
8089 
8090 private:
8091  FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION *m_backup_session;
8092 };
8093 // *INDENT-ON*
8094 
8095 static int
8096 fileio_start_backup_thread (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p,
8097  FILEIO_THREAD_INFO * thread_info_p, int from_npages, bool is_only_updated_pages,
8098  int check_ratio, int check_npages, FILEIO_QUEUE * queue_p)
8099 {
8100  CSS_CONN_ENTRY *conn_p;
8101  int i;
8102 
8103  /* Initialize global MT variables */
8104  thread_info_p->end_r_threads = 0;
8105  thread_info_p->pageid = 0;
8106  thread_info_p->from_npages = from_npages;
8107  thread_info_p->io_type = FILEIO_READ;
8108  thread_info_p->errid = NO_ERROR;
8109  thread_info_p->only_updated_pages = is_only_updated_pages;
8110  thread_info_p->check_ratio = check_ratio;
8111  thread_info_p->check_npages = check_npages;
8112  thread_info_p->tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
8113  /* start read threads */
8114  conn_p = css_get_current_conn_entry ();
8115  for (i = 1; i <= thread_info_p->act_r_threads; i++)
8116  {
8117  css_push_external_task (conn_p, new fileio_read_backup_volume_task (session_p));
8118  }
8119 
8120  /* work as write thread */
8121  (void) fileio_write_backup_volume (thread_p, session_p);
8122  /* at here, finished all read threads check error, interrupt */
8123  if (thread_info_p->io_type == FILEIO_ERROR_INTERRUPT || queue_p->size != 0)
8124  {
8125  return ER_FAILED;
8126  }
8127 
8128  return NO_ERROR;
8129 }
8130 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
8131 
8132 #if !defined(CS_MODE)
8133 /*
8134  * fileio_backup_volume () - Include the given database volume/file as part of
8135  * the backup
8136  * return:
8137  * session(in/out): The session array
8138  * from_vlabel(in): Name of the database volume/file to include
8139  * from_volid(in): Identifier of the database volume/file to include
8140  * last_page(in): stop backing up this volume after this page
8141  * only_updated_pages(in): If we are backing up the database with a specific
8142  * backup level. We may opt to backup only the
8143  * updated pages since previous backup.
8144  *
8145  * Note: Information about the database volume/file is recorded, so it
8146  * can be recreated (e.g., name and space).
8147  * If this is an incremental backup, only pages that have been
8148  * updated since the previous backup are backed up, unless a
8149  * specific request is given to backup all pages.
8150  * Last_page can shorten the number of pages saved (i.e. for
8151  * temp volumes, we do not need to backup the entire volume).
8152  *
8153  * 1) The pages are backed up as they are currently stored on disk,
8154  * that is, we do not use the page buffer pool for this operation
8155  * since we do not want to disturbe the normal access patern of
8156  * clients in the page buffer pool.
8157  * 2) We open the file/volume instead of using the actual vdes, so
8158  * that we avoid a bunch of lseeks.
8159  */
8160 int
8161 fileio_backup_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, const char *from_vol_label_p,
8162  VOLID from_vol_id, PAGEID last_page, bool is_only_updated_pages)
8163 {
8164  struct stat from_stbuf;
8165  int from_npages, npages;
8166  int page_id;
8167  int nread;
8168  FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER *file_header_p;
8169  int check_ratio = 0;
8170  int check_npages = 0;
8171  FILEIO_THREAD_INFO *thread_info_p;
8172  FILEIO_QUEUE *queue_p = NULL;
8173  FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *save_area_p;
8174  FILEIO_NODE *node_p = NULL;
8175  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER *backup_header_p;
8176  int rv;
8177  bool is_need_vol_closed;
8178 
8179 #if (defined(WINDOWS) || !defined(SERVER_MODE))
8180  off_t saved_act_log_fp = (off_t) - 1;
8181 #endif /* WINDOWS || !SERVER_MODE */
8182 
8183  /*
8184  * Backup the pages as they are stored on disk (i.e., don't care if they
8185  * are stored on the page buffer pool any longer). We do not use the page
8186  * buffer pool since we do not want to remove important pages that are
8187  * used by clients.
8188  * We also open the file/volume instead of using the one currently
8189  * available since we do not want to be doing a lot of seeks.
8190  * Remember that we can be preempted.
8191  */
8192  session_p->dbfile.vlabel = from_vol_label_p;
8193  session_p->dbfile.volid = from_vol_id;
8194  session_p->dbfile.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
8195  is_need_vol_closed = false;
8196  if (from_vol_id == LOG_DBLOG_ACTIVE_VOLID)
8197  {
8198  session_p->dbfile.vdes = fileio_get_volume_descriptor (LOG_DBLOG_ACTIVE_VOLID);
8199 #if (defined(WINDOWS) || !defined(SERVER_MODE))
8200  if (session_p->dbfile.vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
8201  {
8202  /* save current file pointer */
8203  saved_act_log_fp = lseek (session_p->dbfile.vdes, (off_t) 0, SEEK_CUR);
8204  /* reset file pointer */
8205  if (saved_act_log_fp == (off_t) - 1)
8206  {
8207  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_READ, 1, session_p->dbfile.vlabel);
8208  goto error;
8209  }
8210 
8211  if (lseek (session_p->dbfile.vdes, (off_t) 0, SEEK_SET) == (off_t) - 1)
8212  {
8213  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_READ, 1, session_p->dbfile.vlabel);
8214  goto error;
8215  }
8216  }
8217 #endif /* WINDOWS || !SERVER_MODE */
8218  }
8219 
8220  if (session_p->dbfile.vdes == NULL_VOLDES)
8221  {
8222  session_p->dbfile.vdes = fileio_open (session_p->dbfile.vlabel, O_RDONLY, 0);
8223  if (session_p->dbfile.vdes == NULL_VOLDES)
8224  {
8225  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, session_p->dbfile.vlabel);
8226  goto error;
8227  }
8228  is_need_vol_closed = true;
8229  }
8230 
8231  if (fstat (session_p->dbfile.vdes, &from_stbuf) == -1)
8232  {
8233  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, session_p->dbfile.vlabel);
8234  goto error;
8235  }
8236 
8237  if (S_ISREG (from_stbuf.st_mode))
8238  {
8239  /* regular file */
8240  session_p->dbfile.nbytes = from_stbuf.st_size;
8241  }
8242  else
8243  {
8244  /* raw device??? */
8245  session_p->dbfile.nbytes = (INT64) xdisk_get_total_numpages (thread_p, from_vol_id) * (INT64) IO_PAGESIZE;
8246  }
8247 
8248  /* print the number divided by volume pagesize */
8249  npages = (int) CEIL_PTVDIV (session_p->dbfile.nbytes, IO_PAGESIZE);
8250  backup_header_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
8251  if (session_p->verbose_fp)
8252  {
8253  fprintf (session_p->verbose_fp, " %-28s | %10d | ", fileio_get_base_file_name (from_vol_label_p), npages);
8254  }
8255 
8256  /* set the number divied by backup pagesize */
8257  if (last_page >= 0 && last_page < npages)
8258  {
8259  from_npages = CEIL_PTVDIV ((last_page + 1) * IO_PAGESIZE, backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
8260  }
8261  else
8262  {
8263  from_npages = (int) CEIL_PTVDIV (session_p->dbfile.nbytes, backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
8264  }
8265 
8266  /* Write a backup file header which identifies this volume/file on the backup. File headers do not use the extra
8267  * pageid_copy field. */
8268  session_p->dbfile.area->iopageid = FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_START_PAGE_ID;
8269  file_header_p = (FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER *) (&session_p->dbfile.area->iopage);
8270  file_header_p->volid = session_p->dbfile.volid;
8271  file_header_p->nbytes = session_p->dbfile.nbytes;
8272  strncpy (file_header_p->vlabel, session_p->dbfile.vlabel, PATH_MAX);
8273  nread = FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER_PAGE_SIZE;
8274  if (fileio_write_backup (thread_p, session_p, nread) != NO_ERROR)
8275  {
8276  goto error;
8277  }
8278 
8279 
8280 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
8281  /* How about adding a backup verbose option ... to print this sort of information as the backup is progressing? A DBA
8282  * could later compare the information thus gathered with a restore -t option to verify the integrity of the archive. */
8283  if (io_Bkuptrace_debug > 0)
8284  {
8285  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_FILE),
8286  file_header_p->vlabel, file_header_p->volid, file_header_p->nbytes, CEIL_PTVDIV (file_header_p->nbytes,
8287  IO_PAGESIZE));
8288  fprintf (stdout, "\n");
8289  }
8290 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
8291 
8292  /* Now start reading each page and writing each page to the backup. */
8293  if (session_p->verbose_fp)
8294  {
8295  check_ratio = 1;
8296  check_npages = (int) (((float) from_npages / 25.0) * check_ratio);
8297  }
8298 
8299  thread_info_p = &session_p->read_thread_info;
8300  queue_p = &thread_info_p->io_queue;
8301  /* set the number of activated read threads */
8302  thread_info_p->act_r_threads = MAX (thread_info_p->num_threads - 1, 0);
8303  thread_info_p->act_r_threads = MIN (thread_info_p->act_r_threads, from_npages);
8304  if (thread_info_p->act_r_threads > 0)
8305  {
8306 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
8307  if (fileio_start_backup_thread (thread_p, session_p, thread_info_p, from_npages, is_only_updated_pages,
8308  check_ratio, check_npages, queue_p) != NO_ERROR)
8309  {
8310  goto error;
8311  }
8312 
8313  if (session_p->verbose_fp)
8314  {
8315  check_ratio = thread_info_p->check_ratio;
8316  }
8317 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
8318  }
8319  else
8320  {
8321  for (page_id = 0; page_id < from_npages; page_id++)
8322  {
8323  /* Have to allow other threads to run and check for interrupts from the user (i.e. Ctrl-C ). check for
8324  * standalone-mode too. */
8325  if ((page_id % FILEIO_CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPT_INTERVAL) == 0
8326  && pgbuf_is_log_check_for_interrupts (thread_p) == true)
8327  {
8328  goto error;
8329  }
8330 
8331  /* alloc queue node */
8332  node_p = fileio_allocate_node (queue_p, backup_header_p);
8333  if (node_p == NULL)
8334  {
8335  goto error;
8336  }
8337 
8338  /* read one page sequentially */
8339  save_area_p = session_p->dbfile.area; /* save link */
8340  session_p->dbfile.area = node_p->area;
8341  node_p->pageid = page_id;
8342  node_p->nread = fileio_read_backup (thread_p, session_p, node_p->pageid);
8343  session_p->dbfile.area = save_area_p; /* restore link */
8344  if (node_p->nread == -1)
8345  {
8346  goto error;
8347  }
8348  else if (node_p->nread == 0)
8349  {
8350  /* This could be an error since we estimated more pages. End of file/volume. */
8351  (void) fileio_free_node (queue_p, node_p);
8352  node_p = NULL;
8353  break;
8354  }
8355 
8356  /*
8357  * Do we need to backup this page ?
8358  * In other words, has it been changed since either the previous backup
8359  * of this level or a lower level.
8360  */
8361 
8362  if (is_only_updated_pages == false || LSA_ISNULL (&session_p->dbfile.lsa)
8363  || LSA_LT (&session_p->dbfile.lsa, &node_p->area->iopage.prv.lsa))
8364  {
8365  /* Backup the content of this page along with its page identifier */
8366 
8367  node_p->nread += FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE_OVERHEAD;
8368  FILEIO_SET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID_COPY (node_p->area, node_p->pageid, backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
8369 
8370 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
8371  fprintf (stdout, "fileio_backup_volume: %d\t%d,\t%d\n", ((FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) (node_p->area))->iopageid,
8372  *(PAGEID *) (((char *) (node_p->area)) + offsetof (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage) +
8373  backup_header_p->bkpagesize), backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
8374 #endif
8375 
8376  if (backup_header_p->zip_method != FILEIO_ZIP_NONE_METHOD
8377  && fileio_compress_backup_node (node_p, backup_header_p) != NO_ERROR)
8378  {
8379  goto error;
8380  }
8381 
8382  save_area_p = session_p->dbfile.area; /* save link */
8383  rv = fileio_write_backup_node (thread_p, session_p, node_p, backup_header_p);
8384  session_p->dbfile.area = save_area_p; /* restore link */
8385  if (rv != NO_ERROR)
8386  {
8387  goto error;
8388  }
8389  }
8390 
8391  if (session_p->verbose_fp && from_npages >= 25 && page_id >= check_npages)
8392  {
8393  fprintf (session_p->verbose_fp, "#");
8394  check_ratio++;
8395  check_npages = (int) (((float) from_npages / 25.0) * check_ratio);
8396  }
8397 
8398  /* free node */
8399  (void) fileio_free_node (queue_p, node_p);
8400  node_p = NULL;
8401  }
8402  }
8403 
8404  /* End of FILE */
8405 
8406  /* alloc queue node */
8407  node_p = fileio_allocate_node (queue_p, backup_header_p);
8408  if (node_p == NULL)
8409  {
8410  goto error;
8411  }
8412 
8413  node_p->nread = backup_header_p->bkpagesize + FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE_OVERHEAD;
8414  memset (&node_p->area->iopage, '\0', backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
8415  FILEIO_SET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (node_p->area, FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_END_PAGE_ID, backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
8416 
8417 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
8418  fprintf (stdout, "io_backup_volume: %d\t%d,\t%d\n", ((FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) (node_p->area))->iopageid,
8419  *(PAGEID *) (((char *) (node_p->area)) + offsetof (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage) +
8420  backup_header_p->bkpagesize), backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
8421 #endif
8422 
8423  if (backup_header_p->zip_method != FILEIO_ZIP_NONE_METHOD
8424  && fileio_compress_backup_node (node_p, backup_header_p) != NO_ERROR)
8425  {
8426  goto error;
8427  }
8428 
8429  save_area_p = session_p->dbfile.area; /* save link */
8430  rv = fileio_write_backup_node (thread_p, session_p, node_p, backup_header_p);
8431  session_p->dbfile.area = save_area_p; /* restore link */
8432  if (rv != NO_ERROR)
8433  {
8434  goto error;
8435  }
8436 
8437  /* free node */
8438  (void) fileio_free_node (queue_p, node_p);
8439  node_p = NULL;
8440 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
8441  fprintf (stdout, "volume EOF : bkpagesize = %d, voltotalio = %ld\n", backup_header_p->bkpagesize,
8442  session_p->bkup.voltotalio);
8443 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
8444  /* Close the database volume/file */
8445  if (is_need_vol_closed == true)
8446  {
8447  fileio_close (session_p->dbfile.vdes);
8448  }
8449 #if (defined(WINDOWS) || !defined(SERVER_MODE))
8450  else
8451  {
8452  if (from_vol_id == LOG_DBLOG_ACTIVE_VOLID && session_p->dbfile.vdes != NULL_VOLDES && saved_act_log_fp >= 0)
8453  {
8454  /* restore file pointer */
8455  lseek (session_p->dbfile.vdes, saved_act_log_fp, SEEK_SET);
8456  }
8457  }
8458 #endif /* WINDOWS || !SERVER_MODE */
8459 
8460  session_p->dbfile.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
8461  session_p->dbfile.volid = NULL_VOLID;
8462  session_p->dbfile.nbytes = -1;
8463  session_p->dbfile.vlabel = NULL;
8464  if (session_p->verbose_fp)
8465  {
8466  if (from_npages < 25)
8467  {
8468  fprintf (session_p->verbose_fp, "######################### | done\n");
8469  }
8470  else
8471  {
8472  while (check_ratio <= 25)
8473  {
8474  fprintf (session_p->verbose_fp, "#");
8475  check_ratio++;
8476  }
8477  fprintf (session_p->verbose_fp, " | done\n");
8478  }
8479  }
8480 
8481  return NO_ERROR;
8482 
8483 error:
8484  if (is_need_vol_closed == true)
8485  {
8486  fileio_close (session_p->dbfile.vdes);
8487  }
8488 #if (defined(WINDOWS) || !defined(SERVER_MODE))
8489  else
8490  {
8491  if (from_vol_id == LOG_DBLOG_ACTIVE_VOLID && session_p->dbfile.vdes != NULL_VOLDES && saved_act_log_fp >= 0)
8492  {
8493  /* restore file pointer */
8494  lseek (session_p->dbfile.vdes, saved_act_log_fp, SEEK_SET);
8495  }
8496  }
8497 #endif /* WINDOWS || !SERVER_MODE */
8498 
8499  if (node_p != NULL)
8500  {
8501  (void) fileio_free_node (queue_p, node_p);
8502  }
8503 
8504  session_p->dbfile.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
8505  session_p->dbfile.volid = NULL_VOLID;
8506  session_p->dbfile.nbytes = -1;
8507  session_p->dbfile.vlabel = NULL;
8508  return ER_FAILED;
8509 }
8510 #endif /* !CS_MODE */
8511 
8512 /*
8513  * fileio_flush_backup () - Flush any buffered data
8514  * return:
8515  * session(in/out): The session array
8516  *
8517  * Note: When the output fills up, we prompt for another volume or more space.
8518  * Incomplete blocks are repeated at the start of the following archive,
8519  * in order to insure that we do not try to read from incomplete tape
8520  * blocks.
8521  */
8522 static int
8523 fileio_flush_backup (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p)
8524 {
8525  char *buffer_p;
8526  ssize_t nbytes;
8527  int count;
8528  bool is_interactive_need_new = false;
8529  bool is_force_new_bkvol = false;
8530 
8531  if ((int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE) > 0
8532  && session_p->bkup.count > (int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE))
8533  {
8534  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "Backup_flush: Backup aborted because count %d larger than max volume size %d\n",
8535  session_p->bkup.count, (int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE));
8536  return ER_FAILED;
8537  }
8538 
8539 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
8540  fprintf (stdout, "io_backup_flush: bkup.count = %d, voltotalio = %ld\n", session_p->bkup.count,
8541  session_p->bkup.voltotalio);
8542 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
8543  /*
8544  * Flush any buffered bytes.
8545  * NOTE that we do not call fileio_write since it will try to do lseek and some
8546  * backup devices do not seek.
8547  */
8548  if (session_p->bkup.count > 0)
8549  {
8550  restart_newvol:
8551  /*
8552  * Determine number of bytes we can safely write to this volume
8553  * being mindful of the max specified by the user.
8554  */
8555  is_interactive_need_new = false;
8556  is_force_new_bkvol = false;
8557  count = session_p->bkup.count;
8558  if ((int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE) > 0)
8559  {
8560  count =
8561  (int) MIN (count,
8562  (int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE) - session_p->bkup.voltotalio);
8563  }
8564  buffer_p = session_p->bkup.buffer;
8565  do
8566  {
8567  /* disk file size check */
8568 
8569 
8570  if (session_p->bkup.voltotalio >= OFF_T_MAX && session_p->bkup.dtype == FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DIRECTORY)
8571  {
8572  /* New volume is needed */
8573  is_force_new_bkvol = true;
8574  }
8575  else
8576  {
8577  /* Write the data */
8578  nbytes = write (session_p->bkup.vdes, buffer_p, count);
8579  if (nbytes <= 0)
8580  {
8581  if (nbytes == 0)
8582  {
8583  is_interactive_need_new = true; /* For raw partitions */
8584  }
8585  else
8586  {
8587  switch (errno)
8588  {
8589  /* equiv to try again */
8590  case EINTR:
8591  case EAGAIN:
8592  continue;
8593  /* New volume is needed and no user interaction needed */
8594 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
8595  case EDQUOT:
8596 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
8597  case EFBIG:
8598  case EIO:
8599  case EINVAL:
8600  is_force_new_bkvol = true;
8601  break;
8602  /* New volume is needed and requires user interaction */
8603  case ENXIO:
8604  case ENOSPC:
8605  case EPIPE:
8606  is_interactive_need_new = true;
8607  break;
8608  /* equiv -- Failure */
8609  default:
8610  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE, 2,
8611  CEIL_PTVDIV (session_p->bkup.voltotalio, IO_PAGESIZE),
8612  session_p->bkup.vlabel);
8613  return ER_FAILED;
8614  }
8615  }
8616  }
8617  else
8618  {
8619  session_p->bkup.voltotalio += nbytes;
8620  count -= (int) nbytes;
8621  buffer_p += nbytes;
8622  }
8623  }
8624 
8625  if (is_interactive_need_new || is_force_new_bkvol
8626  || ((int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE) > 0
8627  && (session_p->bkup.voltotalio >= (int) prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_MAX_VOLUME_SIZE))))
8628  {
8629 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
8630  fprintf (stdout, "open a new backup volume\n");
8631 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
8632  /* Finish this volume, fixup session and open a new volume */
8633  if ((fileio_get_next_backup_volume (thread_p, session_p, is_interactive_need_new) != NO_ERROR)
8634  || (fileio_write_backup_header (session_p) != NO_ERROR))
8635  {
8636  return ER_FAILED;
8637  }
8638  else
8639  {
8640  /* Because the buffer may have been incompletely written on a raw device (i.e. tape), we start a new
8641  * volume by repeating the current buffer block in its entirety immediately after the header. Upon
8642  * restore, the incomplete part will be ignored. */
8643  session_p->bkup.ptr = session_p->bkup.buffer;
8644  goto restart_newvol;
8645  }
8646  }
8647  }
8648  while (count > 0);
8649  /* Update session to reflect that flush completed. */
8650  session_p->bkup.count = 0; /* can only update after flush completes */
8651  session_p->bkup.ptr = session_p->bkup.buffer;
8652  }
8653 
8654  return NO_ERROR;
8655 }
8656 
8657 /*
8658  * fileio_read_backup () - Read a database page from the current database
8659  * volume/file that is backed up
8660  * return:
8661  * session(in/out): The session array
8662  * pageid(in): The page from which we are reading
8663  *
8664  * Note: If we run into an end of file, we filled the page with nulls. This is
8665  * needed since we write full pages to back up destination. Without this,
8666  * we will not be able to know how much to read since not necessarily
8667  * the whole volume/file is backed up.
8668  */
8669 static ssize_t
8670 fileio_read_backup (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, int page_id)
8671 {
8672  int io_page_size = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->bkpagesize;
8673 #if defined(WINDOWS)
8674  int nread, nbytes;
8675 #else
8676  ssize_t nread, nbytes;
8677 #endif
8678  char *buffer_p;
8679 
8680  /* Read until you acumulate io_pagesize or the EOF mark is reached. */
8681  nread = 0;
8682  FILEIO_SET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area, page_id, io_page_size);
8683 
8684 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
8685  fprintf (stdout, "fileio_read_backup: %d\t%d,\t%d\n", ((FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) (session_p->dbfile.area))->iopageid,
8686  *(PAGEID *) (((char *) (session_p->dbfile.area)) + offsetof (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage) + io_page_size),
8687  io_page_size);
8688 #endif
8689 
8690  buffer_p = (char *) &session_p->dbfile.area->iopage;
8691  while (nread < io_page_size)
8692  {
8693  /* Read the desired amount of bytes */
8694 #if !defined(SERVER_MODE)
8695  nbytes = read (session_p->dbfile.vdes, buffer_p, io_page_size - nread);
8696 #elif defined(WINDOWS)
8697  nbytes = read (session_p->dbfile.vdes, buffer_p, io_page_size - nread);
8698 #else
8699  nbytes =
8700  pread (session_p->dbfile.vdes, buffer_p, io_page_size - nread,
8701  FILEIO_GET_FILE_SIZE (io_page_size, page_id) + nread);
8702 #endif
8703  if (nbytes == -1)
8704  {
8705  if (errno != EINTR)
8706  {
8707  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_READ, 2,
8708  FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area), session_p->dbfile.vlabel);
8709  return -1;
8710  }
8711  }
8712  else if (nbytes == 0)
8713  {
8714  if (nread > 0)
8715  {
8716 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
8717  fprintf (stdout, "io_backup_read: io_pagesize = %d, nread = %d, voltotalio = %d : ADD FILLER\n",
8718  io_page_size, nread, session_p->bkup.voltotalio);
8719 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
8720  /*
8721  * We have a file that it is not multiples of io_pagesize.
8722  * We need to add a filler. otherwise, we will not be able to
8723  * find other files.
8724  */
8725  memset (buffer_p, '\0', io_page_size - nread);
8726  nread = io_page_size;
8727  }
8728  break;
8729  }
8730  nread += nbytes;
8731  buffer_p += nbytes;
8732  }
8733 
8734 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
8735  /* Backup Thread is reading data/log pages slowly to avoid IO burst */
8736  if (session_p->dbfile.volid == LOG_DBLOG_ACTIVE_VOLID
8737  || (session_p->dbfile.volid == LOG_DBLOG_ARCHIVE_VOLID && LOG_CS_OWN_WRITE_MODE (thread_p)))
8738  {
8739  ; /* go ahead */
8740  }
8741  else
8742  {
8743  int sleep_msecs;
8744 
8745  if (session_p->sleep_msecs > 0) /* priority 1 */
8746  {
8747  sleep_msecs = session_p->sleep_msecs;
8748  }
8749  else if (prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_SLEEP_MSECS) > 0) /* priority 2 */
8750  {
8751  sleep_msecs = prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_IO_BACKUP_SLEEP_MSECS);
8752  }
8753  else
8754  {
8755  sleep_msecs = 0;
8756  }
8757 
8758  if (sleep_msecs > 0)
8759  {
8760  sleep_msecs = (int) (((double) sleep_msecs) / (ONE_M / io_page_size));
8761 
8762  if (sleep_msecs > 0)
8763  {
8764  thread_sleep (sleep_msecs);
8765  }
8766  }
8767  }
8768 #endif
8769 
8770  return nread;
8771 }
8772 
8773 /*
8774  * fileio_write_backup () - Write the number of indicated bytes from the dbfile
8775  * area to to the backup destination
8776  * return:
8777  * session(in/out): The session array
8778  * towrite_nbytes(in): Number of bytes that must be written
8779  */
8780 static int
8781 fileio_write_backup (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, ssize_t to_write_nbytes)
8782 {
8783  char *buffer_p;
8784  ssize_t nbytes;
8785 
8786  buffer_p = (char *) session_p->dbfile.area;
8787  while (to_write_nbytes > 0)
8788  {
8789  /*
8790  * Buffer as much as you can, so that the device I/O will go through
8791  * without any problem. Remember some backup devices work only with
8792  * a fixed I/O length. We cannot use io_backup_write because we may
8793  * have been called recursively from there after the old volume filled.
8794  */
8795  nbytes = session_p->bkup.iosize - session_p->bkup.count;
8796  if (nbytes > to_write_nbytes)
8797  {
8798  nbytes = to_write_nbytes;
8799  }
8800 
8801  memcpy (session_p->bkup.ptr, buffer_p, nbytes);
8802  session_p->bkup.count += (int) nbytes;
8803  session_p->bkup.ptr += nbytes;
8804  buffer_p += nbytes;
8805  to_write_nbytes -= nbytes;
8806  if (session_p->bkup.count >= session_p->bkup.iosize)
8807  {
8808  if (fileio_flush_backup (thread_p, session_p) != NO_ERROR)
8809  {
8810  return ER_FAILED;
8811  }
8812  }
8813  }
8814 
8815  return NO_ERROR;
8816 }
8817 
8818 /*
8819  * fileio_write_backup_header () - Immediately write the backup header to the
8820  * destination
8821  * return:
8822  * session(in/out): The session array
8823  *
8824  * Note: Note that unlike io_backup_write, we do not buffer, instead we
8825  * write directly to the output destination the number of bytes
8826  * in a bkuphdr. This insures that headers all have the same
8827  * physical block size so we can read them properly. The main
8828  * purpose of this routine is to write the headers in a tape
8829  * friendly blocking factor such that we can be sure we can read
8830  * them back in without knowing how the tape was written in the
8831  * first place.
8832  */
8833 static int
8834 fileio_write_backup_header (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p)
8835 {
8836  char *buffer_p;
8837  int count, nbytes;
8838 
8839  /* Write immediately to the backup. We do not use fileio_write for the same reason io_backup_flush does not. */
8840  count = FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER_IO_SIZE;
8841  buffer_p = (char *) session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
8842  do
8843  {
8844  nbytes = write (session_p->bkup.vdes, buffer_p, count);
8845  if (nbytes == -1)
8846  {
8847  if (errno == EINTR || errno == EAGAIN)
8848  {
8849  continue;
8850  }
8851 
8852  if (errno == ENOSPC)
8853  {
8854  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE_OUT_OF_SPACE, 2,
8855  CEIL_PTVDIV (session_p->bkup.voltotalio, IO_PAGESIZE),
8856  fileio_get_volume_label_by_fd (session_p->bkup.vdes, PEEK));
8857  }
8858  else
8859  {
8860  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_WRITE, 2,
8861  CEIL_PTVDIV (session_p->bkup.voltotalio, IO_PAGESIZE), session_p->bkup.vlabel);
8862  }
8863  return ER_FAILED;
8864  }
8865  else
8866  {
8867  count -= nbytes;
8868  buffer_p += nbytes;
8869  }
8870  }
8871  while (count > 0);
8872  session_p->bkup.voltotalio += FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER_IO_SIZE;
8873  return NO_ERROR;
8874 }
8875 
8876 /*
8877  * fileio_initialize_restore () - Initialize the restore session structure with the given information
8878  * return: session or NULL
8879  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database to backup
8880  * backup_src(in): Name of backup device (file or directory)
8881  * session(in/out): The session array
8882  * level(in): The presumed backup level
8883  * restore_verbose_file_path(in):
8884  * newvolpath(in): restore the database and log volumes to the path
8885  * specified in the database-loc-file
8886  *
8887  * Note: Note that the user may choose a new location for the volume, so the
8888  * contents of the backup source path may be set as a side effect.
8889  */
8890 static FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION *
8891 fileio_initialize_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_full_name_p, char *backup_source_p,
8892  FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level,
8893  const char *restore_verbose_file_path, bool is_new_vol_path)
8894 {
8895  char orig_name[PATH_MAX];
8896 
8897  strcpy (orig_name, backup_source_p);
8898  /* First, make sure the volume given exists and we can access it. */
8899  while (!fileio_is_volume_exist (backup_source_p))
8900  {
8901  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, backup_source_p);
8902  fprintf (stdout, "%s\n", er_msg ());
8903  /* Let user see original prompt name until good one is chosen */
8904  strcpy (backup_source_p, orig_name);
8905  if (fileio_find_restore_volume (thread_p, db_full_name_p, backup_source_p, FILEIO_INITIAL_BACKUP_UNITS, level,
8906  MSGCAT_FILEIO_RESTORE_FIND_REASON) == FILEIO_RELOCATION_QUIT)
8907  {
8908  return NULL;
8909  }
8910  }
8911 
8912  /* Backup session initialization is the same as restore for now, as long as the first backup volume already exists,
8913  * which we just checked. */
8914  session_p->type = FILEIO_BACKUP_READ; /* access backup device for read */
8915  /* save database full-pathname specified in the database-loc-file */
8916  strncpy (session_p->bkup.loc_db_fullname, is_new_vol_path ? db_full_name_p : "", PATH_MAX);
8917  return (fileio_initialize_backup (db_full_name_p, (const char *) backup_source_p, session_p, level,
8918  restore_verbose_file_path, 0 /* no multi-thread */ , 0 /* no sleep */ ));
8919 }
8920 
8921 /*
8922  * fileio_abort_restore () - The restore session is aborted
8923  * return: void
8924  * session(in/out): The session array
8925  */
8926 void
8927 fileio_abort_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p)
8928 {
8929  fileio_abort_backup (thread_p, session_p, false);
8930 }
8931 
8932 /*
8933  * fileio_read_restore () - The number of bytes to read from the backup destination
8934  * return:
8935  * session(in/out): The session array
8936  * toread_nbytes(in): Number of bytes to read
8937  *
8938  * Note: Now handles reads which span volumes, as well as reading incomplete
8939  * blocks at the end of one volume. See fileio_flush_backup for details
8940  * about how the final block is repeated at the start of the new volumes.
8941  */
8942 static int
8943 fileio_read_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, int to_read_nbytes)
8944 {
8945 #if defined(WINDOWS)
8946  int nbytes;
8947 #else
8948  ssize_t nbytes;
8949 #endif
8950  char *buffer_p;
8951  const char *next_vol_p;
8952  bool is_end_of_backup = false;
8953  bool is_need_next_vol = false;
8954 
8955  /* Read until you acumulate the desired number of bytes (a database page) or the EOF mark is reached. */
8956  buffer_p = (char *) session_p->dbfile.area;
8957  while (to_read_nbytes > 0 && is_end_of_backup == false)
8958  {
8959  if (session_p->bkup.count <= 0)
8960  {
8961  /*
8962  * Read and buffer another backup page from the backup volume.
8963  * Note that a backup page is not necessarily the same size as the
8964  * database page.
8965  */
8966  restart_newvol:
8967  is_need_next_vol = false;
8968  session_p->bkup.ptr = session_p->bkup.buffer;
8969  session_p->bkup.count = session_p->bkup.iosize;
8970  while (session_p->bkup.count > 0)
8971  {
8972  /* Read a backup I/O page. */
8973  nbytes = read (session_p->bkup.vdes, session_p->bkup.ptr, session_p->bkup.count);
8974  if (nbytes <= 0)
8975  {
8976  /* An error or EOF was found */
8977  if (nbytes == 0)
8978  {
8979  /* Perhaps the last page read in was the very last one */
8980  if (FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area) == FILEIO_BACKUP_END_PAGE_ID)
8981  {
8982  is_end_of_backup = true;
8983  break;
8984  }
8985  else
8986  {
8987  is_need_next_vol = true;
8988  }
8989  }
8990  else
8991  {
8992  switch (errno)
8993  {
8994  case EINTR:
8995  case EAGAIN:
8996  continue;
8997  case EINVAL:
8998  case ENXIO:
8999 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
9000  case EOVERFLOW:
9001 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
9002  is_need_next_vol = true;
9003  break;
9004  default:
9005  {
9006 
9007  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_READ, 2,
9008  CEIL_PTVDIV (session_p->bkup.voltotalio, IO_PAGESIZE),
9009  session_p->bkup.vlabel);
9010  return ER_FAILED;
9011  }
9012  }
9013  }
9014 
9015  if (is_need_next_vol)
9016  {
9017  next_vol_p =
9018  fileio_get_backup_info_volume_name (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->level,
9019  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num + 1,
9020  FILEIO_FIRST_BACKUP_VOL_INFO);
9021  if (next_vol_p == NULL)
9022  {
9023  if (session_p->bkup.dtype != FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DEVICE)
9024  {
9025  fileio_get_directory_path (session_p->bkup.current_path, session_p->bkup.vlabel);
9026  next_vol_p = session_p->bkup.current_path;
9027  }
9028  }
9029  else
9030  {
9031  if (!fileio_is_volume_exist (next_vol_p)
9032  && strncmp (next_vol_p, session_p->bkup.current_path,
9033  strlen (session_p->bkup.current_path)) != 0)
9034  {
9035  /* assume the changed path, not bkvinf file */
9036  next_vol_p = session_p->bkup.current_path;
9037  }
9038  }
9039 
9040  /* Unmount current backup volume */
9041  fileio_dismount_without_fsync (thread_p, session_p->bkup.vdes);
9042  session_p->bkup.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
9043  /* Find and mount the next volume and continue. */
9044  if (session_p->bkup.dtype == FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DEVICE || next_vol_p == NULL)
9045  {
9046  /* Probably a tape device, let user mount new one */
9047  if (next_vol_p != NULL)
9048  {
9049  strncpy (session_p->bkup.name, next_vol_p, PATH_MAX - 1);
9050  }
9051  if (fileio_find_restore_volume (thread_p, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_fullname,
9052  session_p->bkup.name, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num + 1,
9053  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->level,
9054  MSGCAT_FILEIO_RESTORE_FIND_REASON) == FILEIO_RELOCATION_QUIT)
9055  {
9056  return ER_FAILED;
9057  }
9058  }
9059  else
9060  {
9061  strncpy (session_p->bkup.name, next_vol_p, PATH_MAX - 1);
9062  }
9063 
9064  /* Reset session count, etc */
9065  session_p->bkup.alltotalio += session_p->bkup.voltotalio;
9066  session_p->bkup.voltotalio = 0;
9067  session_p->bkup.count = 0;
9068  /* Bump the unit number to find the next volume */
9069  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num++;
9070  /* Open the next volume */
9071  if (fileio_continue_restore (thread_p, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_fullname,
9072  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_creation, session_p, false, true,
9073  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->start_time) == NULL)
9074  {
9075  return ER_FAILED;
9076  }
9077  /* reset ptr */
9078  session_p->bkup.ptr = session_p->bkup.buffer;
9079  /* add new backup volume info info new_bkvinf */
9080  fileio_add_volume_to_backup_info (session_p->bkup.vlabel, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->level,
9081  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num,
9082  FILEIO_SECOND_BACKUP_VOL_INFO);
9083  /* Retry the buffered read from the new volume */
9084  goto restart_newvol;
9085  }
9086  }
9087  else
9088  {
9089  /* Increase the amount of read bytes */
9090  session_p->bkup.ptr += nbytes;
9091  session_p->bkup.count -= nbytes;
9092  session_p->bkup.voltotalio += nbytes;
9093  }
9094  }
9095 
9096  /* Increase the buffered information */
9097  session_p->bkup.ptr = session_p->bkup.buffer;
9098  session_p->bkup.count = session_p->bkup.iosize - session_p->bkup.count;
9099  }
9100 
9101  /* Now copy the desired bytes */
9102  nbytes = session_p->bkup.count;
9103  if (nbytes > to_read_nbytes)
9104  {
9105  nbytes = to_read_nbytes;
9106  }
9107  memcpy (buffer_p, session_p->bkup.ptr, nbytes);
9108  session_p->bkup.count -= nbytes;
9109  to_read_nbytes -= nbytes;
9110  session_p->bkup.ptr += nbytes;
9111  buffer_p += nbytes;
9112  }
9113 
9114  if (to_read_nbytes > 0 && !is_end_of_backup)
9115  {
9116  return ER_FAILED;
9117  }
9118  else
9119  {
9120  return NO_ERROR;
9121  }
9122 }
9123 
9124 /*
9125  * fileio_read_restore_header () - READ A BACKUP VOLUME HEADER
9126  * return:
9127  * session(in/out): The session array
9128  *
9129  * Note: This routine should be the first read from a backup volume or device.
9130  * It reads the backup volume header that was written with the
9131  * fileio_write_backup_header routine. The header was written with a
9132  * specific buffer block size to be more compatible with tape devices so
9133  * we can read it in without knowing how the rest of the data was
9134  * buffered. Note this also means that backup volume headers are not the
9135  * same size as FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE anymore.
9136  */
9137 static int
9138 fileio_read_restore_header (FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p)
9139 {
9140  int to_read_nbytes;
9141  int nbytes;
9142  char *buffer_p;
9143  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER *backup_header_p;
9144 
9145  backup_header_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
9146  to_read_nbytes = FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER_IO_SIZE;
9147  buffer_p = (char *) backup_header_p;
9148  while (to_read_nbytes > 0)
9149  {
9150  nbytes = read (session_p->bkup.vdes, buffer_p, to_read_nbytes);
9151  if (nbytes == -1)
9152  {
9153  if (errno == EINTR)
9154  {
9155  continue;
9156  }
9157  else
9158  {
9159  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_READ, 2,
9160  CEIL_PTVDIV (session_p->bkup.voltotalio, IO_PAGESIZE), session_p->bkup.vlabel);
9161  return ER_FAILED;
9162  }
9163  }
9164  else if (nbytes == 0)
9165  {
9166  /* EOF should not happen when reading the header. */
9167  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_READ, 2,
9168  CEIL_PTVDIV (session_p->bkup.voltotalio, IO_PAGESIZE), session_p->bkup.vlabel);
9169  return ER_FAILED;
9170  }
9171  to_read_nbytes -= nbytes;
9172  session_p->bkup.voltotalio += nbytes;
9173  buffer_p += nbytes;
9174  }
9175 
9176  /* TODO: check for OLD version: no compression */
9177  if (backup_header_p->bk_hdr_version == FILEIO_BACKUP_NO_ZIP_HEADER_VERSION)
9178  {
9179  backup_header_p->bkpagesize = backup_header_p->db_iopagesize;
9180  backup_header_p->zip_method = FILEIO_ZIP_NONE_METHOD;
9181  backup_header_p->zip_level = FILEIO_ZIP_NONE_LEVEL;
9182  }
9183 
9184  if (to_read_nbytes > 0)
9185  {
9186  return ER_FAILED;
9187  }
9188  else
9189  {
9190  return NO_ERROR;
9191  }
9192 }
9193 
9194 /*
9195  * fileio_start_restore () - Start a restore session
9196  * return: session or NULL
9197  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database to backup
9198  * backup_source(in): Name of backup destination device (file or directory)
9199  * match_dbcreation(out): Creation of data base of backup
9200  * db_iopagesize(out): Database size of database in backup
9201  * db_compatibility(out): Disk compatibility of database in backup
9202  * session(in/out): The session array
9203  * level(in): The presumed backup level
9204  * authenticate(in): true when validation of new bkup volume header needed
9205  * match_bkupcreation(in): explicit timestamp to match in new backup volume
9206  * restore_verbose_file_path(in):
9207  * newvolpath(in): restore the database and log volumes to the path
9208  * specified in the database-loc-file
9209  */
9210 FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION *
9211 fileio_start_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_full_name_p, char *backup_source_p,
9212  INT64 match_db_creation_time, PGLENGTH * db_io_page_size_p, float *db_compatibility_p,
9213  FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level, bool is_authenticate,
9214  INT64 match_backup_creation_time, const char *restore_verbose_file_path, bool is_new_vol_path)
9215 {
9216  FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION *temp_session_p;
9217 
9218  /* Initialize the session array and open the backup source device. */
9219  if (fileio_initialize_restore (thread_p, db_full_name_p, backup_source_p, session_p, level,
9220  restore_verbose_file_path, is_new_vol_path) == NULL)
9221  {
9222  return NULL;
9223  }
9224 
9225  temp_session_p =
9226  fileio_continue_restore (thread_p, db_full_name_p, match_db_creation_time, session_p, true, is_authenticate,
9227  match_backup_creation_time);
9228  if (temp_session_p != NULL)
9229  {
9230  *db_io_page_size_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_iopagesize;
9231  *db_compatibility_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_compatibility;
9232  }
9233 
9234  return (temp_session_p);
9235 }
9236 
9237 static int
9238 fileio_make_error_message (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, char *error_message_p)
9239 {
9240  char *header_message_p = NULL;
9241  char *remote_message_p = NULL;
9242 
9243  if (asprintf (&header_message_p, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO,
9244  MSGCAT_FILEIO_INCORRECT_BKVOLUME)) < 0)
9245  {
9246  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
9247  return ER_FAILED;
9248  }
9249 
9250  if (asprintf (&remote_message_p, "%s%s", header_message_p, error_message_p) < 0)
9251  {
9252  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
9253  free (header_message_p);
9254  return ER_FAILED;
9255  }
9256 
9257  (void) fileio_request_user_response (thread_p, FILEIO_PROMPT_DISPLAY_ONLY, remote_message_p, NULL, NULL, -1, -1, NULL,
9258  -1);
9259  free (header_message_p);
9260  free (remote_message_p);
9261  return NO_ERROR;
9262 }
9263 
9264 /*
9265  * fileio_continue_restore () - CONTINUE A RESTORE SESSION
9266  * return: session or NULL
9267  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database to backup
9268  * db_creation(in): Creation of time data base
9269  * session(in/out): The session array
9270  * first_time(in): true the first time called during restore
9271  * authenticate(in): true when validation of new bkup volume header needed
9272  * match_bkupcreation(in): Creation time of backup
9273  *
9274  * Note: Called when a new backup volume is needed, this routine locates and
9275  * opens the desired backup volume for this database. Also authenticates
9276  * that it has the right timestamp, level, unit_num etc.
9277  * The match_dbcreation parameter specifies an explicit bkup timestamp
9278  * that must be matched. This is useful when one level is restored and
9279  * the next is required. A zero for this variable will ignore the test.
9280  */
9281 static FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION *
9282 fileio_continue_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_full_name_p, INT64 db_creation_time,
9283  FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, bool is_first_time, bool is_authenticate,
9284  INT64 match_backup_creation_time)
9285 {
9286  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER *backup_header_p;
9287  int unit_num = FILEIO_INITIAL_BACKUP_UNITS;
9288  PAGEID expect_page_id;
9289  bool is_need_retry;
9290  bool is_original_header = true;
9291  char *error_message_p = NULL;
9292  struct stat stbuf;
9293  const char *db_nopath_name_p;
9294  char copy_name[PATH_MAX];
9295  char orig_name[PATH_MAX];
9296  FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level;
9297  int exists;
9298  int search_loop_count = 0;
9299  char io_timeval[CTIME_MAX];
9300 
9301  memset (io_timeval, 0, sizeof (io_timeval));
9302 
9303  /* Note that for the first volume to be restored, bkuphdr must have been initialized with sensible defaults for these
9304  * variables. */
9305  unit_num = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num;
9306  level = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->level;
9307  do
9308  {
9309  is_need_retry = false;
9310  /* Have to locate and open the desired volume */
9311  while (session_p->bkup.vdes == NULL_VOLDES)
9312  {
9313 
9314  /* If the name chosen is a actually a directory, then append correct backup volume name here. */
9315  exists = stat (session_p->bkup.vlabel, &stbuf) != -1;
9316  if (session_p->bkup.dtype != FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DEVICE && (exists && S_ISDIR (stbuf.st_mode)))
9317  {
9318  db_nopath_name_p = fileio_get_base_file_name (db_full_name_p);
9319  strcpy (copy_name, session_p->bkup.vlabel);
9320  fileio_make_backup_name (session_p->bkup.name, db_nopath_name_p, copy_name, level, unit_num);
9321  session_p->bkup.vlabel = session_p->bkup.name;
9322  }
9323 
9324  if (search_loop_count == 0)
9325  {
9326  strcpy (orig_name, session_p->bkup.vlabel);
9327  }
9328 
9329  session_p->bkup.vdes = fileio_open (session_p->bkup.vlabel, O_RDONLY, 0);
9330  if (session_p->bkup.vdes == NULL_VOLDES)
9331  {
9332 
9333  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, session_p->bkup.vlabel);
9334  fprintf (stdout, "%s\n", er_msg ());
9335  /* Since we cannot find what they were just looking for, reset the name to what we started looking for in
9336  * the first place. */
9337  strcpy (session_p->bkup.name, orig_name);
9338  /* Attempt to locate the desired volume */
9339  if (fileio_find_restore_volume (thread_p, db_full_name_p, session_p->bkup.name, unit_num, level,
9340  MSGCAT_FILEIO_RESTORE_FIND_REASON) == FILEIO_RELOCATION_QUIT)
9341  {
9342  /* Cannot access backup file. Restore from backup is cancelled. */
9343  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOG_CANNOT_ACCESS_BACKUP, 1,
9344  session_p->bkup.vlabel);
9345  return NULL;
9346  }
9347  }
9348  search_loop_count++;
9349  }
9350 
9351  /* Read description of the backup file. */
9352  if (fileio_read_restore_header (session_p) != NO_ERROR)
9353  {
9354  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_NOT_A_BACKUP, 1, session_p->bkup.vlabel);
9355  is_need_retry = true;
9356  goto retry_newvol;
9357  }
9358 
9359  backup_header_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
9360  /* check for restoring the database and log volumes to the path specified in the database-loc-file */
9361  if (session_p->bkup.loc_db_fullname[0] != '\0')
9362  {
9363  /* replace db_fullname with the databases.txt info */
9364  strncpy (backup_header_p->db_fullname, session_p->bkup.loc_db_fullname, PATH_MAX);
9365  }
9366 
9367  /* Always check for a valid magic number, regardless of whether we need to check other authentications. */
9368  if (strcmp (backup_header_p->magic, CUBRID_MAGIC_DATABASE_BACKUP) != 0)
9369  {
9370  if (strcmp (backup_header_p->magic, CUBRID_MAGIC_DATABASE_BACKUP_OLD) == 0)
9371  {
9372  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOG_BKUP_INCOMPATIBLE, 2, rel_name (),
9373  rel_release_string ());
9374  return NULL;
9375  }
9376 
9377  if (is_first_time)
9378  {
9379  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_NOT_A_BACKUP, 1, session_p->bkup.vlabel);
9380  return NULL;
9381  }
9382  else
9383  {
9384  if (asprintf (&error_message_p,
9385  msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_MAGIC_MISMATCH),
9386  session_p->bkup.vlabel) < 0)
9387  {
9388  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
9389  return NULL;
9390  }
9391 
9392  if (fileio_make_error_message (thread_p, error_message_p) != NO_ERROR)
9393  {
9394  free (error_message_p);
9395  return NULL;
9396  }
9397 
9398  free (error_message_p);
9399  is_need_retry = true;
9400  goto retry_newvol;
9401  }
9402  }
9403 
9404  /* Should check the release version before we do anything */
9405  if (is_first_time && rel_is_log_compatible (backup_header_p->db_release, rel_release_string ()) != true)
9406  {
9407  /*
9408  * First time this database is restarted using the current version of
9409  * CUBRID. Recovery should be done using the old version of the
9410  * system
9411  */
9412  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOG_RECOVER_ON_OLD_RELEASE, 4, rel_name (),
9413  backup_header_p->db_release, rel_release_string (), rel_release_string ());
9414  return NULL;
9415  }
9416 
9417  if (is_authenticate)
9418  {
9419  if (is_first_time)
9420  {
9421  LSA_COPY (&session_p->dbfile.lsa, &backup_header_p->start_lsa);
9422  }
9423 
9424  if (level != backup_header_p->level)
9425  {
9426  if (asprintf (&error_message_p,
9427  msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_LEVEL_MISMATCH),
9428  session_p->bkup.vlabel, backup_header_p->level, level) < 0)
9429  {
9430  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
9431  return NULL;
9432  }
9433 
9434  if (fileio_make_error_message (thread_p, error_message_p) != NO_ERROR)
9435  {
9436  free (error_message_p);
9437  return NULL;
9438  }
9439 
9440  free (error_message_p);
9441  is_need_retry = true;
9442  goto retry_newvol;
9443  }
9444 
9445  /* Test the timestamp of when the backup was taken. */
9446  if (match_backup_creation_time != 0
9447  && difftime ((time_t) match_backup_creation_time, (time_t) backup_header_p->start_time))
9448  {
9449  char save_time1[64];
9450 
9451  fileio_ctime (&match_backup_creation_time, io_timeval);
9452  strcpy (save_time1, io_timeval);
9453 
9454  fileio_ctime (&backup_header_p->start_time, io_timeval);
9455  if (asprintf (&error_message_p,
9456  msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BACKUP_TIME_MISMATCH),
9457  session_p->bkup.vlabel, save_time1, io_timeval) < 0)
9458  {
9459  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
9460  return NULL;
9461  }
9462 
9463  if (fileio_make_error_message (thread_p, error_message_p) != NO_ERROR)
9464  {
9465  free (error_message_p);
9466  return NULL;
9467  }
9468 
9469  free (error_message_p);
9470  is_need_retry = true;
9471  goto retry_newvol;
9472  }
9473 
9474  /* Need to match the expected unit_num */
9475  if (unit_num != backup_header_p->unit_num)
9476  {
9477  if (asprintf (&error_message_p,
9478  msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_UNIT_NUM_MISMATCH),
9479  session_p->bkup.vlabel, backup_header_p->unit_num, unit_num) < 0)
9480  {
9481  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
9482  return NULL;
9483  }
9484 
9485  if (fileio_make_error_message (thread_p, error_message_p) != NO_ERROR)
9486  {
9487  free (error_message_p);
9488  return NULL;
9489  }
9490 
9491  free (error_message_p);
9492  is_need_retry = true;
9493  goto retry_newvol;
9494  }
9495 
9496  /* Should this one be treated as fatal? */
9497  expect_page_id = (is_first_time) ? FILEIO_BACKUP_START_PAGE_ID : FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_CONT_PAGE_ID;
9498  if (backup_header_p->iopageid != expect_page_id)
9499  {
9500  if (asprintf (&error_message_p,
9501  msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_MAGIC_MISMATCH),
9502  session_p->bkup.vlabel) < 0)
9503  {
9504  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
9505  return NULL;
9506  }
9507 
9508  if (fileio_make_error_message (thread_p, error_message_p) != NO_ERROR)
9509  {
9510  free (error_message_p);
9511  return NULL;
9512  }
9513  free (error_message_p);
9514  is_need_retry = true;
9515  goto retry_newvol;
9516  }
9517 
9518  /* NOTE: This could mess with restoring to a new location */
9519  if (strcmp (backup_header_p->db_fullname, db_full_name_p) != 0
9520  || (db_creation_time > 0 && difftime ((time_t) db_creation_time, (time_t) backup_header_p->db_creation)))
9521  {
9522  if (is_first_time)
9523  {
9524  char save_time1[64];
9525  char save_time2[64];
9526 
9527  fileio_ctime (&backup_header_p->db_creation, io_timeval);
9528  strcpy (save_time1, io_timeval);
9529 
9530  fileio_ctime (&db_creation_time, io_timeval);
9531  strcpy (save_time2, io_timeval);
9532 
9533  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_NOT_A_BACKUP_OF_GIVEN_DATABASE, 5,
9534  session_p->bkup.vlabel, backup_header_p->db_fullname, save_time1, db_full_name_p, save_time2);
9535  return NULL;
9536  }
9537  else
9538  {
9539  fileio_ctime (&backup_header_p->db_creation, io_timeval);
9540  if (asprintf (&error_message_p,
9541  msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_DB_MISMATCH),
9542  session_p->bkup.vlabel, backup_header_p->db_fullname, io_timeval) < 0)
9543  {
9544  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
9545  return NULL;
9546  }
9547 
9548  if (fileio_make_error_message (thread_p, error_message_p) != NO_ERROR)
9549  {
9550  free (error_message_p);
9551  return NULL;
9552  }
9553 
9554  free (error_message_p);
9555  is_need_retry = true;
9556  goto retry_newvol;
9557  }
9558  }
9559  }
9560  /* Passed all tests above */
9561  break;
9562  retry_newvol:
9563  is_original_header = false;
9564  /* close it, in case it was opened previously */
9565  if (session_p->bkup.vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
9566  {
9567  fileio_close (session_p->bkup.vdes);
9568  session_p->bkup.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
9569  }
9570 
9571  /* Since there was a problem, let the user try again */
9572  if (fileio_find_restore_volume (thread_p, db_full_name_p, session_p->bkup.name, unit_num, level,
9573  MSGCAT_FILEIO_RESTORE_FIND_REASON) == FILEIO_RELOCATION_QUIT)
9574  {
9575  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOG_CANNOT_ACCESS_BACKUP, 1, session_p->bkup.vlabel);
9576  return NULL;
9577  }
9578  }
9579  while (is_need_retry);
9580  backup_header_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
9581  /*
9582  * If we read an archive header and notice that the buffer size
9583  * was different than our current bkup.iosize then we will have
9584  * to REALLOC the io areas set up in _init. Same for the
9585  * when the database IO pagesize changes.
9586  */
9587  if (backup_header_p->bkup_iosize > session_p->bkup.iosize)
9588  {
9589  session_p->bkup.buffer = (char *) realloc (session_p->bkup.buffer, backup_header_p->bkup_iosize);
9590  if (session_p->bkup.buffer == NULL)
9591  {
9592  return NULL;
9593  }
9594  session_p->bkup.ptr = session_p->bkup.buffer; /* reinit in case it moved */
9595  }
9596  /* Always use the saved size from the backup to restore with */
9597  session_p->bkup.iosize = backup_header_p->bkup_iosize;
9598  /* backuped page is bigger than the current DB pagesize. must resize read buffer */
9599  if (is_first_time)
9600  {
9601  if (backup_header_p->db_iopagesize > IO_PAGESIZE)
9602  {
9603  int io_pagesize, size;
9604  io_pagesize = backup_header_p->db_iopagesize;
9605  if (session_p->dbfile.level == FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL)
9606  {
9607  io_pagesize *= FILEIO_FULL_LEVEL_EXP;
9608  }
9609 
9610  size = MAX (io_pagesize + FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE_OVERHEAD, FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER_PAGE_SIZE);
9611  free_and_init (session_p->dbfile.area);
9612  session_p->dbfile.area = (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) malloc (size);
9613  if (session_p->dbfile.area == NULL)
9614  {
9615  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) size);
9616  return NULL;
9617  }
9618  }
9619  }
9620 
9621  return session_p;
9622 }
9623 
9624 /*
9625  * fileio_finish_restore () - Finish the restore session
9626  * return:
9627  * session(in/out): The session array
9628  */
9629 int
9630 fileio_finish_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p)
9631 {
9632  int success;
9633 
9634  success = fileio_synchronize_all (thread_p, false);
9635  fileio_abort_restore (thread_p, session_p);
9636 
9637  return success;
9638 }
9639 
9640 /*
9641  * fileio_list_restore () - List description of current backup source
9642  * return: session or NULL
9643  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database to backup
9644  * backup_source(out): Name of backup source device (file or directory)
9645  * level(in): The presumed backup level
9646  * newvolpath(in): restore the database and log volumes to the path
9647  * specified in the database-loc-file
9648  */
9649 int
9650 fileio_list_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_full_name_p, char *backup_source_p,
9651  FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level, bool is_new_vol_path)
9652 {
9653  FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION backup_session;
9654  FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION *session_p = &backup_session;
9655  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER *backup_header_p;
9656  FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER *file_header_p;
9657  PGLENGTH db_iopagesize;
9658  float db_compatibility;
9659  int nbytes, i;
9660  INT64 db_creation_time = 0;
9661  char file_name[PATH_MAX];
9662  time_t tmp_time;
9663  char time_val[CTIME_MAX];
9664 
9665  if (fileio_start_restore (thread_p, db_full_name_p, backup_source_p, db_creation_time, &db_iopagesize,
9666  &db_compatibility, session_p, level, false, 0, NULL, is_new_vol_path) == NULL)
9667  {
9668  /* Cannot access backup file.. Restore from backup is cancelled */
9669  if (er_errid () == ER_GENERIC_ERROR)
9670  {
9671  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOG_CANNOT_ACCESS_BACKUP, 1, backup_source_p);
9672  }
9673  return ER_FAILED;
9674  }
9675 
9676  /* First backup header was just read */
9677  backup_header_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
9678  /* this check is probably redundant */
9679  if (backup_header_p->iopageid != FILEIO_BACKUP_START_PAGE_ID
9680  && backup_header_p->iopageid != FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_CONT_PAGE_ID)
9681  {
9682  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_NOT_A_BACKUP, 1, session_p->bkup.vlabel);
9683  goto error;
9684  }
9685 
9686  /* Show the backup volume header information. */
9687  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR));
9688 
9689  tmp_time = (time_t) backup_header_p->db_creation;
9690  (void) ctime_r (&tmp_time, time_val);
9691  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_DBINFO),
9692  backup_header_p->db_fullname, time_val, backup_header_p->db_iopagesize);
9693  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_LEVEL),
9694  backup_header_p->level, fileio_get_backup_level_string (backup_header_p->level),
9695  backup_header_p->start_lsa.pageid, backup_header_p->start_lsa.offset, backup_header_p->chkpt_lsa.pageid,
9696  backup_header_p->chkpt_lsa.offset);
9697 
9698  tmp_time = (time_t) backup_header_p->start_time;
9699  (void) ctime_r (&tmp_time, time_val);
9700  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_TIME), time_val,
9701  backup_header_p->unit_num);
9702  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_RELEASES),
9703  backup_header_p->db_release, backup_header_p->db_compatibility);
9704  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_BKUP_PAGESIZE),
9705  backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
9706  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_ZIP_INFO),
9707  backup_header_p->zip_method, fileio_get_zip_method_string (backup_header_p->zip_method),
9708  backup_header_p->zip_level, fileio_get_zip_level_string (backup_header_p->zip_level));
9709  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_INC_ACTIVELOG),
9710  backup_header_p->skip_activelog ? "NO" : "YES");
9711 
9712  for (i = FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL; i < FILEIO_BACKUP_UNDEFINED_LEVEL && backup_header_p->previnfo[i].at_time > 0; i++)
9713  {
9714  tmp_time = (time_t) backup_header_p->previnfo[i].at_time;
9715  (void) ctime_r (&tmp_time, time_val);
9716  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_HDR_LX_LSA), i,
9717  time_val, backup_header_p->previnfo[i].lsa.pageid, backup_header_p->previnfo[i].lsa.offset);
9718  }
9719 
9720  if (strlen (backup_header_p->db_prec_bkvolname) > 0)
9721  {
9722  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_PREV_BKVOL),
9723  backup_header_p->db_prec_bkvolname);
9724  }
9725 
9726  /* Reminder this is not implemented yet, so no need to show it */
9727  if (strlen (backup_header_p->db_next_bkvolname) > 0)
9728  {
9729  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_NEXT_BKVOL),
9730  backup_header_p->db_next_bkvolname);
9731  }
9732 
9733  fprintf (stdout, "\n");
9734  /* If this is not the first tape, then the header information of the backup is all we show. */
9735  if (backup_header_p->unit_num != FILEIO_INITIAL_BACKUP_UNITS)
9736  {
9737  return fileio_finish_restore (thread_p, session_p);
9738  }
9739 
9740  /* Start reading information of every database volumes/files of the database which is in backup. */
9741  file_header_p = (FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER *) (&session_p->dbfile.area->iopage);
9742  while (true)
9743  {
9744  nbytes = FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER_PAGE_SIZE;
9745  if (fileio_read_restore (thread_p, session_p, nbytes) != NO_ERROR)
9746  {
9747  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_RESTORE_READ_ERROR, 1, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num);
9748  goto error;
9749  }
9750 
9751  if (FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area) == FILEIO_BACKUP_END_PAGE_ID)
9752  {
9753  break;
9754  }
9755 
9756  if (FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area) != FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_START_PAGE_ID)
9757  {
9758  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_BKUP_DATABASE_VOLUME_OR_FILE_EXPECTED, 0);
9759  goto error;
9760  }
9761 
9762  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_FILE),
9763  file_header_p->vlabel, file_header_p->volid, file_header_p->nbytes, CEIL_PTVDIV (file_header_p->nbytes,
9764  IO_PAGESIZE));
9765  session_p->dbfile.volid = file_header_p->volid;
9766  session_p->dbfile.nbytes = file_header_p->nbytes;
9767  strncpy (file_name, file_header_p->vlabel, PATH_MAX);
9768  session_p->dbfile.vlabel = file_name;
9769  /* Read all file pages until the end of the file */
9770  if (fileio_skip_restore_volume (thread_p, session_p) != NO_ERROR)
9771  {
9772  goto error;
9773  }
9774  }
9775 
9776  fprintf (stdout, "\n");
9777  return fileio_finish_restore (thread_p, session_p);
9778 error:
9779  fileio_abort_restore (thread_p, session_p);
9780  return ER_FAILED;
9781 }
9782 
9783 /*
9784  * fileio_get_backup_volume () - Get backup volume
9785  * return: session or NULL
9786  * db_fullname(in): Name of the database to backup
9787  * logpath(in): Directory where the log volumes reside
9788  * user_backuppath(in): Backup path that user specified
9789  * from_volbackup (out) : Name of the backup volume
9790  *
9791  */
9792 int
9793 fileio_get_backup_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_fullname, const char *logpath,
9794  const char *user_backuppath, int try_level, char *from_volbackup)
9795 {
9796  FILE *backup_volinfo_fp = NULL; /* Pointer to backup */
9797  const char *nopath_name; /* Name without path */
9798  const char *volnameptr;
9799  int retry;
9800  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
9801  char format_string[64];
9802  struct stat stbuf;
9803 
9804  sprintf (format_string, "%%%ds", PATH_MAX - 1);
9805 
9806  nopath_name = fileio_get_base_file_name (db_fullname);
9807  fileio_make_backup_volume_info_name (from_volbackup, logpath, nopath_name);
9808 
9809  while ((stat (from_volbackup, &stbuf) == -1) || (backup_volinfo_fp = fopen (from_volbackup, "r")) == NULL)
9810  {
9811  /*
9812  * When user specifies an explicit location, the backup vinf
9813  * file is optional.
9814  */
9815  if (user_backuppath != NULL)
9816  {
9817  break;
9818  }
9819 
9820  /*
9821  * Backup volume information is not online
9822  */
9823  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOG, MSGCAT_LOG_STARTS));
9824  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOG, MSGCAT_LOG_BACKUPINFO_NEEDED),
9825  from_volbackup);
9826  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOG, MSGCAT_LOG_STARTS));
9827 
9828  if (scanf ("%d", &retry) != 1)
9829  {
9830  retry = 0;
9831  }
9832 
9833  switch (retry)
9834  {
9835  case 0: /* quit */
9836  /* Cannot access backup file.. Restore from backup is cancelled */
9837  error_code = ER_LOG_CANNOT_ACCESS_BACKUP;
9838  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error_code, 1, from_volbackup);
9839  return error_code;
9840 
9841  case 2:
9842  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_LOG, MSGCAT_LOG_NEWLOCATION));
9843  if (scanf (format_string, from_volbackup) != 1)
9844  {
9845  /* Cannot access backup file.. Restore from backup is cancelled */
9846  error_code = ER_LOG_CANNOT_ACCESS_BACKUP;
9847  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error_code, 1, from_volbackup);
9848  return error_code;
9849  }
9850  break;
9851 
9852  case 1:
9853  default:
9854  break;
9855  }
9856  }
9857 
9858  /*
9859  * If we get to here, we can read the bkvinf file, OR one does not
9860  * exist and it is not required.
9861  */
9862  if (backup_volinfo_fp != NULL)
9863  {
9864  if (fileio_read_backup_info_entries (backup_volinfo_fp, FILEIO_FIRST_BACKUP_VOL_INFO) == NO_ERROR)
9865  {
9866  volnameptr =
9867  fileio_get_backup_info_volume_name ((FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL) try_level, FILEIO_INITIAL_BACKUP_UNITS,
9868  FILEIO_FIRST_BACKUP_VOL_INFO);
9869  if (volnameptr != NULL)
9870  {
9871  strcpy (from_volbackup, volnameptr);
9872  }
9873  else
9874  {
9875  fileio_make_backup_name (from_volbackup, nopath_name, logpath, (FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL) try_level,
9876  FILEIO_INITIAL_BACKUP_UNITS);
9877  }
9878  }
9879  else
9880  {
9881  fclose (backup_volinfo_fp);
9882  return ER_FAILED;
9883  }
9884 
9885  fclose (backup_volinfo_fp);
9886  }
9887 
9888  if (user_backuppath != NULL)
9889  {
9890  strncpy (from_volbackup, user_backuppath, PATH_MAX - 1);
9891  }
9892 
9893  return NO_ERROR;
9894 }
9895 
9896 
9897 /*
9898  * fileio_get_next_restore_file () - Find information of next file to restore
9899  * return: -1 A failure, 0 No more files to restore (End of BACKUP),
9900  * 1 There is a file to restore
9901  * session(in/out): The session array
9902  * filename(out): the name of next file to restore
9903  * volid(out): Identifier of the database volume/file to restore
9904  * vol_nbytes(out): Nbytes of the database volume/file to restore
9905  */
9906 int
9907 fileio_get_next_restore_file (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, char *file_name_p,
9908  VOLID * vol_id_p)
9909 {
9910  FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER *file_header_p;
9911  int nbytes;
9912  char file_path[PATH_MAX];
9913 
9914  /* Read the next database volume and/or file to restore. */
9915  file_header_p = (FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER *) (&session_p->dbfile.area->iopage);
9916  nbytes = FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_HEADER_PAGE_SIZE;
9917  if (fileio_read_restore (thread_p, session_p, nbytes) != NO_ERROR)
9918  {
9919  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_RESTORE_READ_ERROR, 1, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num);
9920  return -1;
9921  }
9922 
9923  if (FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area) == FILEIO_BACKUP_END_PAGE_ID)
9924  {
9925  if (session_p->bkup.dtype == FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DEVICE)
9926  {
9927  fileio_read_backup_end_time_from_last_page (session_p);
9928  }
9929  return 0;
9930  }
9931 
9932  if (FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area) != FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_START_PAGE_ID)
9933  {
9934  return -1;
9935  }
9936 
9937  session_p->dbfile.volid = file_header_p->volid;
9938  session_p->dbfile.nbytes = file_header_p->nbytes;
9939  session_p->dbfile.level = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->level;
9940 
9941  /* check for restoring the database and log volumes to the path specified in the database-loc-file */
9942  if (session_p->bkup.loc_db_fullname[0] != '\0')
9943  {
9944  /* replace filename with the databases.txt info */
9945  if ((session_p->dbfile.volid == LOG_DBLOG_BKUPINFO_VOLID) || (session_p->dbfile.volid == LOG_DBLOG_INFO_VOLID)
9946  || (session_p->dbfile.volid == LOG_DBLOG_ARCHIVE_VOLID)
9947  || (session_p->dbfile.volid == LOG_DBLOG_ACTIVE_VOLID))
9948  {
9949  sprintf (file_name_p, "%s%c%s", session_p->bkup.log_path, PATH_SEPARATOR,
9950  fileio_get_base_file_name (file_header_p->vlabel));
9951  }
9952  else
9953  {
9954  fileio_get_directory_path (file_path, session_p->bkup.loc_db_fullname);
9955  sprintf (file_name_p, "%s%c%s", file_path, PATH_SEPARATOR, fileio_get_base_file_name (file_header_p->vlabel));
9956  }
9957  }
9958  else
9959  {
9960  strncpy (file_name_p, file_header_p->vlabel, PATH_MAX);
9961  }
9962 
9963  *vol_id_p = session_p->dbfile.volid;
9964  return 1;
9965 }
9966 
9967 /*
9968  * fileio_fill_hole_during_restore () - Fill in a hole found in the backup during
9969  * a restore
9970  * return:
9971  * next_pageid(out):
9972  * stop_pageid(in):
9973  * session(in/out): The session array
9974  * page_bitmap(in): Page bitmap to record which pages have already
9975  * been restored
9976  *
9977  * Note: A hole is likely only for 2 reasons. After the system pages in
9978  * permament temp volumes, or at the end of a volume if we stop backing
9979  * up unallocated pages.
9980  */
9981 static int
9982 fileio_fill_hole_during_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int *next_page_id_p, int stop_page_id,
9983  FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP * page_bitmap)
9984 {
9985  FILEIO_PAGE *malloc_io_pgptr = NULL;
9986 
9987  if (malloc_io_pgptr == NULL)
9988  {
9989  malloc_io_pgptr = (FILEIO_PAGE *) malloc (IO_PAGESIZE);
9990  if (malloc_io_pgptr == NULL)
9991  {
9992  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) IO_PAGESIZE);
9993  return ER_FAILED;
9994  }
9995  memset ((char *) malloc_io_pgptr, 0, IO_PAGESIZE);
9996  (void) fileio_initialize_res (thread_p, malloc_io_pgptr, IO_PAGESIZE);
9997  }
9998 
9999  while (*next_page_id_p < stop_page_id)
10000  {
10001  /*
10002  * We did not back up a page since it was deallocated, or there
10003  * is a hole of some kind that must be filled in with correctly
10004  * formatted pages.
10005  */
10006  if (fileio_write_restore (thread_p, page_bitmap, session_p->dbfile.vdes, malloc_io_pgptr, session_p->dbfile.volid,
10007  *next_page_id_p, session_p->dbfile.level) == NULL)
10008  {
10009  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_RESTORE_READ_ERROR, 1, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num);
10010  return ER_FAILED;
10011  }
10012  *next_page_id_p += 1;
10013  }
10014 
10015  if (malloc_io_pgptr != NULL)
10016  {
10017  free_and_init (malloc_io_pgptr);
10018  }
10019 
10020  return NO_ERROR;
10021 }
10022 
10023 /*
10024  * fileio_decompress_restore_volume () - The number of bytes to decompress/read
10025  * from the backup destination
10026  * return:
10027  * session(in/out): The session array
10028  * nbytes(in): Number of bytes to read
10029  */
10030 static int
10031 fileio_decompress_restore_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, int nbytes)
10032 {
10033  int error = NO_ERROR;
10034  FILEIO_THREAD_INFO *thread_info_p;
10035  FILEIO_QUEUE *queue_p;
10036  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER *backup_header_p;
10037  FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *save_area_p;
10038  FILEIO_NODE *node;
10039 
10040  assert (nbytes >= 0);
10041 
10042  thread_info_p = &session_p->read_thread_info;
10043  queue_p = &thread_info_p->io_queue;
10044  backup_header_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
10045  node = NULL;
10046 
10047  switch (backup_header_p->zip_method)
10048  {
10049  case FILEIO_ZIP_NONE_METHOD:
10050  if (fileio_read_restore (thread_p, session_p, nbytes) != NO_ERROR)
10051  {
10052  error = ER_IO_RESTORE_READ_ERROR;
10053  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, backup_header_p->unit_num);
10054  goto exit_on_error;
10055  }
10056  break;
10057 
10058  case FILEIO_ZIP_LZO1X_METHOD:
10059  {
10060  int rv;
10061  /* alloc queue node */
10062  node = fileio_allocate_node (queue_p, backup_header_p);
10063  if (node == NULL)
10064  {
10065  goto exit_on_error;
10066  }
10067 
10068  save_area_p = session_p->dbfile.area; /* save link */
10069  session_p->dbfile.area = (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) node->zip_page;
10070 
10071  rv = fileio_read_restore (thread_p, session_p, sizeof (lzo_uint));
10072  session_p->dbfile.area = save_area_p; /* restore link */
10073  if (rv != NO_ERROR)
10074  {
10075  error = ER_IO_RESTORE_READ_ERROR;
10076  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, backup_header_p->unit_num);
10077  goto exit_on_error;
10078  }
10079
