10080  /* sanity check of the size values */
10081  if (node->zip_page->buf_len > (size_t) nbytes || node->zip_page->buf_len == 0)
10082  {
10083  error = ER_IO_LZO_COMPRESS_FAIL; /* may be compress fail */
10084  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 4, backup_header_p->zip_method,
10085  fileio_get_zip_method_string (backup_header_p->zip_method), backup_header_p->zip_level,
10086  fileio_get_zip_level_string (backup_header_p->zip_level));
10087 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
10088  fprintf (stdout, "io_restore_volume_decompress_read: block size error - data corrupted\n");
10089 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
10090  goto exit_on_error;
10091  }
10092  else if (node->zip_page->buf_len < (size_t) nbytes)
10093  {
10094  /* read compressed block data */
10095  lzo_uint unzip_len;
10096 
10097  save_area_p = session_p->dbfile.area; /* save link */
10098  session_p->dbfile.area = (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) node->zip_page->buf;
10099 
10100  rv = fileio_read_restore (thread_p, session_p, (int) node->zip_page->buf_len);
10101  session_p->dbfile.area = save_area_p; /* restore link */
10102  if (rv != NO_ERROR)
10103  {
10104  error = ER_IO_RESTORE_READ_ERROR;
10105  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, backup_header_p->unit_num);
10106  goto exit_on_error;
10107  }
10108 
10109  /* decompress - use safe decompressor as data might be corrupted during a file transfer */
10110  unzip_len = nbytes;
10111  rv =
10112  lzo1x_decompress_safe (node->zip_page->buf, node->zip_page->buf_len, (lzo_bytep) session_p->dbfile.area,
10113  &unzip_len, NULL);
10114  if (rv != LZO_E_OK || unzip_len != (size_t) nbytes)
10115  {
10116  error = ER_IO_LZO_DECOMPRESS_FAIL;
10117  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 0);
10118 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
10119  fprintf (stdout, "io_restore_volume_decompress_read: compressed data violation\n");
10120 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
10121  goto exit_on_error;
10122  }
10123  }
10124  else
10125  {
10126  /* no compressed block */
10127  rv = fileio_read_restore (thread_p, session_p, (int) node->zip_page->buf_len);
10128  if (rv != NO_ERROR)
10129  {
10130  error = ER_IO_RESTORE_READ_ERROR;
10131  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, backup_header_p->unit_num);
10132  goto exit_on_error;
10133  }
10134  }
10135 
10136  }
10137  break;
10138 
10139  case FILEIO_ZIP_ZLIB_METHOD:
10140  default:
10141  error = ER_IO_RESTORE_READ_ERROR;
10142  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, backup_header_p->unit_num);
10143  goto exit_on_error;
10144  }
10145 
10146 exit_on_end:
10147 
10148  /* free node */
10149  if (node)
10150  {
10151  (void) fileio_free_node (queue_p, node);
10152  }
10153 
10154  return error;
10155 exit_on_error:
10156 
10157  if (error == NO_ERROR)
10158  {
10159  error = ER_FAILED;
10160  }
10161  goto exit_on_end;
10162 }
10163 
10164 #if !defined(CS_MODE)
10165 /*
10166  * fileio_restore_volume () - Restore a volume/file of given database
10167  * return:
10168  * session_p(in/out): The session array
10169  * to_vlabel_p(in): Restore the next file using this name
10170  * verbose_to_vlabel_p(in): Printable volume name
10171  * prev_vlabel_p(out): Previous restored file name
10172  * page_bitmap(in): Page bitmap to record which pages have already
10173  * been restored
10174  * is_remember_pages(in): true if we need to track which pages are restored
10175  */
10176 int
10177 fileio_restore_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, char *to_vol_label_p,
10178  char *verbose_to_vol_label_p, char *prev_vol_label_p, FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP * page_bitmap,
10179  bool is_remember_pages)
10180 {
10181  int next_page_id = 0;
10182  INT64 total_nbytes = 0;
10183  int nbytes;
10184  int from_npages, npages;
10185  FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP *bitmap;
10186  int check_ratio = 0, check_npages = 0;
10187  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER *backup_header_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
10188  int unit;
10189  int i;
10190  char *buffer_p;
10191  bool incremental_includes_volume_header = false;
10192 
10193  npages = (int) CEIL_PTVDIV (session_p->dbfile.nbytes, IO_PAGESIZE);
10194  session_p->dbfile.vlabel = to_vol_label_p;
10195  nbytes = (int) MIN (backup_header_p->bkpagesize, session_p->dbfile.nbytes);
10196  unit = nbytes / IO_PAGESIZE;
10197  if (nbytes % IO_PAGESIZE)
10198  {
10199  unit++;
10200  }
10201 
10202 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
10203  if (io_Bkuptrace_debug > 0)
10204  {
10205  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_FILE),
10206  session_p->dbfile.vlabel, session_p->dbfile.volid, session_p->dbfile.nbytes,
10207  CEIL_PTVDIV (session_p->dbfile.nbytes, IO_PAGESIZE));
10208  fprintf (stdout, "\n");
10209  }
10210 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
10211 
10212  if (session_p->verbose_fp)
10213  {
10214  fprintf (session_p->verbose_fp, " %-28s | %10d | ", fileio_get_base_file_name (verbose_to_vol_label_p), npages);
10215  check_ratio = 1;
10216  check_npages = (int) (((float) npages / 25.0) * check_ratio);
10217  }
10218 
10219  /*
10220  * Reformatting the volume guarantees no pollution from old contents.
10221  * Note that for incremental restores, one can only reformat the volume
10222  * once ... the first time that volume is replaced. This is needed
10223  * because we are applying the restoration in reverse time order.
10224  */
10225  if (!fileio_is_volume_exist (session_p->dbfile.vlabel))
10226  {
10227  session_p->dbfile.vdes =
10228  fileio_format (thread_p, NULL, session_p->dbfile.vlabel, session_p->dbfile.volid, npages, false, false, false,
10229  IO_PAGESIZE, 0, false);
10230  }
10231  else
10232  {
10233  session_p->dbfile.vdes =
10234  fileio_mount (thread_p, NULL, session_p->dbfile.vlabel, session_p->dbfile.volid, false, false);
10235  }
10236 
10237  if (session_p->dbfile.vdes == NULL_VOLDES)
10238  {
10239  goto error;
10240  }
10241 
10242  /* For some volumes we do not keep track of the individual pages restored. */
10243  bitmap = (is_remember_pages) ? page_bitmap : NULL;
10244  /* Read all file pages until the end of the volume/file. */
10245  from_npages = (int) CEIL_PTVDIV (session_p->dbfile.nbytes, backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
10246  nbytes = FILEIO_RESTORE_DBVOLS_IO_PAGE_SIZE (session_p);
10247 
10248  while (true)
10249  {
10250  if (fileio_decompress_restore_volume (thread_p, session_p, nbytes) != NO_ERROR)
10251  {
10252  goto error;
10253  }
10254 
10255  if (FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area) == FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_END_PAGE_ID)
10256  {
10257  /*
10258  * End of File marker in backup, but may not be true end of file being
10259  * restored so we have to continue filling in pages until the
10260  * restored volume is finished.
10261  */
10262  if (session_p->dbfile.level == FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL && next_page_id < npages)
10263  {
10264  if (fileio_fill_hole_during_restore (thread_p, &next_page_id, npages, session_p, bitmap) != NO_ERROR)
10265  {
10266  goto error;
10267  }
10268  }
10269  break;
10270  }
10271 
10272  if (FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area) > from_npages)
10273  {
10274  /* Too many pages for this volume according to the file header */
10275  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_RESTORE_PAGEID_OUTOF_BOUNDS, 4, backup_header_p->unit_num,
10276  FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area), from_npages, session_p->dbfile.volid);
10277  goto error;
10278  }
10279 
10280 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
10281  fprintf (stdout, "fileio_restore_volume: %d\t%d,\t%d\n",
10282  ((FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) (session_p->dbfile.area))->iopageid,
10283  *(PAGEID *) (((char *) (session_p->dbfile.area)) + offsetof (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage) +
10284  backup_header_p->bkpagesize), backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
10285 #endif
10286 
10287  if (!FILEIO_CHECK_RESTORE_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area, backup_header_p->bkpagesize))
10288  {
10289  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_RESTORE_READ_ERROR, 1, backup_header_p->unit_num);
10290  goto error;
10291  }
10292 
10293  /* Check for holes and fill them (only for full backup level) */
10294  if (session_p->dbfile.level == FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL
10295  && (next_page_id < FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area)))
10296  {
10297  if (fileio_fill_hole_during_restore (thread_p, &next_page_id, session_p->dbfile.area->iopageid, session_p,
10298  bitmap) != NO_ERROR)
10299  {
10300  goto error;
10301  }
10302  }
10303 
10304  /* Restore the page we just read in */
10305  if (session_p->dbfile.level != FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL)
10306  {
10307  next_page_id = FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area);
10308  if (next_page_id == DISK_VOLHEADER_PAGE)
10309  {
10310  incremental_includes_volume_header = true;
10311  }
10312  }
10313 
10314  buffer_p = (char *) &session_p->dbfile.area->iopage;
10315  for (i = 0; i < unit && next_page_id < npages; i++)
10316  {
10317  if (fileio_write_restore (thread_p, bitmap, session_p->dbfile.vdes, buffer_p + i * IO_PAGESIZE,
10318  session_p->dbfile.volid, next_page_id, session_p->dbfile.level) == NULL)
10319  {
10320  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_RESTORE_READ_ERROR, 1, backup_header_p->unit_num);
10321  goto error;
10322  }
10323 
10324  next_page_id += 1;
10325  total_nbytes += IO_PAGESIZE;
10326  if (session_p->verbose_fp && npages >= 25 && next_page_id >= check_npages)
10327  {
10328  fprintf (session_p->verbose_fp, "#");
10329  check_ratio++;
10330  check_npages = (int) (((float) npages / 25.0) * check_ratio);
10331  }
10332  }
10333  }
10334 
10335  if (total_nbytes > session_p->dbfile.nbytes && session_p->dbfile.volid < LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID)
10336  {
10337  (void) ftruncate (session_p->dbfile.vdes, session_p->dbfile.nbytes);
10338  }
10339 
10340 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
10341  if (io_Bkuptrace_debug >= 2 && bitmap)
10342  {
10343  fileio_page_bitmap_dump (stdout, bitmap);
10344  (void) fprintf (stdout, "\n\n");
10345  }
10346 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
10347 
10348  /* check for restoring the database and log volumes to the path specified in the database-loc-file */
10349  if (session_p->bkup.loc_db_fullname[0] != '\0' && session_p->dbfile.volid >= LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID)
10350  {
10351  /* Volume header page may not be included in incremental backup volumes.
10352  * This means that volume header of a partially restoredb volume may not exist.
10353  */
10354  if (session_p->dbfile.level == FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL || incremental_includes_volume_header == true)
10355  {
10356  VOLID volid;
10357 
10358  volid = session_p->dbfile.volid;
10359  if (disk_set_creation (thread_p, volid, to_vol_label_p, &backup_header_p->db_creation,
10360  &session_p->bkup.last_chkpt_lsa, false, DISK_FLUSH_AND_INVALIDATE) != NO_ERROR)
10361  {
10362  goto error;
10363  }
10364 
10365  if (volid != LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID)
10366  {
10367  VOLID prev_volid;
10368  int prev_vdes;
10369 
10370  /* previous vol */
10371  prev_volid = fileio_find_previous_perm_volume (thread_p, volid);
10372  prev_vdes = fileio_mount (thread_p, NULL, prev_vol_label_p, prev_volid, false, false);
10373  if (prev_vdes == NULL_VOLDES)
10374  {
10375  goto error;
10376  }
10377 
10378  if (disk_set_link (thread_p, prev_volid, volid, to_vol_label_p, false, DISK_FLUSH_AND_INVALIDATE) !=
10379  NO_ERROR)
10380  {
10381  fileio_dismount (thread_p, prev_vdes);
10382  goto error;
10383  }
10384 
10385  fileio_dismount (thread_p, prev_vdes);
10386  }
10387  }
10388 
10389  /* save current volname */
10390  strncpy (prev_vol_label_p, to_vol_label_p, PATH_MAX);
10391  }
10392 
10393  fileio_dismount (thread_p, session_p->dbfile.vdes);
10394  session_p->dbfile.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
10395  session_p->dbfile.volid = NULL_VOLID;
10396  session_p->dbfile.vlabel = NULL;
10397 
10398  if (session_p->verbose_fp)
10399  {
10400  if (next_page_id < 25)
10401  {
10402  fprintf (session_p->verbose_fp, "######################### | done\n");
10403  }
10404  else
10405  {
10406  while (check_ratio <= 25)
10407  {
10408  fprintf (session_p->verbose_fp, "#");
10409  check_ratio++;
10410  }
10411  fprintf (session_p->verbose_fp, " | done\n");
10412  }
10413  }
10414 
10415  return NO_ERROR;
10416 
10417 error:
10418  if (session_p->dbfile.vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
10419  {
10420  fileio_dismount (thread_p, session_p->dbfile.vdes);
10421  }
10422 
10423  session_p->dbfile.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
10424  session_p->dbfile.volid = NULL_VOLID;
10425  session_p->dbfile.vlabel = NULL;
10426 
10427  return ER_FAILED;
10428 }
10429 #endif /* !CS_MODE */
10430 
10431 /*
10432  * fileio_write_restore () - Write the content of the page described by pageid
10433  * to disk
10434  * return: o_pgptr on success, NULL on failure
10435  * page_bitmap(in): Page bitmap to record which pages have already
10436  * been restored
10437  * vdes(in): Volume descriptor
10438  * io_pgptr(in): In-memory address where the current content of page resides
10439  * vol_id(in): volume identifier
10440  * page_id(in): Page identifier
10441  * level(in): backup level page restored from
10442  *
10443  * Note: The contents of the page stored on io_pgptr buffer which is
10444  * IO_PAGESIZE long are sent to disk using fileio_write. The restore pageid
10445  * cache is updated.
10446  */
10447 static void *
10448 fileio_write_restore (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP * page_bitmap, int vol_fd, void *io_page_p,
10449  VOLID vol_id, PAGEID page_id, FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level)
10450 {
10451  bool is_set;
10452  FILEIO_WRITE_MODE write_mode = FILEIO_WRITE_DEFAULT_WRITE;
10453 
10454 #if !defined (CS_MODE)
10455  write_mode = dwb_is_created () == true ? FILEIO_WRITE_NO_COMPENSATE_WRITE : FILEIO_WRITE_DEFAULT_WRITE;
10456 #endif
10457 
10458  if (page_bitmap == NULL)
10459  {
10460  /* don't care about ht for this volume */
10461  if (fileio_write (thread_p, vol_fd, io_page_p, page_id, IO_PAGESIZE, write_mode) == NULL)
10462  {
10463  return NULL;
10464  }
10465  }
10466  else
10467  {
10468 #if !defined(NDEBUG)
10469  assert (page_bitmap->vol_id == vol_id);
10470 #endif
10471  is_set = fileio_page_bitmap_is_set (page_bitmap, page_id);
10472 
10473  if (!is_set)
10474  {
10475  if (fileio_write (thread_p, vol_fd, io_page_p, page_id, IO_PAGESIZE, write_mode) == NULL)
10476  {
10477  return NULL;
10478  }
10479 
10480  if (level > FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL)
10481  {
10482  fileio_page_bitmap_set (page_bitmap, page_id);
10483  }
10484  }
10485  }
10486 
10487  return io_page_p;
10488 }
10489 
10490 /*
10491  * fileio_skip_restore_volume () - Skip over the next db volume from the backup
10492  * during a restore
10493  * return:
10494  * session(in/out): The session array
10495  *
10496  * Note: Basically have to read all of the pages until we get to the end of
10497  * the current backup file. It is necessary to "fast forward" to the
10498  * next backup meta-data.
10499  */
10500 int
10501 fileio_skip_restore_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p)
10502 {
10503  int nbytes;
10504  FILEIO_BACKUP_HEADER *backup_header_p = session_p->bkup.bkuphdr;
10505 
10506  /* Read all file pages until the end of the volume/file. */
10507  nbytes = FILEIO_RESTORE_DBVOLS_IO_PAGE_SIZE (session_p);
10508  while (true)
10509  {
10510  if (fileio_decompress_restore_volume (thread_p, session_p, nbytes) != NO_ERROR)
10511  {
10512  goto error;
10513  }
10514 
10515  if (FILEIO_GET_BACKUP_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area) == FILEIO_BACKUP_FILE_END_PAGE_ID)
10516  {
10517  /* End of FILE */
10518  break;
10519  }
10520 
10521 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
10522  fprintf (stdout, "fileio_skip_restore_volume: %d\t%d,\t%d\n",
10523  ((FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE *) (session_p->dbfile.area))->iopageid,
10524  *(PAGEID *) (((char *) (session_p->dbfile.area)) + offsetof (FILEIO_BACKUP_PAGE, iopage) +
10525  backup_header_p->bkpagesize), backup_header_p->bkpagesize);
10526 #endif
10527 
10528  if (!FILEIO_CHECK_RESTORE_PAGE_ID (session_p->dbfile.area, backup_header_p->bkpagesize))
10529  {
10530  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_RESTORE_READ_ERROR, 1, backup_header_p->unit_num);
10531  goto error;
10532  }
10533  }
10534 
10535  session_p->dbfile.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
10536  session_p->dbfile.volid = NULL_VOLID;
10537  session_p->dbfile.vlabel = NULL;
10538 
10539  return NO_ERROR;
10540 
10541 error:
10542 
10543  session_p->dbfile.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
10544  session_p->dbfile.volid = NULL_VOLID;
10545  session_p->dbfile.vlabel = NULL;
10546 
10547  return ER_FAILED;
10548 }
10549 
10550 /*
10551  * fileio_find_restore_volume () - FIND NEW LOCATION OF A VOLUME TO RESTORE
10552  * return:
10553  * dbname(in): The name of the database to which the volume belongs
10554  * to_volname(in): Name we think the volume is supposed to be
10555  * unit_num(in):
10556  * level(in): the backup level needed for restoration
10557  * reason(in):
10558  *
10559  * Note: Prompt the user to tell us the path to backup volume we cannot seem
10560  * to find. Note that validation is not done here it must be done by
10561  * the caller.
10562  */
10563 static FILEIO_RELOCATION_VOLUME
10564 fileio_find_restore_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *db_name_p, char *to_vol_name_p, int unit_num,
10565  FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level, int reason)
10566 {
10567  char *ptr1 = NULL, *ptr2 = NULL, *ptr3 = NULL, *ptr4 = NULL;
10568  char new_vol_name[FILEIO_MAX_USER_RESPONSE_SIZE];
10569  char *fail_prompt_p = NULL;
10570  char *reprompt_p = NULL;
10571  char *full_message_p = NULL;
10572  FILEIO_RELOCATION_VOLUME rval;
10573 
10574  /* Try to build up the outgoing message */
10575  if (asprintf (&ptr1, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_STARTS)) < 0
10576  || asprintf (&ptr2, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, reason)) < 0
10577  || asprintf (&ptr3, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_REST_RELO_NEEDED),
10578  db_name_p, to_vol_name_p, unit_num, level, fileio_get_backup_level_string (level)) < 0
10579  || asprintf (&ptr4, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_REST_RELO_OPTIONS),
10580  FILEIO_RELOCATION_QUIT, FILEIO_RELOCATION_RETRY, FILEIO_RELOCATION_ALTERNATE) < 0)
10581  {
10582  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
10583  rval = FILEIO_RELOCATION_QUIT;
10584  goto end;
10585  }
10586 
10587  if (asprintf (&fail_prompt_p, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_INPUT_RANGE_ERROR),
10588  (int) FILEIO_RELOCATION_FIRST, (int) FILEIO_RELOCATION_LAST) < 0
10589  || asprintf (&reprompt_p, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_NEWLOCATION)) < 0
10590  || asprintf (&full_message_p, "%s%s%s%s%s", ptr1, ptr2, ptr3, ptr4, ptr1) < 0)
10591  {
10592  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
10593  rval = FILEIO_RELOCATION_QUIT;
10594  goto end;
10595  }
10596 
10597  if (fileio_request_user_response (thread_p, FILEIO_PROMPT_RANGE_WITH_SECONDARY_STRING_TYPE, full_message_p,
10598  new_vol_name, fail_prompt_p, FILEIO_RELOCATION_QUIT, FILEIO_RELOCATION_ALTERNATE,
10599  reprompt_p, FILEIO_RELOCATION_ALTERNATE) != NO_ERROR)
10600  {
10601  rval = FILEIO_RELOCATION_QUIT;
10602  goto end;
10603  }
10604 
10605  /* interpret the user responses. */
10606  if (new_vol_name[0] - '0' == FILEIO_RELOCATION_RETRY)
10607  {
10608  rval = FILEIO_RELOCATION_RETRY;
10609  }
10610  else if (new_vol_name[0] - '0' == FILEIO_RELOCATION_ALTERNATE)
10611  {
10612  rval = FILEIO_RELOCATION_ALTERNATE;
10613  strcpy (to_vol_name_p, &new_vol_name[1]);
10614  }
10615  else
10616  {
10617  rval = FILEIO_RELOCATION_QUIT;
10618  }
10619 
10620 end:
10621  if (ptr1)
10622  {
10623  free (ptr1);
10624  }
10625 
10626  if (ptr2)
10627  {
10628  free (ptr2);
10629  }
10630 
10631  if (ptr3)
10632  {
10633  free (ptr3);
10634  }
10635 
10636  if (ptr4)
10637  {
10638  free (ptr4);
10639  }
10640 
10641  if (fail_prompt_p)
10642  {
10643  free (fail_prompt_p);
10644  }
10645 
10646  if (reprompt_p)
10647  {
10648  free (reprompt_p);
10649  }
10650 
10651  if (full_message_p)
10652  {
10653  free (full_message_p);
10654  }
10655 
10656  return rval;
10657 }
10658 
10659 /*
10660  * fileio_get_backup_level_string () - return the string name of the backup level
10661  * return: pointer to string containing name of level
10662  * level(in): the backup level to convert
10663  */
10664 static const char *
10665 fileio_get_backup_level_string (FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level)
10666 {
10667  switch (level)
10668  {
10669  case FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL:
10670  return ("FULL LEVEL");
10671 
10672  case FILEIO_BACKUP_BIG_INCREMENT_LEVEL:
10673  return ("INCREMENTAL LEVEL 1");
10674 
10675  case FILEIO_BACKUP_SMALL_INCREMENT_LEVEL:
10676  return ("INCREMENTAL LEVEL 2");
10677 
10678  default:
10679  return ("UNKNOWN");
10680  }
10681 }
10682 
10683 /*
10684  * fileio_get_zip_method_string () - return the string name of the compression method
10685  * return: pointer to string containing name of zip_method
10686  * zip_method(in): the compression method to convert
10687  */
10688 const char *
10689 fileio_get_zip_method_string (FILEIO_ZIP_METHOD zip_method)
10690 {
10691  switch (zip_method)
10692  {
10693  case FILEIO_ZIP_NONE_METHOD:
10694  return ("NONE");
10695 
10696  case FILEIO_ZIP_LZO1X_METHOD:
10697  return ("LZO1X");
10698 
10699  case FILEIO_ZIP_ZLIB_METHOD:
10700  return ("ZLIB");
10701 
10702  default:
10703  return ("UNKNOWN");
10704  }
10705 }
10706 
10707 /*
10708  * fileio_get_zip_level_string () - return the string name of the compression level
10709  * return: pointer to string containing name of zip_level
10710  * zip_level(in): the compression level to convert
10711  */
10712 const char *
10713 fileio_get_zip_level_string (FILEIO_ZIP_LEVEL zip_level)
10714 {
10715  switch (zip_level)
10716  {
10717  case FILEIO_ZIP_NONE_LEVEL:
10718  return ("NONE");
10719 
10720  case FILEIO_ZIP_1_LEVEL: /* case FILEIO_ZIP_LZO1X_DEFAULT_LEVEL: */
10721  return ("ZIP LEVEL 1 - BEST SPEED");
10722 
10723  case FILEIO_ZIP_2_LEVEL:
10724  return ("ZIP LEVEL 2");
10725 
10726  case FILEIO_ZIP_3_LEVEL:
10727  return ("ZIP LEVEL 3");
10728 
10729  case FILEIO_ZIP_4_LEVEL:
10730  return ("ZIP LEVEL 4");
10731 
10732  case FILEIO_ZIP_5_LEVEL:
10733  return ("ZIP LEVEL 5");
10734 
10735  case FILEIO_ZIP_6_LEVEL: /* case FILEIO_ZIP_ZLIB_DEFAULT_LEVEL: */
10736  return ("ZIP LEVEL 6 - NORMAL");
10737 
10738  case FILEIO_ZIP_7_LEVEL:
10739  return ("ZIP LEVEL 7");
10740 
10741  case FILEIO_ZIP_8_LEVEL:
10742  return ("ZIP LEVEL 8");
10743 
10744  case FILEIO_ZIP_9_LEVEL: /* case FILEIO_ZIP_LZO1X_999_LEVEL: */
10745  return ("ZIP LEVEL 9 - BEST REDUCTION");
10746 
10747  default:
10748  return ("UNKNOWN");
10749  }
10750 }
10751 
10752 /*
10753  * fileio_get_next_backup_volume () - FIND LOCATION OR NEW VOLUME NAME TO CONTINUE BACKUP
10754  * return:
10755  * session(in/out): The session array
10756  * user_new(in): true if user must be involved in the switch
10757  *
10758  * Note: This routine halts output to the current backup volume and opens the
10759  * next backup volume, creating it if it is a file. User interaction may
10760  * be necessary in cases where the backup volume is really a device
10761  * (i.e. because a tape must be mounted). User interaction may also be
10762  * required if the disk space is full on the current disk. We must
10763  * insure that new location chosen is large enough.
10764  */
10765 static int
10766 fileio_get_next_backup_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_SESSION * session_p, bool is_new_user)
10767 {
10768  const char *db_nopath_name_p = NULL;
10769  char copy_name[PATH_MAX];
10770  char orig_name[PATH_MAX];
10771  char *message_area_p = NULL;
10772  char io_timeval[CTIME_MAX];
10773 
10774  if (session_p->bkup.dtype == FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DIRECTORY)
10775  {
10776  fileio_dismount (thread_p, session_p->bkup.vdes);
10777  }
10778  else
10779  {
10780  fileio_dismount_without_fsync (thread_p, session_p->bkup.vdes);
10781  }
10782  session_p->bkup.vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
10783  /* Always force a new one for devices */
10784  if (session_p->bkup.dtype == FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DEVICE)
10785  {
10786  is_new_user = true;
10787  }
10788 
10789  /* Keep the backup info correct */
10790  session_p->bkup.alltotalio += session_p->bkup.voltotalio;
10791  session_p->bkup.voltotalio = 0;
10792  /* Tell user that current backup volume just completed */
10793  fileio_ctime (&session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->start_time, io_timeval);
10794  if (asprintf (&message_area_p, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BACKUP_LABEL_INFO),
10795  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->level, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num,
10796  fileio_get_base_file_name (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_fullname), io_timeval) < 0)
10797  {
10798  /* Note: we do not know the exact malloc size that failed */
10799  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) FILEIO_MAX_USER_RESPONSE_SIZE);
10800  return ER_FAILED;
10801  }
10802  else
10803  {
10804  (void) fileio_request_user_response (thread_p, FILEIO_PROMPT_DISPLAY_ONLY, message_area_p, NULL, NULL, -1, -1,
10805  NULL, -1);
10806  /* Note: Not free_and_init */
10807  free (message_area_p);
10808  }
10809 
10810  /* Some initializations for start of next backup volume. */
10811  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->iopageid = FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_CONT_PAGE_ID;
10812  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num++;
10813  memset (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_prec_bkvolname, 0, sizeof (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_prec_bkvolname));
10814  strcpy (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_prec_bkvolname, session_p->bkup.vlabel);
10815  memset (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_next_bkvolname, 0, sizeof (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_next_bkvolname));
10816 
10817  /* Guess new path name in same dir as current volume. For devices, just repeat the device name. */
10818  if (session_p->bkup.dtype == FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DIRECTORY)
10819  {
10820  /* First, get the path of the just finished volume. */
10821  fileio_get_directory_path (orig_name, session_p->bkup.name);
10822  strcpy (copy_name, orig_name);
10823  if (is_new_user)
10824  {
10825  /* Fill in the expected volume name to show the user */
10826  db_nopath_name_p = fileio_get_base_file_name (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_fullname);
10827  fileio_make_backup_name (session_p->bkup.name, db_nopath_name_p, orig_name, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->level,
10828  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num + 1);
10829  strcpy (copy_name, session_p->bkup.name);
10830  }
10831  }
10832  else
10833  {
10834  strcpy (copy_name, session_p->bkup.name);
10835  strcpy (orig_name, session_p->bkup.name);
10836  }
10837 
10838  do
10839  {
10840  if (is_new_user)
10841  {
10842  if (fileio_find_restore_volume (thread_p, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_fullname, copy_name,
10843  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num, session_p->dbfile.level,
10844  MSGCAT_FILEIO_BKUP_FIND_REASON) == FILEIO_RELOCATION_QUIT)
10845  {
10846  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOG_CANNOT_ACCESS_BACKUP, 1, session_p->bkup.vlabel);
10847  return ER_FAILED;
10848  }
10849  }
10850 
10851  /* Append backup volume name onto directory. */
10852  if (session_p->bkup.dtype == FILEIO_BACKUP_VOL_DIRECTORY)
10853  {
10854  db_nopath_name_p = fileio_get_base_file_name (session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_fullname);
10855  fileio_make_backup_name (session_p->bkup.name, db_nopath_name_p, copy_name, session_p->dbfile.level,
10856  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num);
10857  }
10858  else
10859  {
10860  strcpy (session_p->bkup.name, copy_name);
10861  }
10862 
10863 
10864  session_p->bkup.vlabel = session_p->bkup.name;
10865  /* Create the new volume and go on with our lives */
10866  session_p->bkup.vdes =
10867  fileio_create_backup_volume (thread_p, session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->db_fullname, session_p->bkup.vlabel,
10868  LOG_DBCOPY_VOLID, false, false,
10869  ((session_p->dbfile.level == FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL)
10870  ? FILEIO_BACKUP_MINIMUM_NUM_PAGES_FULL_LEVEL : FILEIO_BACKUP_MINIMUM_NUM_PAGES));
10871  if (session_p->bkup.vdes < 0)
10872  {
10873 
10874  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_IO_MOUNT_FAIL, 1, session_p->bkup.vlabel);
10875  if (asprintf (&message_area_p, "%s\n", er_msg ()) < 0)
10876  {
10877  fileio_request_user_response (thread_p, FILEIO_PROMPT_DISPLAY_ONLY, message_area_p, NULL, NULL, -1, -1,
10878  NULL, -1);
10879  free (message_area_p);
10880  }
10881  }
10882 
10883  is_new_user = true;
10884  /* reset to the original name until acceptable alternative is chosen */
10885  strcpy (copy_name, orig_name);
10886  }
10887  while (session_p->bkup.vdes == NULL_VOLDES);
10888 
10889  /* Remember name of new backup volume */
10890  if (fileio_add_volume_to_backup_info (session_p->bkup.name, session_p->dbfile.level,
10891  session_p->bkup.bkuphdr->unit_num, FILEIO_FIRST_BACKUP_VOL_INFO) != NO_ERROR)
10892  {
10893  return ER_FAILED;
10894  }
10895 
10896  return NO_ERROR;
10897 }
10898 
10899 
10900 /*
10901  * BKVINF RELATED FUNCTIONS
10902  *
10903  * These functions collectively manage the bkvinf file. They are responsible
10904  * for reading, writing, and maintaining the in memory cache of backup
10905  * volume related information.
10906  */
10907 
10908 /*
10909  * fileio_add_volume_to_backup_info () - Add a backup volume name to the internal cache
10910  * return:
10911  * name(in): Filename of backup volume
10912  * level(in): backup level for that volume
10913  * unit_num(in): unit (or sequence) number of that volume
10914  * which_bkvinf(in):
10915  */
10916 int
10917 fileio_add_volume_to_backup_info (const char *name_p, FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level, int unit_num, int which_bkvinf)
10918 {
10919  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY *node_p, *back_p;
10920  struct stat stbuf;
10921  char real_path_buf[PATH_MAX];
10922  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_QUEUE *data_p;
10923 
10924  data_p = &(fileio_Backup_vol_info_data[which_bkvinf]);
10925  if ((!(*data_p).initialized) && fileio_initialize_backup_info (which_bkvinf) != NO_ERROR)
10926  {
10927  return ER_FAILED;
10928  }
10929 
10930  /* Get a node */
10931  node_p = fileio_allocate_backup_info (which_bkvinf);
10932  if (node_p == NULL)
10933  {
10934  return ER_FAILED;
10935  }
10936 
10937  if (stat (name_p, &stbuf) != -1)
10938  {
10939  if (S_ISREG (stbuf.st_mode))
10940  {
10941  /* for regular file, convert to the real-path */
10942  if (realpath (name_p, real_path_buf) != NULL)
10943  {
10944  name_p = real_path_buf;
10945  }
10946  }
10947  }
10948 
10949  strncpy (node_p->bkvol_name, name_p, PATH_MAX - 1);
10950  node_p->unit_num = unit_num;
10951 
10952  /* Put it on the queue for that level */
10953  if ((*data_p).anchors[level] == NULL)
10954  {
10955  /* this is the first one */
10956  (*data_p).anchors[level] = node_p;
10957  }
10958  else
10959  {
10960  /* Put it at the end of the chain */
10961  back_p = (*data_p).anchors[level];
10962  while (back_p->link != NULL)
10963  {
10964  if (back_p->unit_num == unit_num)
10965  {
10966  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "bkvinf inconsistency, duplicate unit num %d found for level %d\n",
10967  unit_num, level);
10968  }
10969  back_p = back_p->link;
10970  }
10971  /* check the last entry */
10972  if (back_p->unit_num == unit_num)
10973  {
10974  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "bkvinf inconsistency, duplicate unit num %d found for level %d\n", unit_num,
10975  level);
10976  }
10977 
10978  back_p->link = node_p;
10979  }
10980 
10981  return NO_ERROR;
10982 }
10983 
10984 /*
10985  * fileio_write_backup_info_entries () - Prints internal bkvinf table in a format
10986  * suitable for the bkvinf file as well as human
10987  * consumption
10988  * return:
10989  * fp(in): Open file handle or else NULL for stdout
10990  * which_bkvinf(in):
10991  */
10992 int
10993 fileio_write_backup_info_entries (FILE * fp, int which_bkvinf)
10994 {
10995  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY *node_p;
10996  int level, n;
10997  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_QUEUE *data_p;
10998 
10999  data_p = &(fileio_Backup_vol_info_data[which_bkvinf]);
11000  if (!fp)
11001  {
11002  fp = stdout;
11003  }
11004 
11005  for (level = FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL; level < FILEIO_BACKUP_UNDEFINED_LEVEL; level++)
11006  {
11007  for (node_p = (*data_p).anchors[level]; node_p != NULL; node_p = node_p->link)
11008  {
11009  n = fprintf (fp, "%3d %d %s\n", level, node_p->unit_num, node_p->bkvol_name);
11010  if (n <= 0)
11011  {
11012  return ER_FAILED;
11013  }
11014  }
11015  }
11016 
11017  return NO_ERROR;
11018 }
11019 
11020 /*
11021  * fileio_read_backup_info_entries () - Read and parse the entries in a bkvinf file and
11022  * store them in the internal cache
11023  * return:
11024  * fp(in): Open file handle
11025  * which_bkvinf(in):
11026  */
11027 int
11028 fileio_read_backup_info_entries (FILE * fp, int which_bkvinf)
11029 {
11030  FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level;
11031  int tmp, unit_num;
11032  char vol_name[PATH_MAX];
11033  int n, line = 0;
11034  char format_string[32];
11035 
11036  if (fp == NULL)
11037  {
11038  return ER_FAILED;
11039  }
11040 
11041  /* Always throw away old cache (if any) and then start fresh */
11042  fileio_finalize_backup_info (which_bkvinf);
11043  if (fileio_initialize_backup_info (which_bkvinf) != NO_ERROR)
11044  {
11045  return ER_FAILED;
11046  }
11047 
11048  sprintf (format_string, "%%d %%d %%%ds", PATH_MAX - 1);
11049  while ((n = fscanf (fp, format_string, &tmp, &unit_num, vol_name)) > 0)
11050  {
11051  level = (FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL) tmp;
11052  line++;
11053  if ((n != 3) || (level >= FILEIO_BACKUP_UNDEFINED_LEVEL)
11054  /* || (level < FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL) */
11055  || (unit_num < FILEIO_INITIAL_BACKUP_UNITS))
11056  {
11057  fprintf (stdout, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_IO, MSGCAT_FILEIO_BACKUP_VINF_ERROR),
11058  line);
11059  return ER_FAILED;
11060  }
11061 
11062  /* remember this backup volume */
11063  if (fileio_add_volume_to_backup_info (vol_name, level, unit_num, which_bkvinf) != NO_ERROR)
11064  {
11065  return ER_FAILED;
11066  }
11067  }
11068 
11069  return NO_ERROR;
11070 }
11071 
11072 
11073 /*
11074  * fileio_get_backup_info_volume_name () - Return the string of volume name
11075  * return:
11076  * level(in):
11077  * unit_num(in):
11078  * which_bkvinf(in):
11079  */
11080 const char *
11081 fileio_get_backup_info_volume_name (FILEIO_BACKUP_LEVEL level, int unit_num, int which_bkvinf)
11082 {
11083  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY *node_p;
11084  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_QUEUE *data_p;
11085 
11086  data_p = &(fileio_Backup_vol_info_data[which_bkvinf]);
11087  for (node_p = (*data_p).anchors[level]; node_p != NULL; node_p = node_p->link)
11088  {
11089  if (unit_num == node_p->unit_num)
11090  {
11091  return (node_p->bkvol_name);
11092  }
11093  }
11094 
11095  return NULL;
11096 }
11097 
11098 
11099 /*
11100  * fileio_finalize_backup_info () - Clean up and free all resources related to the bkvinf
11101  * cache
11102  * return: void
11103  * which_bkvinf(in):
11104  */
11105 void
11106 fileio_finalize_backup_info (int which_bkvinf)
11107 {
11108  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_QUEUE *data_p;
11109 
11110  data_p = &(fileio_Backup_vol_info_data[which_bkvinf]);
11111  if ((*data_p).initialized)
11112  {
11113  fileio_clear_backup_info_level (FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL, true, which_bkvinf);
11114  (*data_p).initialized = false;
11115  }
11116  return;
11117 }
11118 
11119 /*
11120  * fileio_initialize_backup_info () - Initialize the bkvinf cache and related structures
11121  * return:
11122  * which_bkvinf(in):
11123  *
11124  * Note: Be sure to call bkvinf_final when the backups are complete.
11125  */
11126 static int
11127 fileio_initialize_backup_info (int which_bkvinf)
11128 {
11129  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_QUEUE *data_p;
11130 
11131 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
11132  const char *env_value;
11133  /* This checking is done here so it can be in one location and because this routine is likely to be called before
11134  * backup/restore. */
11135  if (io_Bkuptrace_debug < 0)
11136  {
11137  /* Find out if user wants debugging info during backup/restore. */
11138  env_value = envvar_get ("IO_TRACE_BACKUP");
11139  io_Bkuptrace_debug = (env_value == NULL ? 0 : atoi (env_value));
11140  }
11141 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
11142 
11143  data_p = &(fileio_Backup_vol_info_data[which_bkvinf]);
11144  if (!(*data_p).initialized)
11145  {
11146  (*data_p).free = NULL;
11147  memset ((*data_p).anchors, 0, sizeof ((*data_p).anchors));
11148  (*data_p).initialized = true;
11149  }
11150 
11151  return NO_ERROR;
11152 }
11153 
11154 /*
11155  * fileio_allocate_backup_info () - Allocate a bkvinf_entry
11156  * return: a pointer to the node allocated, or NULL if failure
11157  * which_bkvinf(in):
11158  */
11159 static FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY *
11160 fileio_allocate_backup_info (int which_bkvinf)
11161 {
11162  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY *temp_entry_p;
11163  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_QUEUE *data_p;
11164 
11165  data_p = &(fileio_Backup_vol_info_data[which_bkvinf]);
11166  if (!(*data_p).initialized)
11167  {
11168  return NULL;
11169  }
11170 
11171  /* check free list */
11172  if ((*data_p).free != NULL)
11173  {
11174  temp_entry_p = (*data_p).free;
11175  (*data_p).free = temp_entry_p->link;
11176  temp_entry_p->link = NULL;
11177  }
11178  else
11179  {
11180  /* allocate one */
11181  temp_entry_p = ((FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY *) malloc (sizeof (FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY)));
11182  if (temp_entry_p != NULL)
11183  {
11184  temp_entry_p->link = NULL;
11185  }
11186  else
11187  {
11188  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, sizeof (FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY));
11189  }
11190  }
11191 
11192  return temp_entry_p;
11193 }
11194 
11195 /*
11196  * fileio_clear_backup_info_level () - REMOVES ALL VOLUMES OF A BACKUP LEVEL FROM CACHE
11197  * return:
11198  * level(in): backup level to remove
11199  * dealloc(in): true if the nodes should be freed back to the OS
11200  * which_bkvinf(in):
11201  *
11202  * Note: This routine removes all the nodes for a given level and any levels
11203  * above it. Ordinarily the nodes will be placed on the free list for
11204  * reuse, but if dealloc is true, then the space will be freed.
11205  * Example: IF level 1 is to be cleared, then level 2 is also cleared.
11206  */
11207 int
11208 fileio_clear_backup_info_level (int level, bool is_dealloc, int which_bkvinf)
11209 {
11210  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_ENTRY *next_p;
11211  FILEIO_BACKUP_INFO_QUEUE *data_p;
11212  int i;
11213 
11214  data_p = &(fileio_Backup_vol_info_data[which_bkvinf]);
11215  if (level < 0)
11216  {
11217  level = FILEIO_BACKUP_FULL_LEVEL;
11218  }
11219 
11220  /* Delete from the front */
11221  for (i = FILEIO_BACKUP_UNDEFINED_LEVEL - 1; i >= level; i--)
11222  {
11223  while ((*data_p).anchors[i] != NULL)
11224  {
11225  next_p = (*data_p).anchors[i]->link;
11226  if (is_dealloc)
11227  {
11228  free_and_init ((*data_p).anchors[i]);
11229  }
11230  else
11231  {
11232  /* stick it on the free list */
11233  (*data_p).anchors[i]->link = (*data_p).free;
11234  (*data_p).free = (*data_p).anchors[i];
11235  }
11236  (*data_p).anchors[i] = next_p;
11237  }
11238  }
11239 
11240  /* Free the free list nodes if necessary to avoid leaks */
11241  if (is_dealloc)
11242  {
11243  while ((*data_p).free)
11244  {
11245  next_p = (*data_p).free->link;
11246  free_and_init ((*data_p).free);
11247  (*data_p).free = next_p;
11248  }
11249  }
11250 
11251  return NO_ERROR;
11252 }
11253 
11254 /*
11255  * fileio_request_user_response () - REQUEST A RESPONSE VIA REMOVE CLIENT
11256  * return:
11257  * prompt_id(in):
11258  * prompt(in):
11259  * response(in):
11260  * failure_prompt(in):
11261  * range_low(in):
11262  * range_high(in):
11263  * secondary_prompt(in):
11264  * reprompt_value(in):
11265  */
11266 int
11267 fileio_request_user_response (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_REMOTE_PROMPT_TYPE prompt_id, const char *prompt_p,
11268  char *response_p, const char *failure_prompt_p, int range_low, int range_high,
11269  const char *secondary_prompt_p, int reprompt_value)
11270 {
11271 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
11272  char *remote_data_p = NULL;
11273  char *remote_answer_p = NULL;
11274  int data_size;
11275  int remote_status;
11276  char *ptr;
11277 
11278  /* Send the prompt to the client */
11279  if (xio_send_user_prompt_to_client (thread_p, prompt_id, prompt_p, failure_prompt_p, range_low, range_high,
11280  secondary_prompt_p, reprompt_value) != NO_ERROR)
11281  {
11282  return ER_FAILED;
11283  }
11284 
11285  /* Obtain the user's response from the client, without blocking the server. */
11286  if (xs_receive_data_from_client (thread_p, &remote_data_p, &data_size) != NO_ERROR)
11287  {
11288  if (remote_data_p)
11289  {
11290  free_and_init (remote_data_p);
11291  }
11292 
11293  return ER_FAILED;
11294  }
11295 
11296  ptr = or_unpack_int (remote_data_p, &remote_status);
11297  if (remote_status != NO_ERROR)
11298  {
11299  free_and_init (remote_data_p);
11300  return ER_FAILED;
11301  }
11302  data_size -= OR_INT_SIZE;
11303  if (response_p && data_size > 0)
11304  {
11305  /* Otherwise prompt appears successful */
11306  ptr = or_unpack_string_nocopy (ptr, &remote_answer_p);
11307  if (remote_answer_p != NULL)
11308  {
11309  memcpy (response_p, remote_answer_p, intl_mbs_len (remote_answer_p) + 1);
11310  }
11311  }
11312 
11313  free_and_init (remote_data_p);
11314  return NO_ERROR;
11315 #else /* SERVER_MODE */
11316  extern unsigned int db_on_server;
11317 
11318  char new_vol_name[FILEIO_MAX_USER_RESPONSE_SIZE];
11319  char *user_response_p = new_vol_name;
11320  const char *display_string_p;
11321  char line_buf[PATH_MAX * 2];
11322  int pr_status, pr_len;
11323  int x;
11324  int result = 0;
11325  bool is_retry_in = true;
11326  int rc;
11327  char format_string[32];
11328 
11329  /* we're pretending to jump to the client */
11330  db_on_server = 0;
11331  /* Interestingly enough, this is basically the same code as in the ASYNC_ callback has to do remotely. */
11332  display_string_p = prompt_p;
11333  memset (new_vol_name, 0, sizeof (new_vol_name));
11334 
11335  sprintf (format_string, "%%%ds", FILEIO_MAX_USER_RESPONSE_SIZE - 1);
11336 
11337  while (is_retry_in)
11338  {
11339  /* Display prompt, then get user's input. */
11340  fprintf (stdout, display_string_p);
11341 
11342  pr_status = ER_FAILED;
11343  pr_len = 0;
11344  is_retry_in = false;
11345 
11346  if (prompt_id != FILEIO_PROMPT_DISPLAY_ONLY)
11347  {
11348  rc = -1;
11349  if ((fgets (line_buf, PATH_MAX, stdin) != NULL)
11350  && ((rc = sscanf (line_buf, format_string, user_response_p)) > 0))
11351  {
11352 
11353  /* Attempt basic input int validation before we send it back */
11354  switch (prompt_id)
11355  {
11356  case FILEIO_PROMPT_RANGE_TYPE:
11357  /* Numeric range checking */
11358  result = parse_int (&x, user_response_p, 10);
11359  if (result != 0 || x < range_low || x > range_high)
11360  {
11361  fprintf (stdout, failure_prompt_p);
11362  is_retry_in = true;
11363  }
11364  else
11365  {
11366  pr_status = NO_ERROR;
11367  }
11368  break;
11369 
11370  /* attempt simply boolean (y, yes, 1, n, no, 0) validation */
11371  case FILEIO_PROMPT_BOOLEAN_TYPE:
11372  if (char_tolower (*user_response_p) == 'y' || *user_response_p == '1'
11373  || intl_mbs_casecmp ((const char *) user_response_p, "yes") == 0)
11374  {
11375  pr_status = NO_ERROR;
11376  /* convert all affirmate answers into '1' */
11377  strcpy (user_response_p, "1");
11378  }
11379  else
11380  {
11381  pr_status = NO_ERROR;
11382  /* convert all negative answers into '0' */
11383  strcpy (user_response_p, "0");
11384  }
11385  break;
11386 
11387  /* no validation to do */
11388  case FILEIO_PROMPT_STRING_TYPE:
11389  pr_status = NO_ERROR;
11390  break;
11391 
11392  /* Validate initial prompt, then post secondary prompt */
11393  case FILEIO_PROMPT_RANGE_WITH_SECONDARY_STRING_TYPE:
11394  /* Numeric range checking on the first promp, but user's answer we really want is the second prompt */
11395  result = parse_int (&x, user_response_p, 10);
11396  if (result != 0 || x < range_low || x > range_high)
11397  {
11398  fprintf (stdout, failure_prompt_p);
11399  is_retry_in = true;
11400  }
11401  else if (x == reprompt_value)
11402  {
11403  /* The first answer requires another prompt */
11404  display_string_p = secondary_prompt_p;
11405  is_retry_in = true;
11406  prompt_id = FILEIO_PROMPT_STRING_TYPE;
11407  /* moving the response buffer ptr forward insures that both the first response and the second are
11408  * included in the buffer. (no delimiter or null bytes) */
11409  user_response_p += intl_mbs_len (user_response_p);
11410  }
11411  else
11412  {
11413  /* This answer was sufficient */
11414  pr_status = NO_ERROR;
11415  }
11416 
11417  break;
11418 
11419  default:
11420  /* should we treat this as an error? It is really a protocol error. How do we handle backward
11421  * compatibility for future releases? */
11422  pr_status = NO_ERROR;
11423  }
11424  }
11425  else if (rc == 0)
11426  {
11427  is_retry_in = true;
11428  }
11429  else
11430  {
11431  /* EOF encountered, treat as an error */
11432  return ER_FAILED;
11433  }
11434  }
11435  }
11436 
11437  /* The answer can be returned now. It should be stored in new_vol_name */
11438  /* check for overflow, could be dangerous */
11439  pr_len = intl_mbs_len (new_vol_name);
11440  if (pr_len > FILEIO_MAX_USER_RESPONSE_SIZE)
11441  {
11442  pr_status = ER_FAILED;
11443  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_NET_DATA_TRUNCATED, 0);
11444  }
11445 
11446  /* Copy the answer to the response buffer */
11447  if (response_p)
11448  {
11449  memcpy (response_p, new_vol_name, sizeof (new_vol_name));
11450  }
11451 
11452  db_on_server = 1;
11453  return (pr_status);
11454 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
11455 }
11456 
11457 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
11458 /*
11459  * fileio_symlink () -
11460  * return:
11461  * src(in):
11462  * dest(in):
11463  * overwrite(in):
11464  */
11465 int
11466 fileio_symlink (const char *src_p, const char *dest_p, int overwrite)
11467 {
11468  if (overwrite && fileio_is_volume_exist (dest_p))
11469  {
11470  unlink (dest_p);
11471  }
11472 
11473  if (symlink (src_p, dest_p) == -1)
11474  {
11475  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CANNOT_CREATE_LINK, 2, src_p, dest_p);
11476  return ER_FAILED;
11477  }
11478 
11479  return NO_ERROR;
11480 }
11481 
11482 /*
11483  * fileio_lock_region () -
11484  * return:
11485  * fd(in):
11486  * cmd(in):
11487  * type(in):
11488  * offset(in):
11489  * whence(in):
11490  * len(in):
11491  */
11492 static int
11493 fileio_lock_region (int fd, int cmd, int type, off_t offset, int whence, off_t len)
11494 {
11495  struct flock lock;
11496 
11497  lock.l_type = type; /* F_RDLOCK, F_WRLOCK, F_UNLOCK */
11498  lock.l_start = offset; /* byte offset, relative to l_whence */
11499  lock.l_whence = whence; /* SEEK_SET, SEEK_CUR, SEEK_END */
11500  lock.l_len = len; /* #bytes (O means to EOF) */
11501  return fcntl (fd, cmd, &lock);
11502 }
11503 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
11504 
11505 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
11506 /*
11507  * fileio_os_sysconf () -
11508  * return:
11509  */
11510 int
11511 fileio_os_sysconf (void)
11512 {
11513  long nprocs = -1;
11514 
11515 #if defined(_SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN)
11516  nprocs = sysconf (_SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN);
11517 #elif defined(_SC_NPROC_ONLN)
11518  nprocs = sysconf (_SC_NPROC_ONLN);
11519 #elif defined(_SC_CRAY_NCPU)
11520  nprocs = sysconf (_SC_CRAY_NCPU);
11521 #elif defined(WINDOWS)
11522  {
11523  SYSTEM_INFO sysinfo;
11524  /* determine the base of virtual memory */
11525  GetSystemInfo (&sysinfo);
11526  nprocs = sysinfo.dwNumberOfProcessors;
11527  }
11528 #else /* WINDOWS */
11529  ; /* give up */
11530 #endif /* WINDOWS */
11531  return (nprocs > 1) ? (int) nprocs : 1;
11532 }
11533 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
11534 
11535 /*
11536  * fileio_initialize_res () -
11537  * return:
11538  */
11539 void
11540 fileio_initialize_res (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_PAGE * io_page, PGLENGTH page_size)
11541 {
11542  fileio_init_lsa_of_page (io_page, page_size);
11543  io_page->prv.pageid = -1;
11544  io_page->prv.volid = -1;
11545 
11546  io_page->prv.ptype = '\0';
11547  io_page->prv.pflag_reserve_1 = '\0';
11548  io_page->prv.p_reserve_1 = 0;
11549  io_page->prv.p_reserve_2 = 0;
11550  io_page->prv.p_reserve_3 = 0;
11551 }
11552 
11553 
11554 /*
11555  * PAGE BITMAP FUNCTIONS
11556  */
11557 
11558 /*
11559  * fileio_page_bitmap_list_init - initialize a page bitmap list
11560  * return: void
11561  * page_bitmap_list(in/out): head of the page bitmap list
11562  */
11563 void
11564 fileio_page_bitmap_list_init (FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP_LIST * page_bitmap_list)
11565 {
11566  assert (page_bitmap_list != NULL);
11567  page_bitmap_list->head = NULL;
11568  page_bitmap_list->tail = NULL;
11569 }
11570 
11571 /*
11572  * fileio_page_bitmap_create - create a page bitmap
11573  * return: page bitmap
11574  * vol_id(in): the number of the page bitmap identification
11575  * total_pages(in): the number of total pages
11576  */
11577 FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP *
11578 fileio_page_bitmap_create (int vol_id, int total_pages)
11579 {
11580  FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP *page_bitmap;
11581  int page_bitmap_size;
11582 
11583  page_bitmap = (FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP *) malloc (sizeof (FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP));
11584  if (page_bitmap == NULL)
11585  {
11586  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, sizeof (FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP));
11587  return NULL;
11588  }
11589 
11590  page_bitmap_size = CEIL_PTVDIV (total_pages, 8);
11591 
11592  page_bitmap->next = NULL;
11593  page_bitmap->vol_id = vol_id;
11594  page_bitmap->size = page_bitmap_size;
11595  page_bitmap->bitmap = (unsigned char *) malloc (page_bitmap_size);
11596  if (page_bitmap->bitmap == NULL)
11597  {
11598  free_and_init (page_bitmap);
11599 
11600  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) page_bitmap_size);
11601  return NULL;
11602  }
11603  memset (page_bitmap->bitmap, 0x0, page_bitmap_size);
11604 
11605  return page_bitmap;
11606 }
11607 
11608 /*
11609  * fileio_page_bitmap_list_find - find the page bitmap which is matched
11610  * with vol_id
11611  * return: pointer of the page bitmap or NULL
11612  * page_bitmap_list(in): head of the page bitmap list
11613  * vol_id(in): the number of the page bitmap identification
11614  */
11615 FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP *
11616 fileio_page_bitmap_list_find (FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP_LIST * page_bitmap_list, int vol_id)
11617 {
11618  FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP *page_bitmap;
11619 
11620  if (page_bitmap_list->head == NULL)
11621  {
11622  return NULL;
11623  }
11624 
11625  assert (page_bitmap_list->tail != NULL);
11626 
11627  page_bitmap = page_bitmap_list->head;
11628 
11629  while (page_bitmap != NULL)
11630  {
11631  if (page_bitmap->vol_id == vol_id)
11632  {
11633  return page_bitmap;
11634  }
11635  page_bitmap = page_bitmap->next;
11636  }
11637 
11638  return NULL;
11639 }
11640 
11641 /*
11642  * fileio_page_bitmap_list_add - add a page bitmap to a page bitmap list
11643  * page_bitmap_list(in/out): head of the page bitmap list
11644  * page_bitmap(in): pointer of the page bitmap
11645  */
11646 void
11647 fileio_page_bitmap_list_add (FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP_LIST * page_bitmap_list,
11648  FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP * page_bitmap)
11649 {
11650 #if !defined(NDEBUG)
11651  FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP *bitmap;
11652 #endif
11653 
11654  assert (page_bitmap_list != NULL);
11655  assert (page_bitmap != NULL);
11656 
11657 #if !defined(NDEBUG)
11658  /* Check the uniqueness of vol_id */
11659  bitmap = page_bitmap_list->head;
11660  while (bitmap != NULL)
11661  {
11662  assert (bitmap->vol_id != page_bitmap->vol_id);
11663  bitmap = bitmap->next;
11664  }
11665 #endif
11666 
11667  if (page_bitmap_list->head == NULL)
11668  {
11669  assert (page_bitmap_list->tail == NULL);
11670 
11671  page_bitmap_list->head = page_bitmap;
11672  page_bitmap_list->tail = page_bitmap;
11673  }
11674  else
11675  {
11676  assert (page_bitmap_list->tail != NULL);
11677 
11678  page_bitmap_list->tail->next = page_bitmap;
11679  page_bitmap_list->tail = page_bitmap;
11680  }
11681 }
11682 
11683 /*
11684  * fileio_page_bitmap_list_destroy - destroy a page bitmap list
11685  * return: void
11686  * page_bitmap_list(in/out): head of the page bitmap list
11687  */
11688 void
11689 fileio_page_bitmap_list_destroy (FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP_LIST * page_bitmap_list)
11690 {
11691  FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP *page_bitmap = NULL;
11692  FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP *page_bitmap_next = NULL;
11693 
11694  assert (page_bitmap_list != NULL);
11695 
11696  page_bitmap = page_bitmap_list->head;
11697 
11698  while (page_bitmap != NULL)
11699  {
11700  page_bitmap_next = page_bitmap->next;
11701 
11702  page_bitmap->vol_id = 0;
11703  page_bitmap->size = 0;
11704  free_and_init (page_bitmap->bitmap);
11705  free_and_init (page_bitmap);
11706 
11707  page_bitmap = page_bitmap_next;
11708  }
11709  page_bitmap_list->head = NULL;
11710  page_bitmap_list->tail = NULL;
11711 }
11712 
11713 /*
11714  * fileio_page_bitmap_set - set the bit that represents the exitence of the page
11715  * return: void
11716  * page_bitmap(in): pointer of the page bitmap
11717  * page_id(in): position of the page
11718  */
11719 static void
11720 fileio_page_bitmap_set (FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP * page_bitmap, int page_id)
11721 {
11722  assert (page_bitmap != NULL);
11723  assert ((page_bitmap->size - 1) >= (page_id / 8));
11724 
11725  page_bitmap->bitmap[page_id / 8] |= 1 << (page_id % 8);
11726 }
11727 
11728 /*
11729  * fileio_page_bitmap_is_set - get the bit that represents the exitence of the page
11730  * return: if the bit of page is set then it returns true.
11731  * page_bitmap(in): pointer of the page bitmap
11732  * page_id(in): position of the page
11733  */
11734 static bool
11735 fileio_page_bitmap_is_set (FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP * page_bitmap, int page_id)
11736 {
11737  bool is_set;
11738 
11739  assert (page_bitmap != NULL);
11740  assert ((page_bitmap->size - 1) >= (page_id / 8));
11741 
11742  is_set = page_bitmap->bitmap[page_id / 8] & (1 << (page_id % 8)) ? true : false;
11743 
11744  return is_set;
11745 }
11746 
11747 /*
11748  * fileio_page_bitmap_dump - dump a page bitmap
11749  * return: void
11750  * out_fp(in): FILE stream where to dump; if NULL, stdout
11751  * page_bitmap(in): pointer of the page bitmap
11752  */
11753 static void
11754 fileio_page_bitmap_dump (FILE * out_fp, const FILEIO_RESTORE_PAGE_BITMAP * page_bitmap)
11755 {
11756  int i;
11757 
11758  assert (page_bitmap != NULL);
11759 
11760  if (out_fp == NULL)
11761  {
11762  out_fp = stdout;
11763  }
11764 
11765  fprintf (out_fp, "BITMAP_ID = %d, BITMAP_SIZE = %d\n", page_bitmap->vol_id, page_bitmap->size);
11766 
11767  for (i = 0; i < page_bitmap->size; i++)
11768  {
11769  if ((i % 32) == 0)
11770  {
11771  fprintf (out_fp, "%#08X: ", i);
11772  }
11773  else
11774  {
11775  fprintf (out_fp, "%02X ", page_bitmap->bitmap[i]);
11776  }
11777 
11778  if ((i % 32) == 31)
11779  {
11780  fprintf (out_fp, "\n");
11781  }
11782  }
11783  fprintf (out_fp, "\n");
11784 }
11785 
11786 /*
11787  * fileio_page_check_corruption - Check whether the page is corrupted.
11788  * return: error code
11789  * thread_p (in): thread entry
11790  * io_page (in): the page
11791  * is_page_corrupted (out): true, if the page is corrupted.
11792  */
11793 int
11794 fileio_page_check_corruption (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILEIO_PAGE * io_page, bool * is_page_corrupted)
11795 {
11796  assert (io_page != NULL && is_page_corrupted != NULL);
11797 
11798  *is_page_corrupted = !fileio_is_page_sane (io_page, IO_PAGESIZE);
11799 
11800  return NO_ERROR;
11801 }
